story:
Patrick Toucas-Terzian donne vie à un univers graphique riche et puissant

Aujourd'hui cette œuvre novatrice élaborée depuis quarante ans, courageuse et bouillonnante, est entreposée dans un garage faute de financement suffisant.

Artiste visionnaire mais pas businessman , Patrick Toucas-Terzian a déjà exposé en France, en Arménie et au Canada.

Associons-nous pour passer au niveau supérieur !

Trop de grands artistes ont été connus tard 

Choisissez de faire la différence, en contribuant à hauteur de vos moyens et en relayant cet appel sur les réseaux sociaux.

Soutenez ce projet parce qu'il vous touche, parce que ces peintures sont uniques, parce qu'elles acquièrent de la valeur.

 

En route vers la lumière !

Etape 1  (si les 5000 euros sont réunis) : un site web de qualité pour remplacer le site familial obsolète et un ouvrage d'art professionnel.


Etape 2  (si la mise est doublée) : tournée de promotion du peintre et d’un agent auprès de musées et de galeries dans 5 villes de France (Paris, Marseille, Lyon, Bordeaux, Lille)


Etape 3 (aux optimistes la chance sourit !) : tournée de promotion à l'étranger du peintre et d’un agent (Etats-Unis, Canada et Arménie).

L'aventure se poursuivra, nous le souhaitons, avec un lieu d'exposition permanent.

Les œuvres de Patrick Toucas-Terzian prendront de la valeur à mesure que l'artiste gagnera en visibilité  !

story:
Our 30-foot American Bison is coming back to roam the playa at Burning Man 2019, but first it needs some love...

Starting in 2015, a group of friends got together to bring a ridiculous idea to life. We wanted to create an audio-visual experience for the playa and beyond that sparks conversation about the American bison's complicated past, present, and future.

Three years in, and countless hours and sore muscles later, we've accomplished a lot. Kindred Spirit is visually stunning, with a brown fur base meant to mimic the real animal by day and a custom geometric color-changing LED overlay that glows by night. Our sound-stage hosts artist, live musician, and DJ performances, and features an upper deck to dance and lounge on! Our art car provides a lens through which we can explore the majestic mammal that's an intrinsic part of our collective history.

This is in no small part thanks to your generous contributions from 2016 and 2017. Thank you!

So, our mutant bison is sitting on a ranch...

...and it won't start.

Since 2015, Kindred Spirit has called New York, New Jersey, Oregon, and California "home." In 2018, KS made a voyage to its new permanent home in Nevada. The trip was a little bumpy to say the least.

Our truck broke down on the highway, and we had to get it towed the rest of the way. Thankfully this didn't happen far from our final destination so the cost was not exorbitant. Upon arrival, a mechanic took a look under the hood and revealed several issues that need to be addressed before Kindred Spirit can safely get back on the road (or, for that matter, even start again). We need your help to fund this work and to get ready for another amazing season!

Here's where your contributions will go...

There are two areas where your contributions will directly help us cross the finish line and deliver our gift to the playa..

Vehicle Maintenance - Kindred Spirit's may need a total overhaul under the hood. At a minimum, it looks like we'll need to replace the fuel injectors, fuel injector harness, and several other components. It's possible we'll need to replace the entire engine. We may also need to install new batteries & cabling, and get an oil change. Parts and labor all taken into account, we expect this to cost between $2,000-$3,000.

Transportation to and from the playa - It takes a ton of planning and resources to get KS safely to Burning Man and back to home base. Your contributions will help offset those costs, estimated to come in between $1,000-$1,500.

Kindred Spirit's Impact...

We hope our time on the playa puts smiles on your faces and that we'll watch the sunrise on our upper deck together while jamming to some awesome music. In the future, our goal is to become a stage for historians, environmentalists, conservationists, and other groups and organizations who are passionate about the bison and seek to spread knowledge and awareness. Of course, we'll also be organizing music-focused get-togethers so we can dance and make new memories outside of Black Rock City.

The Kindred Spirit Team

Our team is a diverse bunch from both coasts, with a healthy blend of Burning Man veterans and virgins filling the ranks. We're a crew of builders, artists, programmers, DJ's, musicians, photographers, and entrepreneurs. We all bring different skills, passions, and areas of expertise to the table, and we're all committed to seeing Kindred Spirit shine.

The road to Burning Man begins now...

Kindred Spirit is our gift to the Burning Man community. If you've enjoyed the bison on or off playa, please consider a contribution to help us get it back on the road! We want to get the ball rolling on repairs early in the year so we can hit the ground running on building new art this spring and summer.

You can always help us by spreading the word about the car and sharing this campaign among your friends! For more information please check out our Facebook page, and follow us on Instagram!

Stay tuned for more updates from the Kindred Spirit crew as the Burn gets closer!

<3 THANK YOU AND SEE YOU IN THE DUST! <3

My name is Orn. I'm (wannabe) an illustrator. Live in Chicago. (www.ornumap.com)
I'm also a full-time mom. It doesn't mean I stay home and doing nothing.

I'm doing my best to raising my son. Mexicasian! (Mexican + Thai)
I work here and there on the drawing commission and sell prints online.

My most popular item is the portrait drawing.

story:
(English below)

Krátké shrnutí

Letní hudební festivaly v České republice jsou nutností, pokud chcete žít hlubší kulturní zážitek v srdci Evropy. Tyto festivaly jsou prostory, kde si mladí lidé užívají alternativní kapely z celé ČR a vyjadřují se v prostředí „svobody“.

Festival Deziluze 2020

Deziluze je neziskový festival vytvořený před 7 lety skupinou mladých sociálních aktivistů, kterou vede Mariannka Cimburová. Byl tak vytvořen  prostor pro propagaci nových umělců na české scéně ve spojení amatérských kapel, divadel, spisovatelů a básníků, filmařů, fotografů, akrobatů, sportovců a tanečníků.

 

Mariannka Cimburová, Spoluakladatelka festivalu Deziluze

https://www.facebook.com/marianna.cimburova

Pro 2020 bylo rozhodnuto oživit pivovar „Herold“ v Březnici. Dochází tak k přizpůsobení tohoto místa pro instalace umělců, koncertů, divadla, blešího trhu a dalších aktivit! Kombinace barokního pivovaru, kultury, kreativity a veselí nezbytně upoutá smysly návštěvníků.

Spolu s českým inovačním mechanismem myELEN.com hledá Deziluze podporu pro umělce a organizační tým. Shromážděné dary budou použity na nákup materiálů, které umělci použijí pro své instalace a na scénografii prostoru.

Cílem je podpořit talent těchto nových umělců jako způsob zhodnocení jejich práce.

Jaké jsou cíle?

Udržet naživu projekt, který podporuje práci mladých umělců a pomáhá jim při rozvoji jejich talentu.

Nápoje zdarma!

Čili habanero shot!!

Vstup ZDARMA na festival!
 

Pořadatelé Deziluze poskytnou s vašimi dary, materiály potřebné k instalaci inovativních výstav, jako jsou instalatérské umění, techno chrám, obrazy a další

Benefity spojené s dary jsou:

50 Kč = doplňkový nápoj

100 Kč = Chilli habanero

200 Kč = vstup ZDARMA

 

Dopad

Žijeme ve světě, kde je kultura podceňována. 

Svým darem podpoříte talent nové generace umělců v České republice. Přispějete tak k rozvoji kultury.

Prožijete obohacující alternativní zážitek na festivalu Deziluze

Přispějte k rozvoji města Březnice, které bude mít vyšší návštěvnost, což znamená ekonomické a sociální dopady na město.

 

Umělci

Alisa Okisheva


 

https://www.instagram.com/eroticorn/

Alžběta Rajchlová

https://www.instagram.com/alzbeta.rajchlova/

 

Anna Nevrlá

https://www.instagram.com/ani_ne_grafika/
 

Cesar Isaac

https://www.facebook.com/cesar.isaac.9

 

Henry Lacina

https://www.instagram.com/henrylacina/

Kateřina Lotty



https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=1000139...

Luisa Lacinová


 

https://www.facebook.com/luisa.lacinova.79

Nela Neubauerová


 

https://www.facebook.com/nelala2

Rizika & Výzvy

Hlavní riziko pro tento festival se týká viru COVID-19. V případě, že by bylo zjištěno riziko šíření nákazy, nebo pokud by byla v České republice k datu události, 26. – 27. Června 2020, stanovena nová omezení pro venkovní akce v České republice.

Nízká účast na festivalu, což znamená menší příjem ze vstupu a příjem z prodeje jídla / pití a nedostatek prostředků potřebných k platbě za služby (jeviště, zvuk, doprava, hudebníci).

 

Dodatečné informace 

Nezisková organizace Bez iluze Deziluze z.s.  organizuje v uplynulých letech festival kombinovaným financováním od veřejných a soukromých dárců a vlastním provozováním stánků s potravinami a nápoji. K financování přispívá i tzv. Deziluzní blešák, kterým organizátoři zároveň upozorňují na problém nadměrné konzumace zboží a podporuje tak recyklaci.

Rozpočet se řeší s co nejnižšími náklady, organizační tým a umělci pracují jako dobrovolníci, kapely (až na pár výjimek) hrají za „cestovné“. Rozpočet je tak použit zejména na služby dopravy, pódia, úpravy pivovaru, instalace toalet / sprch / stanů atd.

Pro náš letošní event se přizpůsobují nevyužité budovy pivovaru Herold a bez finanční odměny se odváží tuny odpadu, stejně tak se zajišťuje bezpečnost v budovách. Náš festival vdechuje budovám nový život. 

Doufáme, že Deziluze bude moct využít pivovar k dalším událostem v budoucnu.

Festival FB fan page: https://www.facebook.com/festivaldeziluze/

FB event: https://www.facebook.com/events/2616054565117137/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/festival.deziluze/

Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCx2NhwUn99PkCu

_____________________________________________________________________________________

(English version)

Short Summary

Summer music festivals in the Czech Republic are a ‘must to do' if you want to live a deeper cultural experience in the heart of Europe. These festivals are spaces where youths enjoy the music of local artists and express themselves in an environment of ‘freedom’.

Festival Deziluze 2020

Deziluze is a non-profit festival created 7 years ago by a group of young social activists, led by Mariannka Cimburová. Who had the illusion to create a space for the promotion of new artists in the Czech stage. Bringing together amateur bands, theaters, writers and poets, filmmakers, photographers, acrobats, athletes, and dancers. 

 

Mariannka Cimburová, Deziluze festival founder

https://www.facebook.com/marianna.cimburova

For the 2020 version, they decided to bring back to life an abandoned brewery of ‘pivovar Herold’ in Březnice. Renovating and adapting this place for the installation of artists, theater, a flea market, and more! The mix of a baroque abandoned brewery, culture, creativity, and festivity will mesmerize your senses.

Together with the Czech innovator, myELEN.com, Deziluze is proposing this crowdfunding effort for the support of the artists. The donations collected will be used for the purchase of materials that the artists will use for their installations. 

The goal is to support the talent of these new artists, as a way to valorize their work.

What are the benefits?

Firstly to keep alive a project that is supporting the work of young artists, helping them in the development of their talents.

FREE entrance to the festival!

Complimentary drinks!!

Get to know these artists community!!!

 

With your donations, the Deziluze organizers will provide the materials needed for the installation of the Art Exposition. Contributing to the creation of innovative expressions, such as plumbing art, techno temple, paintings, and more...

Going to the chase, the proposal for the donations is:

50 CZK = complimentary drink

100 CZK = Chili habanero shot

200 CZK = FREE entrance to the festival

 

The Impact

We live in a world where Culture is undervalued. Artists often struggle to make a living from their creations. While culture is what makes 

>>>With your donation, you will be encouraging the talent of the new generation of artists in the Czech Republic. Thus, contributing to the development of culture. 

>>>You will compensate artists for their innovative creations. To make them feel support to their talent. They are preparing the Art Exposition voluntarily.

>>>Live an enriching alternative experience at the Deziluze festival

>>>Contribute to the development of the town Březnice, that will have higher visitors, meaning Economic and Social impact for the town.

 

The Artists

Here are the artists that will present their work in the Art Exposition, the creative minds behind the surreal scene you will experience at Deziluze

Alisa Okisheva



https://www.instagram.com/eroticorn/

Alžběta Rajchlová

https://www.instagram.com/alzbeta.rajchlova/

Anna Nevrlá

https://www.instagram.com/ani_ne_grafika/

Cesar Isaac

https://www.facebook.com/cesar.isaac.9

Henry Lacina

https://www.instagram.com/henrylacina/

Kateřina Lotty

https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=1000139...
 

Luisa Lacinová


 

https://www.facebook.com/luisa.lacinova.79

Nela Neubauerová

https://www.facebook.com/nelala2

Risks & Challenges

The main risk for this festival would be related to the novel virus, COVID-19. In case there would be detected risk of spreading of the disease (overcrowded event), or if new restrictions would be proclaimed for open-air events in the Czech Republic at the dates of the event, 26-27 June of 2020.  

On the contrary, the low attendance to the festival, meaning less income from the entrance, second-hand shop, and food/drinks. Funds required to pay for the services (stage, sound, transportation, musicians).

 

Additional Information

The non-profit organization Bez iluze Deziluze z.s. has done the festival through the past years with the combined funding from public and private donors, plus own managed stands of food, drinks, and a second-hand market. The ‘second hand’ market is drawing as well the attention to the problem of consumption and recycling of clothes. 

Distributing the budget with the lowest cost possible, for instance, the organizing team and artists work as volunteers, the bands (with few exceptions) play as ‘traveler’. Leaving the budget for the services of transport, stage, adaptation of the brewery, installation of toilets/showers/tents, etc. 

For the 2020 version of Deziluze, the team is adapting the unused buildings of the Herold brewery. Exporting tons of rubbish and waste without a financial reward. Ensuring security in the buildings as well, so that events can take place in a safe environment. Giving buildings new life. 

Hoping that the building can be used by Deziluze to make other events in the future, they will give a new life to Březnice.

Festival FB fan page: https://www.facebook.com/festivaldeziluze/

FB event: https://www.facebook.com/events/2616054565117137/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/festival.deziluze/

Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCx2NhwUn99PkCu...

story:
ABOUT the Hanoman Art Studio

Hi! I am Iwan, the current and dedicated steward of Hanoman Art Studio (HAS) in Ubud, Bali. Hanoman art studio is a beautiful and historical art space in the heart of Ubud, Bali, Indonesia. Run by me since 1980, Hanoman Art Studio is a community space for painters,musicians, art performances and research artists. 

I am asking for your support so Hanoman Art Studio can serve artists, movers of all levels, and audiences for years to come.                 

++++ I NEED YOU ++++

The Art Studio needs your help - The studio has been in use for almost 20 (!) years and now the landlord wants to renovate the building and increase the rental price.

I would like to continue with this art space and for this I need your help to pay the rent for the first year.

What's more, if we reach our fundraising goals, we can bring back our beloved Art Space after renovations in Summer 2016.

Art Studio gives a space to artists to use however they choose, for tourists and residents, and is the meeting point for all of them in Ubud.

Former Residents include Iwan, Agus, Joe, and so many others. It's an incredible space and we want it to keep it open! 

SMALL PAINTINGS: Canvas with acrylic paint without frame.

SIZE: 30 x 30 cm


MEDIUM PAINTING: Canvas with acrylic paint with out frame.
SIZE : 40 x 50 cm

LARGE PAINTING: Canvas with acrylic pint without frame.

SIZE : 120 x 100 cm


COFFEE: Kopi Luwak or civet coffee, refers to the coffee that includes part-digested coffee cherries eaten and defecated by the Asian palm civet.This coffee is well- known as the best coffee in the world. 

50gr of Luwak coffee from Kintamani mountain in Bali.

TOTE Bags hand painting (this is an example)



POSTCARD 


                                            

BUDGET
This is our bare to keep Hanoman Art Space alive: 

6.000 $   rent, to keep Hanoman Art Space open for 1 year 

3.500 $   materials for the painters, visitors and locals.

800 $      Electricity

200 $      Water

890 $    Local fees

1.500 $   Wall paint / Renovations


The time to support is now! Please share the love with Hanoman Art Space and keep the longest running art space in the city alive and thriving. Help us to keep open this amazing space!

OTHER Ways You Can Help

Can’t contribute but love our work? Please share this campaign with your people and networks. It’s easy: just use the tools provided by Indiegogo.  

WE THANK YOU SO MUCH!

Yours,

Iwan

story:
Qui Suis-je ?

Je m'appele Sam,  ingénieur en Robotique , étant petit je vivais dans un milieu ou les ordinateurs étaient destinés aux personnes aisés , j'avais une soif intense de connaissances en science mais les livres étaient assez rare et chère pour satisfaire ma curiosité  .

Etant étudiant j'avais constaté que malgré à la période des TIC ou nous sommes , beaucoup d'étudiant n'avait pas à leur disposition un outil de travail informatique pour leur recherches , devoirs de maisons , pour faire leur travail de mémoire ou leur présentation Power point .

Ayant constaté ce problème avec mon équipe nous avons developpé SMARTBAG , qui est à moindre coût , facile d'utilisation et se connectant aisement sur le Net avec un système d'exploitation basé sous Linux (Débian et Ubuntu) .

Objectif

Nous recherchons un financement de 10.000$ ce qui nous permettrait de finaliser le perfectionnement des Machines et d'accroître rapidemeny la production des SmartBags , en payant des machines comme les imprimantes 3D pour facilter la production et enfin embaucher beaucoup plus de personnes dans notre entreprise .

N'improte quel contribution de votre part(encouragement ou financement) sera le bienvenu .

Si nous n'atteignons pas notre objectif apres le délais prévu , le montant obtenu servirait uniquement au perfectionnement du Smartbag  et à la recherche .

 L'impact

SmartBag est le premier Sac connecté , meme Steve Jobs ou Samsung n'ont jamais pensé à ce concept si innovant !

Ce projet est destiné à tout le monde sans exeption et changerait notre facon d'interagir avec le monde virtuel .

En le dotant de l'énergie solaire il fonctionne presque grâce à de l'énergie libre et infine , ce qui le rend écologique et est accessible à toutes les couches sociales et ergonomique .

SmartBag est le fruit de 5 ans de dur labeur et de recherches en Informatique et électronique et la produit de toutes mes connaissances en Intelligence Artificel .

En partageant ce projet entre vos ami(e)s , vos parents , vos frères , soeurs , votre bien aimé etc... sachez que vous participez à la transformation et à l'Amélioration de conditions de vies éducatives de plusieurs personnes en Afrique et dans le monde .

Vous êtes comme une petite roue dans une montre , sans votre contibution , c'est tout le système d'horlge qui sera en défaillance .

Conclusion

Nous sommes conscients des obstacles majeurs et mineurs que nous ferons fâce dans la concrétisation de ce projet , mais nous sommes aussi convaincu que tous obstacles constituent des preuves ultime que nous sommes sur la bonne voie et le fait que vous êtes sur ces dernieres lignes en nous conssacrant votre temps à la lecture prouve que vous êtes des étoiles determinés a changer le monde .

Etant étudiant j'avais constaté que malgré à la période des TIC ou nous sommes , beaucoup d'étudiant n'avait pas à leur disposition un outil de travail informatique pour leur recherches , devoirs de maisons , pour faire leur travail de mémoire ou leur présentation Power point .
Ayant constaté ce problème avec mon équipe nous avons developpé SMARTBAG , qui est à moindre coût , facile d'utilisation et se connectant aisement sur le Net avec un système d'exploitation basé sous Linux (Débian et Ubuntu) .
Objectif
Nous recherchons un financement de 10.000$ ce qui nous permettrait de finaliser le perfectionnement des Machines et d'accroître rapidemeny la production des SmartBags , en payant des machines comme les imprimantes 3D pour facilter la production et enfin embaucher beaucoup plus de personnes dans notre entreprise .
N'improte quel contribution de votre part(encouragement ou financement) sera le bienvenu .
Si nous n'atteignons pas notre objectif apres le délais prévu , le montant obtenu servirait uniquement au perfectionnement du Smartbag  et à la recherche .


 L'impact

SmartBag est le premier Sac connecté , meme Steve Jobs ou Samsung n'ont jamais pensé à ce concept si innovant !
Ce projet est destiné à tout le monde sans exeption et changerait notre facon d'interagir avec le monde virtuel .
En le dotant de l'énergie solaire il fonctionne presque grâce à de l'énergie libre et infine , ce qui le rend écologique et est accessible à toutes les couches sociales et ergonomique .
SmartBag est le fruit de 5 ans de dur labeur et de recherches en Informatique et électronique et la produit de toutes mes connaissances en Intelligence Artificel .
En partageant ce projet entre vos ami(e)s , vos parents , vos frères , soeurs , votre bien aimé etc... sachez que vous participez à la transformation et à l'Amélioration de conditions de vies éducatives de plusieurs personnes en Afrique et dans le monde .
Vous êtes comme une petite roue dans une montre , sans votre contibution , c'est tout le système d'horlge qui sera en défaillance .
Conclusion
Nous sommes conscients des obstacles majeurs et mineurs que nous ferons fâce dans la concrétisation de ce projet , mais nous sommes aussi convaincu que tous obstacles constituent des preuves ultime que nous sommes sur la bonne voie et le fait que vous êtes sur ces dernieres lignes en nous conssacrant votre temps à la lecture prouve que vous êtes des étoiles determinés a changer le monde .

story:
Our Space

 Museum of Creative Human Art (MOCHA), a brick and mortar shared work space for artists to commune and create, bringing together a community of like-minded individuals in an effort to collaborate and inspire one another.

Location: 15430 Waterloo Rd. Cleveland, OH.

In the Waterloo Arts District 

Our mission: to provide affordable and suitable workspace, equipment, and host a community of artist in North-eastern Ohio. 

We are committed to creating the ideal location and atmosphere for members of MOCHA Cleveland. Helping to develop and build a healthy network of established and emerging artists.

-That's why we need your help!

We are asking for your generous donations to ensure that our members have a quality location  for creative inspiration. The more money raised will help us in providing our members with quality equipment, tools and supportive services.

"MOCHA is a place where the creator can build confidence, network, collaborate, develop skill, relax and have fun- its a recreation center for the creative mind". -Campy II

Take a look inside of MOCHA

Some of the unique amenities MOCHA Members will enjoy:

  • Free Wifi
  • 24 Hour access
  • Private Meeting Space
  • Special/Private Event Space  
  • Printing, Copying, Fax, Scan
  • Concierge Service
  • Kitchenette  
  • Clean atmosphere

Help us reach our $15,000  goal with your donations

 Construction begin soon. Below, we have provided a few raw images of the 3,500 sq ft space

Now it's time to fill it up! 

Listed below are a handful of things needed for the space.

 "The breakdown"

  • Computers - $4000
  • Shop Chairs - $5000
  • Art Tables - $2000
  • Art supplies - $1,500
  • Easels - $1,500
  • Design software - $1,000

Your contribution will impact lives!

Museum of Creative Human Art was designed with the current and next generation of creatives in mind, fulfilling a need in a undervalued market.

Unfortunately, art has been taken out of most school curriculum, due to lack of funding, especially in the poverty stricken urban districts. "Cultural experiences and opportunities are being closed off to youngsters, especially those from poor backgrounds, the Warwick University report said". -BBC news

Research says:

"Since 2010, the number of arts teachers in schools had fallen by up to 11%". -BBC news/ Warwick University report.

Where will our next artists and creatives come from? Who will teach them the fundamentals of their desired discipline and inspire them to be great?

MOCHA is offering an alternative, something new and innovative to our underprivileged youth and community. Classes and apprenticeship opportunities will be offered, along with after-school and summer programs, facilitated by local freelance artists and professionals.

Your contribution will support and develop the next architect, design engineer, shoe designer, software designer, comic developer, and/or famous artist.

About the Owners:

MOCHA was developed by two African-American men who have committed themselves to helping the next generation find and cultivate their passion by providing a valuable resource.

Antwoine Washington, Co-owner.  A visual artist who loves drawing and painting. Since his years as a youth he created art, and later went on to earn a bachelors degree in Fine Arts from Southern University A&M College. As a fine artist, he hopes to share his knowledge, skills and expertise with young creatives who aspire to become the next generation of artist. 

 

M. Campy Russell II, Co-owner. Graduate of Cleveland State University with a degree in Communications and Public Relations. For over 10 years served as a mentor in Cleveland where he impacted the lives of "at-risk" youth, being honored in the Who’s Who of Cleveland for his  impact in the community for two consecutive years. He hopes to continue to provide resources that will support the dreams of our youth while encouraging community engagement.

story:
Story

Shards, are nothing but fragments of the broken.

Tales of the broken home

Pieces and fragments float together, roaming the empty space into oblivion as they have lose their purpose of what was once whole. 

 

 

Broken Cores

Introducing new custom faces to go along with the theme. Royalties each have a core protecting their own gemstone of spades, hearts, clubs and diamonds after being separated with their equal counterparts. 

Sample of artwork showing a royal flush in spades:

 

Sample of artwork showing Queens:

Sample of artwork showing Jacks:

Sample of artwork showing 10s:

Sample of artwork showing 5s:

Sample of artwork showing the two jokers:

 

How are the shards protected? 

Sample of artwork for tuck-box:

About the deck

Contains 56 Cards. Printed on classic bicycle high quality playing card stock with air-cushion finish. 

Risks & Challenges

All or nothing (Fixed Goal)- If we achieve our goal, rest assure that orders will be fulfilled as soon as possible. If not, you'll have your money refunded by indiegogo. 

As this is our first Indiegogo project, there can be unforeseeable challenges that we have yet to encounter which might affect the delivery time. Estimation of delivery can be faster or slower than the stated estimation. 

As we have already obtained the approval from Bicycle® to use their logo on this deck, backers can rest assure and trust that Bicycle® will deliver a promising quality as they always have. 

Shipping (Updated)

Shipping is NOT free. The United States Playing Card Company does not provide fulfillment services. Therefore, we have to post every single orders ourselves.

For shipping, we have chosen Flexipack International by POS Malaysia. 

*Failure to provide accurate information for delivery will be on the expense of the backer.

*Estimated delivery time will range from 6-11 working days after we start to post your order. 

Ineligible country for shipping: Israel

Freebies for backers

As startup is always difficult, we rely heavily on backers to fulfill our initial goal. Everyone who participate in our first project who get at least a deck is entitled to receive a free item (Surprise gift) during our second campaign.

*Bicycle® Shards has to be fully funded

*Shipping not Included 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help spread the word if you would like to help by clicking the share button!

Follow us on Instagram!

@aerialplayingcards 

Comments/Suggestions 

Comments and suggestions are highly welcome! Feel free to contact us or drop a comment in the comment section if there is anything that is unclear to you or if you wish to provide any sort of suggestions.

story:
Short Summary 

My Name is Eric Ross, A.K.A Eric The Artist  I am trying to fund an African American Art Gallery here in Las Vegas. The funding I am requesting is to help me with the rental costs and also art supplies  

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to fund the gallery just for a few months until I am established. Studio rental costs here vary anywhere from $500 to 1,400 per month  I am trying to raise $3,000 to start everything. Contributors will receive prints of my artwork and  free invitations to the art shows here in Vegas which are gaining in popularity. 

The Impact

As a new resident of Las Vegas as of a year ago, I saw the need for an art gallery that showcases the African American experience here in the United States.Your contribution will be extremely helpful in making my goal a reality. Art is my way of expression, I would like to illustrate that for the world to see, with your help.  

Risks & Challenges

‘Starting a new business or a personal project is always risky and can be scary and difficult. However, one must take risks in order to succeed. I am embracing this challenge that I think is worthwhile . Together we can make this vision a reality! 

Other Ways You Can Help

‘For those unable to contribute financially, you can still help by forwarding the links of my campaign to others and putting a good word in for me. Any contribution will be much appreciated. Thank you.    Eric Ross. A.K.A. Eric The Artist.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Radoslav, but you may call me Rade or Rasha.

I'm an artist... no, I'm an office worker...  well,  both are true.

For the last 20 years or so, I've been practicing various forms of art. Mostly visual arts, performances, objects and installations, but not limited to that. During the period, I published more than 12 e_books in my native language and English, fiction prose and poetry. I've been creating a lot of web content, humorous mostly, for my friends worldwide.

Also, for the last 20 years or so, I've been an office worker. First at different positions and, after graduating as a Bachelor with honors in Economy, ten years as the Chief accountant in public elementary school. This was needed, since art pays next to nothing.

 

Unfortunately, even though Economy pays better, it takes a lot of my time and energy. It was almost impossible for me to engage in art as much as I needed, in fact, it almost drove me to stop creating art altogether. So I've put my education to good use, taking myself as a subject, and found a way to combine work with pleasure. With this campaign, I'm trying to raise enough money to buy equipment, machines and materials needed to form a small family art shop, dedicated to creation of unique designs, furniture, jewelry and pretty much anything that can be considered artistic. Did I mention I'm a member of Art society of my country? Well, if you decide to look me up, a good point to start is to use "Radoslav B. Chugaly" in your preferred search engine, I promise it will not be boring or hard.

I have no larger goal in my life than this, to be free to create and share ideas, objects and practices with others. 

What I Need & What You Get

What I do need is fairly simple and straightforward. I've done my homework, as I mentioned, collecting info about my potential market and resources - there is a definite space for my small business, specially since it offers unique outcomes.

I've checked the prices of machines and resources I need, took in consideration the amount of tax I will probably have to pay for the money received through this campaign and came up with the rounded figure of 10.000 US$. Of course, if I don't reach that amount, I'll still be able to start this art shop, only in smaller size and a little bit more time will be needed to reach the final stage. No matter, I'm not quitting with this idea, this shop will exist in real world as it now exists in my imagination.

For the backers (that's you, of course) I've prepared creative and interesting perks. Most of them rely on my artistic skills and talents, but there are also a few surprises in store. All the perks will be personalized, all of them handmade, and I promise they will be unique.

The Impact

Focus of my future work will be on wood. Salvaged wood, re-purposed wood and new one. There are designs already prepared for the table lamps, coffee tables and serving trays. Some of the objects will use epoxy resin, but also other materials. What I wish to emphasize here is that the plan is to use as much recycling and re-purposing as possible, especially with such a precious commodity as wood is. Also, my design plans include the idea of not using metal screws or bolts combined with wood, while maintaining the proposed furniture available for some easy assembly by the buyer - I wish people to take part in creative act, it gives more pleasure to a person. 

This way, except making artistic and unique objects to my satisfaction, I hope to take small part in making the world a better place by salvaging and recycling waste to a new value. 

Risks & Challenges

The greatest risk involved with this campaign is not to be funded, of course, but the most important ones are regarding my personal health and abilities to produce and market profitable items, while staying an artist and not loose focus of handmade products.

I am in excellent health, that is something of a pride for me, and I hope to stay so. As for the rest, I am more than qualified having graduated with majors in business and services, and being worldly recognized at both visual and written art. Of course, I do not sleep on the job, constant learning and research are a must.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't assist this campaign through financial support, I'll be just as happy to ask you for sharing the info about it. Sometimes this can help even more, and to me this means a lot.

story:
ArtRoom24.com is the first online social marketplace for artist and art galleries.

I am raising funds to launch my website which can help artist to sell their artwork globally and to ease purchases of an art collector. We aim to give the global audience on every artist's artworks which they deserve.

We aim to give artists the best platform they need to share their artwork and reach the audience they deserve. The target market consists of artists and artwork traders that want to get attention and to get in contact with their customers. It enable artists to communicate directly to their customers and followers, through their ArtRoom24’s social profiles, and are able to by-pass their physical presence in art galleries.

Definition of an Online Social Marketplace

The best example for an online marketplace is E-Bay. Multiple vendors can sell their own products to its customers globally, but it is not very social. Facebook is very social, and enables its members to interact with each other, make friends, upload pictures to their profiles, create interest groups and express their opinions.

A Social Marketplace is a combination of these two platforms.

 

As an artists,

  • you are able to present your artwork online for the world to see with just a click of a button.
  • share your information to any artist or customer to contact you easily.
  • display your beautiful artworks and creations.
  • sell you artwork in this website globally.
  • an option to sell both in auctions or fixed price format.
  • an integrated Creative Common License model to protect uploaded content and digital material.
  • connect across the world globally through the social features.
  • a forum to discuss art related topics and other concerns.
  • an active and social interaction to all artist and loyal art collector across the globe.

 

As a merchant,

  • one website to scan all your favorite artist and their art creations.
  • ease your artwork research and skip visiting and scanning on many different resources online.
  • a wide variety selection of all your art type needs and wants.
  • ease your artwork purchase procedure and lessen delivery hassles.
  • connect socially to your favorite artist around the globe and to other art collector and user.
  • interact actively in any forums of artist or user of your same interest.
     

Key Bonus

  • enable all user, artist or collector to understand each other through multi language selection.
  • enable user to actively be social to all user, artist and collector.

Many artists have created digital artworks and have not published it properly by a publishing company. Also while not necessarily having established a name in its field, it is difficult for these artists to make sales and attract attention. ArtRoom24 gives a chance to get more exposure through its member’s database and integrated social functionalities.

In line to my unique concept and the first online social marketplace for art, a needed budget of 20,000 EUR to make all things happen and to start my concept come to live. The team is already working to much to make this possible but we need funds to launch the website and to fund the fees, press release, marketing strategies, social platforms and the alike

Your help and donations will extend globally in terms of showcasing the creative creations and artworks of artist doing their masterpiece with all their effort and time. It is the best time to help the artist shine their talent globally and for the people across the world to see beauty in everyday life.

story:
Short Summary

The mission of organization is social,medical , ducational and legal supporting to soldiers` mothers and soldiers` children who have   problems in these areas. During 25 years experts of  organization have implemented the project focused on Human Rights protection.

Since January 2015, Armenian "Soldier's Mother" NGO has launched a new educational program, in which children with physical needs will be able to get free education in reputable art studios and workshops in Yerevan. The purpose of the project is that the children will be afforded with a good opportunity to communicate with their peers, as well as take an active participation in the public life of the city. The society has been able to encompass this children  with care and assistance, which need support and help. The "Zinvori Mair" organization is working with the National Center for Aesthetics and within this project the center is attended by 30 children. All the 30 children of the program "Art therapy" have a variety of physical issues, for example - autism, scoliosis, cerebral palsy, issues with hearing, vision, etc. Much attention is paid to the children whose families are socially secured  or where two of the children have a disability or health issues. So far, the organization can afford to include a child who live in Yerevan or neighboring regions within the project, but the number of such children is getting more and more. 
At the beginning of the project the organization provided the children with the necessary materials - bags, gouache, paper, markers, scissors, threads, embroidery frames and so on. The children are instructed by experienced teachers and psychiatrists with extensive experience of similar work with sick children. Periodic exhibitions are also organized within this project, where the works made by the children during lessons are demonstrated. Some works are already ready for final exhibition which include paintings and clay sculptures which will be displayed during the general show. 


What We Need & What You Get

The  final exhibition, which include paintings and clay sculptures,  will be displayed during the general show. 

To promote the closing of the exhibition, we want to create a catalog of painting and sculpture, as well as posters and leaflets depicting the work of children. All this will be handed out during the closing the fair guests and partners of the project.

Budget

1. Catalog 100 exs.*$4=$400

2. Posters 5 exs.*$10=$50

3. Leaflets 150 exs.*$1=$150


The Impact

The purpose of the project is that the children will be afforded with a good opportunity to communicate with their peers, as well as take an active participation in the public life of the city. The society has been able to encompass this children  with care and assistance, which need support and help. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this letter by all social ways

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
NFT is the Future of the Digital Era and this has become a trend all over the world

 

My name is Andy Tan and I like arts and new technology.

At the point when I found out about cryptocurrency and NFTs,
I realized that this was the biggest change and opportunity in our life.
I wanted to participate in this new game and bring along all my supporters.
NFTs,Cryptos and Blockchain are going to change the world.

 

What is an NFT?

NFTs (Non-fungible tokens) are scare digital items that can be "minted" to limited quantities, just like a rare art print. They are becoming one of the greatest selling products 
in the world of blockchain and cryptocurrency.
 
Some has already sold more than multi-millions for a single NFT. Non-fungible tokens(NFT) are digital assets whose unique identity and ownership are verified on a blockchain with usually a limited supply. NFTs are not mutually interchangeable. 
 

 

 

Here's how it work

Introducing Initial NFTs Offering for our collection of "Bored Bulls" 10,000 unique NFTs.

The design inspiration of the Bored Bulls is based on "Bored Ape".
The design works carefully selected by the algorithm eventually generated a total of 10,000 unique Bored Bulls, each of which is unique.

This is one of the example of our Bored Bulls artwork,
we constantly working to improve the design and value of the Bored Bulls.

Owning a Bored Bulls will have the commercial value return of our entire ecology. 

 

 

Here's what we need.

We need to raise about $3,000 USD to kickstart our idea and build a generous community to help set up community wallet.

This will help :

Cover start up costs like the on going website development

NFTs design and programming

Blockchain NFTs minting fee

Set up a community wallet

 

Bored Bulls NFTs community


Owning a Bored Bulls is not just about having a rare piece of digital art or a personalized avatar,Bored Bulls owners will benefit from becoming part of a new community filled with 
like-minded individuals all searching for greatness. 

All Bored Bulls members will have access to a discord channel where they can post suggestions. Every Bored Bulls member is welcome to share their idea and each member has one ticket to vote on the best idea.We value and listen to your feedback.
Our vision is to push an amazing community to its highest potential. 

We want to set up a Bored Bulls NFTs community wallet.

Community wallet will use for donations and any projects that Bored Bulls members can vote and decide where the funds will be channeled to.

Now,you TOO can join in on the craze by support and buying a valuable NFT at the early stage.
Your pledge will get you a limited-edition, one-of-a-kind, NFT.
Once you have them, they'll be yours permanently to keep or to sell. 

We are here to help those who wants to jump into this booming industry but do not have the skills to create unique and artistic digital media.

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR ALL YOUR SUPPORT! 

OFFICIAL WEBSITE:

http://www.boredbulls.com

story:
My name is Brian Charles. You may be asking, “Brian, just who do you think you are?” Well, I’m originally from a small town in Iowa, grew up in your average family- one sister, mom, dad, dog, cat. But the year of my 21st birthday that all changed and it changed dramatically. My father got sick and passed away due to pancreatic cancer. So now what? My thoughts exactly. My whole world shifted, so I decided to shift with it.

 

I packed up my Honda Civic and drove West to California, where I knew exactly one person. After six (mostly blurred) years, I moved back home. Another year passed before I decided to hit the road for Mississippi, where I met the love of my life. We had plans to wed in May of 2020, but you know how 2020 went… Since my split I’ve found the courage to put myself out there. I had been tattooing only a short time before I realized I had finally found my passion, and when you find your passion nothing can stop you.

 

My story has made me a teacher, someone who has the ability to get through to people. Having learned this about myself, I’ve made it my mission to educate society a little bit more about tattoos and what they truly mean for an individual. I will help get the message out there that tattoos have been around for decades and will continue to be around much longer than you or I. Tattoos and booze will never lose! Neither is going anywhere any time soon. 

 

What we put on our bodies is no indicator of our potential, but rather an expression of our being, a record of our journey. I want to help break the stigma one community at a time, and no better place to start than beautiful, culture rich Biloxi, Mississippi- the place I now call home. 

 

Electric Envy Tattoo Spa will be different from the traditional shop that many see as intimidating or rough around the edges. The concept of a SPA, (that’s right, a spa) where you can get a tattoo, a massage, a facial, semi-permanent makeup, and more, is a game changer. Your art, your journey, should be memorable and uniquely yours. You deserve a peaceful zen experience as you engage in your unique art expression.

 

We will offer many amazing services for the creative and expressive residents of, and visitors to, beautiful Biloxi. Working with the youth of the community, we will create an after-school type program for teens and young adults. We will introduce different styles of art and teach our new friends how to become effective entrepreneurs, get their voices heard, and follow their own passions to never be without. 

 

One thing I’ve learned from my own journey and circumstances is that a person’s future is their own. The nurturing we offer the youth of our communities is instrumental in the development of the toolboxes of their futures. Teaching them early that they are accepted, and acceptable, can be the single turn that leads them in a healthy direction, regardless of what life may throw in their paths. Art and business leadership are two incredible tools that can keep them going through any obstacles they may face.

 

First and foremost, this funding will help secure our ideal location in the heart of the community. We will also begin efforts to mobilize our services for a personalized and secure environment to serve those who cannot, or do not wish to travel into public environments, especially during these unsure times. We will be capable of scheduling a private visit to your home or other preferred location (or event), to apply your tattoo safely and professionally.

 

Additionally, the donations we receive through this effort will go towards things such as art and office supplies, decor, lighting, and improvements to our location for a relaxing and safe environment. We will be able to bring in local educators and host stunning events and displays to help grow and showcase our new family and our work. 

 

And we will have the opportunity to enact a great business and marketing model that will ensure lasting roots for the community. I've never been about the almighty dollar and money has never ruled my life. I have always been the person who will give away everything if only it meant the comfort and care of someone else.

 

So, after some deep encouragement from people who have faith in me and this idea, I decided to create this fundraiser and these rewards to help make this dream a reality for us all. The perks in place for those who contribute here, and become part of the foundation for this movement, are designed to give back. The landlord doesn't take rent in tattoos, but if you're willing to invest in me, I will give back with even greater value, and you have my guarantee on that.

 

Many talented local artists are eager to be part of this innovative project. While much of my journey so far has been a struggle, it has put me in a unique position to take those experiences that have shaped me, and offer knowledge to others. By creating this place for artists and creatives of all kinds to feel at home, we will also teach all who doubt us, or themselves, that anything is possible when you follow your passions to create your path. We can demonstrate that a tattoo is an expression, not a scarlet letter. Art is soul, not destruction.

 

I have walked back from the very edge and want to make sure no one ever feels like that is a place they want to go. Having learned a healthier, inspiring way to live, I want to lead by example and help this great community find the same outlets and optimism that I continue to nurture within myself.

 

We are passionate, talented, and bold, and we are here to make some noise. With a little help from you, our lovely new friends, noise is what we shall make! We will spread Electric Envy far and wide so that everyone has the chance to understand that their dreams are worthy and always as close as their determination. 

 

You who have given your time to read this, share it with your friends, or are able and willing to invest a hard earned dollar, you are precious and important to me and will never be forgotten. I look forward to seeing you in the spa! Until then, always stand firm in your drive and passions, believe in YOU, never slow down, and don’t forget to live loudly. May God bless you. Ciao!

 

With peace, love, and *@#king noise,

Brian Charles

story:
Blue here with a cute and simple idea for a League of Legends pin!

  • You like league of legends? You like Teemo? Or better yet- YOU LIKE BEEMO? Well then, why not fund this idea and bring it to life? Have a little Beemo pin of your own!
  • This design is a digital mock-up. The final design may have slight changes to it whether it be the outline of it or some of the colors to fit the pantone color options.
  • The pin will be hard enamel, gold and 1.8 inches tall.

 

Costs

  • 50% of funds go towards the production cost

  • 20% of funds go towards shipping

  • 20% of funds go towards packaging necessities

  • 12% of funds go towards Indiegogo fees and tax

    This is an approximation of how these funds will be divided. Packaging and shipping take up a good chunk so that they can be recyclable.

 

Contact Info

Twitter @ BluePencilAri

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't afford to pledge? Here's how you can help for free!

  • You can get the word out and share this campaign with your friends!
  • Indiegogo has wonderful sharing tools that make it easy to show this campaign on your social media such as twitter, facebook, instagram and more!

 

Risks & Challenges

Some risks and challenges we may face during this Indiegogo campaign have a very low chance of occurring, however, they may still be possible due to outside sources.

  • The biggest risk is that if my manufacturer messes up the design, it will double the production time. Please keep in mind that the pins shown may be subject to slight changes at any time during the process.
  • If any issues occur I will give updates as soon as possible so everyone is aware of what is happening at all times.

story:
Our Story

My mom (Zanele) and I (Lindelani) run a beadwork company specializing in traditional African wear, accessories, interior art work and corporate gifts. We would like your assistance in sharing our rich African culture with the world. Our aim with this campaign is to raise funds that will grow our business and the people behind our beautiful range of products

My mom has over 15 years’ experience in the beadwork, sewing and craft industry and is living her dream through this company. She has recently approached the CathsSETA (which is a government agency in charge of up-skilling people in the Culture, Arts, Tourism and Sports sector in South Africa) to find a way to get the skills she’s learnt in her experience, to the women we currently work with and other women who are interested in learning beadwork to help feed their families.

We currently work from home and outsource some of our work to working groups spread across South Africa, as all our products can only be handmade. Many of the people we work with are mothers who are also breadwinners from previously disadvantaged backgrounds. They rely on skills they've learnt to use their hands to put food on the table and often have very little schooling. This is a costly and often difficult to manage part of our business. Some challenges we face include keeping a consistent standard throughout the various designs we have and we lack the resources and infrastructure to train all of the people we outsource work to.

To solve this we are starting our own craft and art brand called Nokwanda. Nokwanda is a girl child’s name meaning “she who brings growth”. Through this brand we want to produce high quality products that epitomize the diverse and rich history of various African cultures to share with the world. We are asking you to help us fund this dream. With your contributions, we will be able to develop a quality standards-compliant curriculum and business plan required by CathsSETA, acquire the skills to create brand materials such as a logo, brand identity, packaging as well as a website with high resolution images to showcase our products to clients all over the world. Once we are compliant with CathsSETA, we will be able to utilize their funding to train the ladies that supply us and provide them with starter pack kits. These will not only up skill them, but give a head start to running their own one-women or group businesses producing standardized craft work.

Your contribution to this campaign will go a long-way in uplifting the lives of many families who wish be lead fulfilling lives where they can contribute to the economy productively. We believe in the famous Zulu saying, “Umuntu ngumuntu, ngabantu” which loosely translated means a person is only a person through other people; and want to share that spirit of human kindness with you. Even if you can’t contribute with money, we ask that you share this campaign page with people that you think will find this as a worthwhile project to invest in. We’d also like to reach out to businesses who are interested in buying or reselling our products. We would love to work with you to give your customers a taste of our African heritage. I’d like to sign-off by saying Siyabonga, meaning we thank you.


The Impact

You contribution will help change lives. We are not asking for funds to feed the poor, but for the opportunity to uplift people who have the drive and passion to share elements of their unique ethnic culture with the world.
"Give a man a fish, and feed him for a day; teach a man how to fish and feed him for a lifetime." -Unknown


How we intend to use the funds:

Our initial goal is $6 000 USD broken down into the following:

Business Cards $200
Brand Identity $800
Indiegogo Perks $1 000
Business Plan $800
Beadweaving Curriculum Development $660
Website Design & Development $1 200
Domain/Hosting (3  years) $180
Product Photography $800
Packaging Designs $120
Indiegogo Fee (4%) $240
Total $6 000


Other Ways You Can Help

We would really appreciate it if you could please share this campaign within your personal network as well as online (Facebook, Twitter, G+, LinkdIn, Blogs, Forums, etc) to whomever you believe would find this as a worthy project to invest in. Feel to to use the Indiegogo sharing tools to make this easier.
Thank you.
story_txt:
Our Story


My mom (Zanele) and I (Lindelani) run a beadwork company specializing in traditional African wear, accessories, interior art work and corporate gifts. We would like your assistance in sharing our rich African culture with the world. Our aim with this campaign is to raise funds that will grow our business and the people behind our beautiful range of productsMy mom has over 15 years’ experience in the beadwork, sewing and craft industry and is living her dream through this company. She has recently approached the CathsSETA (which is a government agency in charge of up-skilling people in the Culture, Arts, Tourism and Sports sector in South Africa) to find a way to get the skills she’s learnt in her experience, to the women we currently work with and other women who are interested in learning beadwork to help feed their families.We currently work from home and outsource some of our work to working groups spread across South Africa, as all our products can only be handmade. Many of the people we work with are mothers who are also breadwinners from previously disadvantaged backgrounds. They rely on skills they've learnt to use their hands to put food on the table and often have very little schooling. This is a costly and often difficult to manage part of our business. Some challenges we face include keeping a consistent standard throughout the various designs we have and we lack the resources and infrastructure to train all of the people we outsource work to.To solve this we are starting our own craft and art brand called Nokwanda. Nokwanda is a girl child’s name meaning “she who brings growth”. Through this brand we want to produce high quality products that epitomize the diverse and rich history of various African cultures to share with the world. We are asking you to help us fund this dream. With your contributions, we will be able to develop a quality standards-compliant curriculum and business plan required by CathsSETA, acquire the skills to create brand materials such as a logo, brand identity, packaging as well as a website with high resolution images to showcase our products to clients all over the world. Once we are compliant with CathsSETA, we will be able to utilize their funding to train the ladies that supply us and provide them with starter pack kits. These will not only up skill them, but give a head start to running their own one-women or group businesses producing standardized craft work.Your contribution to this campaign will go a long-way in uplifting the lives of many families who wish be lead fulfilling lives where they can contribute to the economy productively. We believe in the famous Zulu saying, “Umuntu ngumuntu, ngabantu” which loosely translated means a person is only a person through other people; and want to share that spirit of human kindness with you. Even if you can’t contribute with money, we ask that you share this campaign page with people that you think will find this as a worthwhile project to invest in. We’d also like to reach out to businesses who are interested in buying or reselling our products. We would love to work with you to give your customers a taste of our African heritage. I’d like to sign-off by saying Siyabonga, meaning we thank you.
The ImpactYou contribution will help change lives. We are not asking for funds to feed the poor, but for the opportunity to uplift people who have the drive and passion to share elements of their unique ethnic culture with the world."Give a man a fish, and feed him for a day; teach a man how to fish and feed him for a lifetime." -Unknown





How we intend to use the funds:Our initial goal is $6 000 USD broken down into the following:


Business Cards
$200


Brand Identity
$800


Indiegogo Perks
$1 000


Business Plan
$800


Beadweaving Curriculum Development
$660


Website Design & Development
$1 200


Domain/Hosting (3  years)
$180


Product Photography
$800


Packaging Designs
$120


Indiegogo Fee (4%)
$240


Total
$6 000





Other Ways You Can Help
We would really appreciate it if you could please share this campaign within your personal network as well as online (Facebook, Twitter, G+, LinkdIn, Blogs, Forums, etc) to whomever you believe would find this as a worthy project to invest in. Feel to to use the Indiegogo sharing tools to make this easier.
Thank you.

story:
[ENGLISH FOLLOWS]

Personnes en fauteuil roulant, personnes se déplaçant avec des béquilles, personnes âgées, familles avec poussette, etc. Il est estimé que le manque d'accessibilité touche au moins 600 000 Montréalais de près ou de loin. Pourtant, aucune loi n'encadre l'accessibilité universelle au Québec, et de nombreux commerces et lieux publics continuent de fermer leurs portes à toute une frange de la population.

Réalisé par Portraits de Montréal grâce à l'appui de Kéven Breton, militant pour l'accessibilité universelle, À LA PORTE est un projet bénévole de sensibilisation des Montréalais et des Québécois aux impacts concrets du manque d’accessibilité de la ville sur la vie de nombreux citoyens, à mobilité réduite ou non.


À LA PORTE, C'EST QUOI ?

Quand le métro a été construit, il devait permettre à Montréal d'entrer dans la modernité. Aujourd'hui, seulement 8 stations sur 68 - toutes sur la ligne orange - sont accessibles à tous. Nous avons donc choisi symboliquement ce mode de transport public pour illustrer le manque d'accessibilité à Montréal et au Québec. Ainsi, 68 personnes différentes ont été photographiées devant toutes les stations du réseau de la STM, et nous ont partagé 68 anecdotes de la vie courante, tranches de vie authentiques marquées par l’inaccessibilité.

L’ensemble de ce contenu sera dévoilé à travers une véritable exposition virtuelle, sur un site web dédié au projet : alaporte.org (non disponible avant juin)


À LA PORTE a pour objectif principal de sensibiliser les Montréalais et les Québécois à l’importance de l’accessibilité universelle dans l’intégration de tous les citoyens, sans discrimination aucune. Le projet ne pointe du doigt aucun acteur public spécifique, ni aucune organisation ou entreprise en particulier ; il ne fait que mettre en lumière une réalité peu comprise par la population. 

Au-delà de cet objectif de sensibilisation, les citoyens disposeront de deux moyens forts pour manifester leur soutien à la cause :

  • Signer une pétition en ligne qui sera rattachée à l’exposition virtuelle et à la soirée de lancement, afin de demander au gouvernement Québécois de doter le Québec d’une loi-cadre sur l’accessibilité universelle (= loi qui décrira un programme et en fixera les objectifs et les engagements dans la durée) comme c'est déjà le cas en Ontario ou en France par exemple. 
  • Envoyer au gouvernement Québécois des cartes postales reprenant certaines des 68 photos/histoires de la série, et qui seront vendues pour la somme symbolique de 5$/unité lors de l'événement puis sur le site web dédié au projet. Elles seront également disponibles en contrepartie de certaines contributions à cette campagne de socio-financement.

Notre espoir est qu’en sensibilisant l’ensemble des Montréalais et des Québécois aux enjeux de l’accessibilité, et en leur donnant les outils pour manifester leurs attentes auprès des pouvoirs publics, des mesures seront prises pour faire évoluer la situation dans le sens de l'inclusion totale.


OBJECTIF 6000 $ : UN ÉVÉNEMENT DE LANCEMENT

Pour maximiser l’impact de cette série et de cette exposition virtuelle, nous souhaitons organiser une soirée de lancement, afin de réunir les participants de À LA PORTE, toutes les personnes qui ont rendu possible ce projet, et d'autres défenseurs de l'accessibilité universelle. Nous inviterons également les médias, des représentants de la STM et de l’AMT, de la mairie et des municipalités de Montréal, et du Gouvernement du Québec, dans l'espoir de pouvoir faire avancer la situation.

Vous pourrez vous aussi faire partie de cet événement citoyen en contribuant à cette campagne.

Le projet À LA PORTE et l'ensemble des activités de Portraits de Montréal sont réalisés de façon 100% bénévole, et nous avons donc besoin de votre aide pour concrétiser cet événement. Il nous faut lever 6000 $ pour pouvoir en financer l'organisation.

Prévu sous forme de 5 à 7 étendu, fort en émotions et en animations, le lancement de À LA PORTE devrait avoir lieu le jeudi 4 juin 2015, durant la Semaine québécoise des personnes handicapées. La date reste toutefois sujette à changement en fonction des disponibilités d'une salle 100% accessible qui puisse accueillir toutes les personnes qui souhaitent venir.

Plus nous serons nombreux, plus l'événement sera grandiose et mémorable !


OBJECTIF 9000 $ : UNE EXPOSITION PHYSIQUE

Pour encrer cette série dans la réalité, nous aimerions également mettre sur pied une véritable exposition physique avec une quinzaine de photos et les histoires qui vont avec. L'ensemble sera présenté en exclusivité lors de la soirée de lancement, puis déplacé dans une galerie de Montréal où les citoyens pourront ensuite aller la découvrir gratuitement. Et si les fonds collectés nous le permettent peut-être pourrons nous également la faire voyager à travers le reste du Québec !

Cette magnifique exposition physique ne pourra avoir lieu que si nous parvenons à lever 9000 $.


À PROPOS DE PORTRAITS DE MONTRÉAL

Portraits de Montréal est l’adaptation Montréalaise de Humans of New York. 

Sur ce blogue sont présentés des portraits d'humains rencontrés de façon aléatoire dans les rues de Montréal. Chaque portrait se compose d’une photo de la personne et d’un morceau choisi de la conversation qui a eu lieu lors de la rencontre. Créé en mars 2014, il rejoint aujourd’hui près de 80 000 personnes par semaine, et a bénéficié d’une vaste couverture médiatique (Radio-Canada, TVA, City, La Presse, Gazette, Journal Métro, 24 Heures, Huffington Post, Urbania, Nightlife, et bien d'autres). 

À noter que Portraits de Montréal est un blogue à but purement artistique et social, qui cherche à rapprocher les humains et qui ne génère aucun revenu de ses activités.

Pour nous contacter : portraitsdemontreal@gmail.com

Liens utiles : 

  • Blogue
  • Facebook
  • Instagram
  • Youtube
------------------------------------------------

[ENGLISH TEXT]

People in wheelchairs, people walking with clutches, elderly people, families with strollers, etc. It is estimated that the lack of accessibility affects at least 600,000 Montrealers. Yet, there is no law to provide a framework to universal accessibility in Quebec, and many businesses and public places still keep their doors closed to a whole part of the population.

Produced by Portraits of Montréal with the help of Kéven Breton, supporter of universal accessibility, AT THE DOOR aims to raise awareness on the impacts of our city’s lack of accessibility in the lives of many citizens, with or without limited mobility.


WHAT IS AT THE DOOR?

When the metro was built, it was meant to allow Montreal to enter the age of modernity. Today, only 8 stations out of 68 – all on the orange line – are accessible to all. As a symbol we chose this public transportation system to illustrate the lack of accessibility in Montreal and in Québec. Therefore, 68 different people were photographed in front of the 68 metro stations, and shared 68 everyday life anecdotes, authentic stories all linked by the issue of inaccessibility.

The entirety of this content will be revealed in a digital exhibit, on a dedicated website: alaporte.org (available in June).

AT THE DOOR’s main objective is to raise awareness among Montrealers and Quebecers on the importance of universal accessibility in the inclusion of all citizens, with no discrimination whatsoever. The project doesn’t point fingers at any given public organization, it only sheds a light on a reality that is unknown by most of the population.

Beyond this awareness objective, people will be provided with two means to show their support to this cause:

  • Signing an online petition to ask the Quebec Governement to create a framework-law on universal accessibility (a law that will set official goals and engagements towards universal accessibility) as is the case in Ontario or France.
  • Sending a postcard with a picture and story from the project to the Quebec Government. Those will be sold during the event and on the website of the project. They also are available as perks in this crowdfunding campaign.
Our hope is that by raising awareness on the issue of accessibility, and by providing Montrealers and Quebecers to communicate their expectations to the Government, measures will be implemented to make the situation evolve towards total inclusion.


$ 6,000 GOAL: A LAUNCH EVENT

To maximize the impact of this series, we wish to host a launch party, in order to gather all the participants of AT THE DOOR, everyone who helped make this project happen, and other supporters of the cause. We will also invite the media, officials from the STM and AMT, from the City of Montreal, and from the Government of Québec.

You too can be a part of this event by contributing to this campaign!

The AT THE DOOR project and all the activities of Portraits of Montreal are produced entirely on a volunteering basis, and we therefore need your help to make this event happen. We need to raise $ 6,000 to be able to organize the event.

The official launch event of AT THE DOOR should be held on Thursday, June 4th, in the middle of the 'Semaine québécoise des personnes handicapées' [Quebec week for handicapped persons]. The date may be subject to change based on the availabilities of a venue that will be 100% accessible and able to host everyone.

The more we will be, the greater and the most memorable this event will be!


$ 9,000 GOAL : A PHYSICAL EXHIBIT

To anchor this series in the real world, we would like to create a physical exhibit with a selection of pictures and stories from AT THE DOOR. The exhibit will be revealed during the launch event, and then hosted in a Montreal Gallery and open to anyone for free. And if the funds allow us to, then we could also have the exhibit travel through the rest of Quebec!
This beautiful exhibition will take place only if we're capable to raise 9,000 $.

ABOUT PORTRAITS OF MONTREAL

Portraits de Montréal is the Montreal version of Humans of New York.

On this blog are presented portraits of humans randomly met in the streets of Montreal. Each portrait comes with an extract of the conversation that took place when the photo was shot. Created in March 2014, it now reaches close to 80,000 weekly, and gained mass media coverage (Radio-Canada, TVA, City, La Presse, Gazette, Journal Métro, 24 Heures, Huffington Post, Urbania, Nightlife, and many more).

It’s important to note that Portraits of Montréal is an artistic blog meant to bring humans closer together, and generates no revenue from its activities.

You can get in touch at: portraitsdemontreal@gmail.com

Links:

  • Blogue
  • Facebook
  • Instagram
  • Youtube
                                               -------------------------------------

-------------------------------------

Un GROS merci à nos partenaires / A HUGE thanks to our partners

  

       

  

-------------------------------------

Ils parlent de nous / As seen in

      

           24H                    Sympatico                        Le JdM                                 Urbania

          MAtv               CISM (27 avr.)
