story:
THE PROJECT

  Collecting funds for the “Tarot of Fates”, will provide us the ability to pay for the printing (making a start with 500pcs) and promotion expenses. Even though we believe that you will spread the word after seeing our work, we won’t stop there. An e-shop with amazing greek products such as clothes, jewelry, decoration, shoes, games and much more is being prepared. And if we reach the goal x4 android + ios applications is also planned. And our journey will begin thanks to your help.

  Special items, packaged in a beautiful way, have been chosen to be used as perks and we are pretty sure that you or a person you love will enjoy them. Those perks will act as reminders of Greece, bringing to you a taste of ancient times and elegance as well, for this is exactly what we wish to give you through this deck and upcoming future products.

So, spread the word to your friends and family for something BIG is here!

May you all be in good health!

INTRODUCTION

Do you dare to discover what the Fates have for you?

  A destiny predetermined by the Fates, a power acting in parallel with the Gods that even they have not the power to change.

Clotho – the spinner, Lachesis – the allotter and Atropos – the unturnable, controlled the mother thread of life for every mortal from birth to death. Do they still do?

  In the ancient times of Greece the Oracles had a role in people’s lives. Answers would be given to questions about the future and history was written according to what the Fates determined. Oracles, secrets and mysteries in the ancient times are things that are possible to experience today by using the cards of the “Tarot of Fates” deck and find the answers to matters that trouble us. It was done then, in the ancient times and it is done again today. All you have to do is believe and you can find the oracle hidden in you.

  As Clotho spun the thread of life, Lachesis measured it allotted to each person with her measuring rod and finally Atropos, inevitably, would cut the thread of life. She chose the manner of each person’s death and when their time was come, she cut their life thread with her shears.

  So, Lachesis presented the things that were, Clotho the things that are and Atropos the things that are to be. Goddesses of great honor, placed by the side of Zeus said to be the daughters of Nyx and sisters of the Hours.

  The interpretations of the cards are easy and clear. The images and figures have been carefully selected because the meanings hide stories to be explored based upon the history of such an important civilization. The book that is included contains stories for each figure, so that you can learn and therefore understand more about the meanings of the cards and any deeper meanings that are hidden.

  My goal is to bring to all of you the chance to get to know piece by piece, story by story my country’s history and to use your imagination to discover the mystical part of the ancient Greek world where divinity always played an important role.

 

THE AMAZING TEAM

The Creator

My name is Kalliopi Kapousizi and i aim to bring to you as much divinity and harmony as possible through this amazing Tarot deck. I wish to bring something of the old ways to our modern world, unveiling the possibilities that each one of us have inside us and stay hidden, due to the challenges we face everyday.

I am a positive thinker, i believe in the energy of the universe and to the secrets it contains. This is why i wanted to design a tarot deck based on a civilization where oracles were taken into serious consideration a lot. The tarot of the Fates can be used by everyone, with understandable but deep meanings. A long time ago, people believed in destiny and they still do and this happens for a reason.

I believe that there is more than just trying to explain the words of Gods or what is  not understood. There are great powers around us and most of all inside us.

Let's find them and bring them out!

 

The Graphic Designer

George was born in a family of artists. He enjoys drawing and has a strong fantasy, being able to create something entirely out of his mind. And i find that extraordinary. As a young boy he loved to draw dinosaurs, dragons and beasts of all kind and to be honest he still does. His skills don't stop here, he is a great dps player in World of Warcraft! As a person of high expectations from himself with dreams and goals, it was very easy for me to choose him, to create this time my dream. And it was a GO!

I hope the images are as pleasant to your eyes as they are to mine.

 

The Advisor

Sofia is literally the person that came into my life unexpectedly, when we both joined a class and we somehow matched. She is trully the smartest person i know, always learning something new and i admire her for that. She is actually a well established architect, but that was never enough for her. Other than working and being a very good singer, she is always expanding her knowledge and she shares that with me with pleasure.

Angel and fairies, positive pshycology,  affirmations, energy healing, powerful mind thinking, card decks and many many more are some of the things i found out because of Sofia. Often, i tell her that when i have kids one day, she better be into their lives teaching them everything she knows and she laughs. A true friend that i love so much.

Thank you Sofia and Thank you Universe!

 

The Photographer

Well, i don't know what to say about my mom. She is the best mom i could wish for. She loves taking pictures of buildings and nature, but especially abandoned places. She has a totally different way of seeing things than me and i learn a lot from her. She loves travelling and meeting new people, getting to know their habbits and daily routine capturing the unseen with her camera.

I Love you Miterion ! (that's how i call her) 

 

My Family & Friends

And my team grows bigger with all these amazing people standing by my side unconditionally 24/7. Family members in Thessaloniki and Athens have helped me, each one of them on a different way, assisting me daily on this project. There are also dear friends like Triantafyllos and Mina who did their best preparing this campaign and deck. I am blessed for having all these people by my side, supporting me, for we make a great team!

 

 

 

THE PERKS

 

THE DECK

The deck will be of 300 gsm smooth quality paper, fully printed, with gloss finish in a beautiful box. Dimensions 70x121mm - 2.75''x4.75''. There are 57 cards inside including 22 figures, while the rest are myths and suggestions to read the cards.

THE NECKLACES

Unique designs for men and women, will accompany you with all of your outfits plus each one has an energy stone that will give you luck and protection from the bad energy around us. Also a great gift for people who are into the energy stuff!

THE T-SHIRTS

For those who like the graphics but are not so much into the energy stuff, those t-shirts will be an awesome choice for any member of your family or friends. Available in two colors and many sizes, these t-shirts will get you noticed, so don't forget to advertise them :)

THE 2018 DECOR

These elegant Energy Stones will not only surround you with Good Luck, but will also decorate your room providing some luxurious shine and its the best choice to make a gift to people you love.

 

REMEMBER:

The stones were all collected by hand from greek beaches and it took us many months to find them, since it is very hard to discover them. These perks will not be available on the e-shop later on so it is really a limited collection. Not many pieces are available and we suggest that  you don't miss them. In many civilizations the naturally drilled stones are known and believed to bring luck and abundance. Still we understand that not all people believe, so other perks are created to satisfy them too and support us.
story_txt:
THE PROJECT
  Collecting funds for the “Tarot of Fates”, will provide us the ability to pay for the printing (making a start with 500pcs) and promotion expenses. Even though we believe that you will spread the word after seeing our work, we won’t stop there. An e-shop with amazing greek products such as clothes, jewelry, decoration, shoes, games and much more is being prepared. And if we reach the goal x4 android + ios applications is also planned. And our journey will begin thanks to your help.
  Special items, packaged in a beautiful way, have been chosen to be used as perks and we are pretty sure that you or a person you love will enjoy them. Those perks will act as reminders of Greece, bringing to you a taste of ancient times and elegance as well, for this is exactly what we wish to give you through this deck and upcoming future products.
So, spread the word to your friends and family for something BIG is here!
May you all be in good health!
INTRODUCTION

story:
Ιn 1999, scientist in Singapore created a GMO fish that was meant to glow, while detecting environmental pollution. The fish was later patented and sold as a pet. We take this as a contemporary story of creation, where life can be patented and owned. 
On the other hand, consider that honey bee is part of a continuous universe, and while feeding the hive by collaborative work, fertilizes other plants and sustains life. These two, stories of creation and  life are the foundation of this exhibition

In a society driven by consumerism, often seen as the neurotic speed of life accelerated by greed, we miss the essence of life and creation, neglecting the cultural, collaborative and environmental pillars, which ultimately can bring the sought balance.

The contemplative empowerment approach may be the social change that is needed. 

Have you ever experienced the feeling of having the earthly possessions, yet missing feelings and emotions’ fulfillments as an individual? 

If the answer is YES, then we are thrilled to have you onboard. 

My name is Kleoni and I am a visual artist, and through art we want to create spaces of contemplation and empowerment. 

Such is the space that we want to create with your support.

Best part is that after 4 years of research on this project, we are ready to present, in the form of a show.

In this show we explore how mindfulness practices and contemplative teachings of different professions and traditions can impact social transformation and commodification… remember that bee that fertilizes the plants, and how is the impetus force of life? Now it makes more sense…

The exhibition will last for three days and will take place in May, 2019, in Athens, in Greece.

 Drawings and sculptures will be at view, a video installation, two participatory performances and a panel where artists, scientists and beekeepers will join together to share the critical reflection in experiential learning towards the cycle of life and how this is treated in each profession. 

We really need your support to bring this show to life. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for 8050€/ 9110$ in total to produce this project.  That amount can be broken into:

Ceramic costs (plates, cups) 500 €,

Production cost of exhibition: Video 1000€, Animation 500€, Performance rehearsals 500€ Sculptures 2500€

Drawings materials 300€, Booklet _ photography-design –print 1500€, Instruments 300€

Musicians 450€, Video Design 500€ = 8050€

What you get!

10$ a thank you digital card send to you by email

15$ + shipping: a small ceramic shell shaped plate

20$ + shipping: 2 orange cups 

25$+ shipping:2 heart cups

40$+ shipping: 2 pomegranate shaped bowls

50$+ shipping: Τhe ceramic salad bowls inspired by the medusa protagonists of the show.

60$+ shipping: Bee Platers

60$+ shipping: 3 Dna Plates

70$+ shipping: Medusa Drawings  (100)

80$: a personal drumming session (100 pl)

350$+ shipping::  a digital photo museum print, limited edition of 8

500 Behind the scenes. Your name as a Silver donor,  a signed booklet of the show and an invitation behind the scenes before the doors open! 

2000$+ shipping: One of the two drawings of the show. The doorkeeper.

 

The Impact

We are accustomed to hear that we live in times of crisis, yet the real crisis is not the economic meltdown, even though it impacts our every day greatly.  

We break new ground in the field of contemplative empowerment that cover all aspects and can be put in service of responsible citizenship and social transformation. Our work will take the viewer to a journey, starting from empowering different ways of connection to search within ourselves, and finally to underline the importance of collaboration as social activism.

story:
My name is Marianne Chapel, I’m an artist, art instructor, and founder of a contemporary art gallery. I have a Masters in Fine Arts Painting from Indiana University, and I have been instructing art at the college level for over 20 years. I am passionate about supporting artists and art. It has been my dream to create an artist studio hub since my college years!

I believe art studios are essential to the artist’s life. The sharing of ideas, the environment of self-discipline, the professional work habits, and the time and place for creativity are all crucial to an artist.  It is so important to me to have a group of like-minded people to work with, both to request feedback, and to build projects together. In graduate school, I loved the experience of being with a close-knit group of artists daily and having the space to work comfortably and retreat privately, if I chose. This freedom, the support I felt, and the feelings of belonging I had, are what I am recreating in the SPAACES Art Studio Program.

This fundraising campaign will subsidize the rent for two art studios at the SPAACES hub, in Sarasota, FL. It will create a small community of artists in a 2000 square foot industrial space with newly renovated, air-conditioned artist studios, and will offer them at a low, subsidized amount of only $200/month for rent. Without the subsidization, the art studios would rent for approximately $400 a month, funds raised from this campaign will cut this cost to half. All the funds will go directly to the subsidization of these two art studios and for the payment of utilities and upkeep.

I am a dedicated advocate for artists. I'm building SPAACES to provide better working conditions and affordable studios for practicing Sarasota artists. I have recently built the 3 new studios, waiting to be filled.

SPAACES Art Studio Program offers studio space to artists for a one-year term. Though it is small in scale, only able to support three artists a time, the project hopes to grow and expand into multiple studio spaces in the future. SPAACES is the only subsidized studio opportunity for artists in the artsy city of Sarasota, FL. It will also provide a communal space for programming, exhibitions and community outreach.

After the funds are raised, SPAACES will set out to find deserving artists who will make the most of the opportunity (and who truly need it, financially). SPAACES will invite applicants to submit proposals and call finalists for in-person interviews, ultimately landing on two individuals.

Your contribution will help make an important impact in Sarasota’s artistic community, helping it grow from the wonderful home for traditional art that it already is, to include a much-needed collaborative space for working artists, and a visiting place for the connoisseurs who appreciate boundary-pushing contemporary art by up-and-coming artists.

Your contribution will change the lives of dedicated, working artists by giving them a unique opportunity to have the time and space to create art that will have an impacting affect in our world. Your donation will help grow art tourism in Sarasota, positively affecting the artists, the public audience, art appreciators, and all who come to see artists at work.

This is an opportunity for you to be part of something new and unique, a catalyst for artistic innovation in the art scene in Sarasota.

SPAACES is a non-profit modeled, visual arts, cultural organization benefiting diverse Sarasota, Florida communities and Florida artists.

This project will create a huge shift for the city of Sarasota!

As a resident of Sarasota and working artist, I have been aware of the distinct absence of affordable art studio spaces. I have tapped into my experiences of travel and teaching to formulate the concept for SPAACES, and to mold that idea into an operating visual arts gallery and studio space in Sarasota.

Sarasota, FL has long been a cultural destination for those interested in visual and performing arts venues. People come from around the world to visit exhibits at The John and Mable Ringling Museum of Art as well as to see productions at The Asolo Repertory Theatre, or one of the many Sarasota local theaters.

Sarasota is also a draw for talented artists who temporarily locate here to hone their craft at the award-winning Ringling School of Art and Design. Usually students leave Sarasota after school because they don’t have a supportive environment to stay. What if there was a place for Ringling graduates to feel inspired, welcomed and supported, so that they want to remain in Sarasota after completing their degrees?

There is now such a place being created!

SPAACES an energetic, thriving environment for living, breathing artists who want to work in and gain inspiration from a contemporary, collaborative, and experiential artistic universe. This new artistic area will create the much needed nurture and support for Sarasota Artists, and create a destination location for art tourism.

Why I'm qualified to manage this project:

I earned a Bachelor of Fine Arts from Buffalo State College and a Master of Fine Arts from Indiana University. I was the recipient of Indiana University’s Graduate Studies Research Grant for Florence, Italy, the Charles Lanham Fellowship for Travel Abroad, and was award a research grant at the Vermont Studio Center. I have instructed art for 20 years including Buffalo State College, The University of Tampa, Santa Fe University of Art and Design, and currently at the Ringling School of Art and Design where I was awarded a faculty grant.

I have years of extensive experience in retail management and have managed clothing stores such as Casual Corner and Macy's. My experiences through teaching, managing, creating as an artist, and perspective gained in the art world through travel make me uniquely qualified to be able to carry out the vision of SPAACES and offer a community for working artists in Sarasota.

When I reflect on my life and my past, I can see that all I have done has led me to this point of creating SPAACES for the artists of Sarasota, FL. 

This campaign is aimed to specifically subsidize new artist studios, however SPAACES has an ongoing outreach and involvement with the community in many different ways. If we don't reach the amount of our entire goal, the funds received will go to the management, building, exhibitions, and organizational aspects of SPAACES and the efforts of its continued growth. If we do not reach our goal, the plan for a 12 month lease for subsidized studios would not work, therefore the art studios will be rented out to individuals willing and able to pay the full cost of the art studio.

COMMUNITY PROJECTS

SPAACES brings the community together to consider a variety of art activities including social, political, and cultural themes.

NEW ART FORMS

SPAACES specializes in progressive forms of contemporary art, social practice art, and collaborative artistic events and exhibitions.

CULTURAL HUB

SPAACES is a non-profit modeled, visual arts, cultural organization benefiting diverse Sarasota, Florida communities and Florida artists

Making it Happen:

SPAACES is centrally located just a few blocks northeast of downtown Sarasota in an air-conditioned industrial space that allows for the creation of all manner of contemporary works.

SPAACES Art Studio Program initial footprint contains three art studio spaces to be subsidized by this campaign and then rented far below the average rate for creative space in the Sarasota area, and an intimate gallery for displaying local work.

SPAACES is a unique environment created by artists for artists. It provides affordable studio space for artists working to make their living through their craft, and it provides an artistic oasis of contemporary, experiential art for the community to enjoy.

SPAACES is a visual arts organization dedicated to supporting artists by offering subsidized, affordable art studios, quality exhibitions, and an encouraging, creative environment. We specialize in high caliber, new forms of art and provide collaborative space for exciting community projects.

SPAACES makes a profound difference in the lives of the artists who participate, empowering their artistic voice through professional development, worldly exposure, and intellectual exploration.

SPAACES is Sarasota’s home for visual arts studios and collaborative art programming. We nurture a vibrant arts community, foster artistic excellence, and bring people together for powerful shared experiences that inspires a creative exchange of ideas. SPAACES is a unique artistic microcosm in the Sarasota visual arts landscape, moving Sarasota up the ranks in art tourism.

Please give a gift today.

And please help us to get the word out to others and to make some noise about this campaign by sharing – use the Indiegogo share tools!

Perks included in contributions:

SPAACES Ceramic Mug:
Warm up your mornings with a hot cup of coffee in the SPAACES White Ceramic Mug Cup o’ Joe. Ceramic material, c-handle mug, 3.75" H and 11-oz capacity.

SPAACES Tote Bag:
Take yourself shopping with an environmentally friendly, stylish tote bag embellished with the SPAACES logo.Made of 100% cotton, machine washable, 14.5" x 15".

SPAACES Solid Knit Beanie:
Keep yourself warm with a SPAACES super comfy and stylish solid knit beanie. 100% acrylic knit, 9.84 in height, 2.3 oz.

Fine Art Prints by Marianne Chapel
Add sophistication to your decor with a signed and numbered, limited edition print of original artwork by Marianne Chapel. Printed on archival paper, this artwork is rich with warm tones of golden yellow, soft gray, navy blue, white, punchy red, and a splash of bright turquoise. This is a print of an original artwork of an encaustic wax painting. Chapel creates these paintings by fusing together thick layers of encaustic wax to create relief-like texture, and using carving techniques to soften edges, melt blocks together and eliminate others.

Marianne grew up exploring the city-like, low income housing development where she lived with her mom and four older sisters. The sprawling, identical, apartment buildings were built in three phases and covered ten acres. The boundaries she pushed and the buildings she hid behind became areas of special significance and limitation. Chapel ordered this world into a system of invisible linear diagrams and imaginary geometric shapes which marked areas of refuge, restrictions, safety and risk. At home, she was preoccupied with drawing made-up maps of unknown locations and well-organized house designs with intricate floor plans. She immersed herself in the challenge of combining the necessary rooms of a house in an efficient way, each rectangular space fitting together like a puzzle piece.

I thickly apply encaustic wax and use carving techniques to soften edges, melt blocks together and eliminate others. My methods mirror the building and rebuilding of architecture. Like sites that have been destroyed and rebuilt, I build art, rearrange it, and build it again.

*20% of funds go to crowdfunding fulfillment services

Though it is small in scale, only able to support three artists a time, the project hopes to grow and expand into multiple studio spaces in the future. SPAACES is the only subsidized studio opportunity for artists in the artsy city of Sarasota, FL. It will also provide a communal space for programming, exhibitions and community outreach.After the funds are raised, SPAACES will set out to find deserving artists who will make the most of the opportunity (and who truly need it, financially). SPAACES will invite applicants to submit proposals and call finalists for in-person interviews, ultimately landing on two individuals.Your contribution will help make an important impact in Sarasota’s artistic community, helping it grow from the wonderful home for traditional art that it already is, to include a much-needed collaborative space for working artists, and a visiting place for the connoisseurs who appreciate boundary-pushing contemporary art by up-and-coming artists.Your contribution will change the lives of dedicated, working artists by giving them a unique opportunity to have the time and space to create art that will have an impacting affect in our world. Your donation will help grow art tourism in Sarasota, positively affecting the artists, the public audience, art appreciators, and all who come to see artists at work.This is an opportunity for you to be part of something new and unique, a catalyst for artistic innovation in the art scene in Sarasota.SPAACES is a non-profit modeled, visual arts, cultural organization benefiting diverse Sarasota, Florida communities and Florida artists.This project will create a huge shift for the city of Sarasota!As a resident of Sarasota and working artist, I have been aware of the distinct absence of affordable art studio spaces. I have tapped into my experiences of travel and teaching to formulate the concept for SPAACES, and to mold that idea into an operating visual arts gallery and studio space in Sarasota.Sarasota, FL has long been a cultural destination for those interested in visual and performing arts venues. People come from around the world to visit exhibits at The John and Mable Ringling Museum of Art as well as to see productions at The Asolo Repertory Theatre, or one of the many Sarasota local theaters.Sarasota is also a draw for talented artists who temporarily locate here to hone their craft at the award-winning Ringling School of Art and Design. Usually students leave Sarasota after school because they don’t have a supportive environment to stay. What if there was a place for Ringling graduates to feel inspired, welcomed and supported, so that they want to remain in Sarasota after completing their degrees?There is now such a place being created!SPAACES an energetic, thriving environment for living, breathing artists who want to work in and gain inspiration from a contemporary, collaborative, and experiential artistic universe. This new artistic area will create the much needed nurture and support for Sarasota Artists, and create a destination location for art tourism.Why I'm qualified to manage this project:I earned a Bachelor of Fine Arts from Buffalo State College and a Master of Fine Arts from Indiana University. I was the recipient of Indiana University’s Graduate Studies Research Grant for Florence, Italy, the Charles Lanham Fellowship for Travel Abroad, and was award a research grant at the Vermont Studio Center. I have instructed art for 20 years including Buffalo State College, The University of Tampa, Santa Fe University of Art and Design, and currently at the Ringling School of Art and Design where I was awarded a faculty grant.I have years of extensive experience in retail management and have managed clothing stores such as Casual Corner and Macy's. My experiences through teaching, managing, creating as an artist, and perspective gained in the art world through travel make me uniquely qualified to be able to carry out the vision of SPAACES and offer a community for working artists in Sarasota.When I reflect on my life and my past, I can see that all I have done has led me to this point of creating SPAACES for the artists of Sarasota, FL. This campaign is aimed to specifically subsidize new artist studios, however SPAACES has an ongoing outreach and involvement with the community in many different ways. If we don't reach the amount of our entire goal, the funds received will go to the management, building, exhibitions, and organizational aspects of SPAACES and the efforts of its continued growth. If we do not reach our goal, the plan for a 12 month lease for subsidized studios would not work, therefore the art studios will be rented out to individuals willing and able to pay the full cost of the art studio.COMMUNITY PROJECTSSPAACES brings the community together to consider a variety of art activities including social, political, and cultural themes.NEW ART FORMSSPAACES specializes in progressive forms of contemporary art, social practice art, and collaborative artistic events and exhibitions.CULTURAL HUBSPAACES is a non-profit modeled, visual arts, cultural organization benefiting diverse Sarasota, Florida communities and Florida artistsMaking it Happen:SPAACES is centrally located just a few blocks northeast of downtown Sarasota in an air-conditioned industrial space that allows for the creation of all manner of contemporary works.SPAACES Art Studio Program initial footprint contains three art studio spaces to be subsidized by this campaign and then rented far below the average rate for creative space in the Sarasota area, and an intimate gallery for displaying local work.SPAACES is a unique environment created by artists for artists. It provides affordable studio space for artists working to make their living through their craft, and it provides an artistic oasis of contemporary, experiential art for the community to enjoy.SPAACES is a visual arts organization dedicated to supporting artists by offering subsidized, affordable art studios, quality exhibitions, and an encouraging, creative environment. We specialize in high caliber, new forms of art and provide collaborative space for exciting community projects.SPAACES makes a profound difference in the lives of the artists who participate, empowering their artistic voice through professional development, worldly exposure, and intellectual exploration.SPAACES is Sarasota’s home for visual arts studios and collaborative art programming. We nurture a vibrant arts community, foster artistic excellence, and bring people together for powerful shared experiences that inspires a creative exchange of ideas. SPAACES is a unique artistic microcosm in the Sarasota visual arts landscape, moving Sarasota up the ranks in art tourism.Please give a gift today.And please help us to get the word out to others and to make some noise about this campaign by sharing – use the Indiegogo share tools!Perks included in contributions:SPAACES Ceramic Mug:Warm up your mornings with a hot cup of coffee in the SPAACES White Ceramic Mug Cup o’ Joe. Ceramic material, c-handle mug, 3.75" H and 11-oz capacity.SPAACES Tote Bag:Take yourself shopping with an environmentally friendly, stylish tote bag embellished with the SPAACES logo.Made of 100% cotton, machine washable, 14.5" x 15".SPAACES Solid Knit Beanie:Keep yourself warm with a SPAACES super comfy and stylish solid knit beanie. 100% acrylic knit, 9.84 in height, 2.3 oz.Fine Art Prints by Marianne ChapelAdd sophistication to your decor with a signed and numbered, limited edition print of original artwork by Marianne Chapel. Printed on archival paper, this artwork is rich with warm tones of golden yellow, soft gray, navy blue, white, punchy red, and a splash of bright turquoise. This is a print of an original artwork of an encaustic wax painting. Chapel creates these paintings by fusing together thick layers of encaustic wax to create relief-like texture, and using carving techniques to soften edges, melt blocks together and eliminate others.Marianne grew up exploring the city-like, low income housing development where she lived with her mom and four older sisters. The sprawling, identical, apartment buildings were built in three phases and covered ten acres. The boundaries she pushed and the buildings she hid behind became areas of special significance and limitation. Chapel ordered this world into a system of invisible linear diagrams and imaginary geometric shapes which marked areas of refuge, restrictions, safety and risk. At home, she was preoccupied with drawing made-up maps of unknown locations and well-organized house designs with intricate floor plans. She immersed herself in the challenge of combining the necessary rooms of a house in an efficient way, each rectangular space fitting together like a puzzle piece.I thickly apply encaustic wax and use carving techniques to soften edges, melt blocks together and eliminate others. My methods mirror the building and rebuilding of architecture. Like sites that have been destroyed and rebuilt, I build art, rearrange it, and build it again.*20% of funds go to crowdfunding fulfillment services

story:
A BANISHED WARRIOR JOINS FORCES WITH A BAND OF MISFITS, JOURNEY THROUGH THE NIGHTMARES OF GERMAN FOLKLORE IN THE DEPTHS OF THE BLACK FOREST. 

NOW WITH THREE COVERS.

VARIANT BY PETER GILMORE

VARIANT BY CAANAN WHITE

story:
Short Summary

The art object for Burning Man 2021 created by a group of artists from Ukraine and Russia who already created BRC art objects in 2015, 2018, 2019. Wooden statue of a human floating in the desert. Half sunk in the ground. It is huge and massive and asks people a lot of questions regarding humans in the modern world. These questions are not easy, often incomprehensible, and always different. What is yours? Share with us.

The art got approval from Burning man Honoraria in 2020, but due to pandemics, it wasn`t issued. One prototype of the art was already created for one of the creative spaces in Moscow. The next goals: to create one more prototype in Ukraine and the main sculpture for Black Rock City 2021 (yes we strongly believe that Burning Man 2021 will take place this year!)

What We Need & What You Get

The object is a huge and complex construction made of metal and wood. Most of funds will go for

  • Wood, metal, rods, washers, nuts, generators, led-lamps
  • Instruments
  • CNC cutting and welding
  • Transportation and logistics

The Impact

We want to dedicate Merman to people, who stuck as this rigid huge human figure. In the past, some mental problems, depressions, burnout, hard decisions, and other difficulties of modern humans. All of us had bad times and it's about a choice - to stuck and stop or continue to "swim" forward, even if it`s a desert only around you. 

Every little donation made by you will help us to show through our art that there is a chance to get out of these hard times, for everyone, always.

Risks & Challenges

We believe that Burning Man will take place this year and Merman will be set in BRC before the event start - August 29, 2021. But even if it won`t happen we still will bring Merman to Nevada in 2022, 2023... 2040.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can become our subscriber on social media, like our posts, and share with your friends, it gives us a great boost to move forward:

https://www.instagram.com/merman_art/

https://www.facebook.com/mermanart

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCalDWy-EhJg3tM...

story:
￼A free artistic soul - years of helping people at hospital. NURSE. A good, nice, professional nurse. Still dreaming about helping with ART. Poetry, circus, music, painting, acting, writing...

"You will never be an artist!" 
"You? You are arting only in your little room."
"Did you go to art school?"

But she felt it in her whole heart. She knew her own mind. And she reached for her dreams. And those dreams came true.


TRY TO HURT AN ARTIST AND SHE MAKES A MASTERPIECE OUT OF IT

Broken from fake friends, love, human principles and true - she chose the way of growing up. So then she started. She started to yell, scream and cry by whole soul - on paper, on canvas... She gave the colours their new own life and changed the words into gentle living beings. And then she started to smile. To smile, love and then? She just woke up from ashes and became a beautiful, powerful and strong flower.

IT IS NORMAL TO:
- be broken
- be blind
- be dissapointed
- want to disappear 
- trust 
- believe lies
- make a mistake
- be good
- be naive
- be a human being

IT IS POSSIBLE TO:
- wake up
- reach your own dreams
- trust someone who is better
- find love for a lifetime 
- still stay good
- want to be ALIVE!
- be a human being all the time
- be thankful for everything
- make a mistake
- have a beautiful life


It is normal to be a GIRL, 
it is possible to become a WOMAN.


ABUSUS OF LOVE
(A poetry collection)

A connection of poems, music and paintings.
They are telling about love of lovers in its various forms. Its using, overusing, abusing, even addiction.


POETRY COLLECTION, WHICH:

- Is your FRIEND but could be your LOVER
- Will UNDERSTAND You
- You can GO IN BED with
- Is about YOU too
- Is about EVERYBODY
- You could LISTEN to
- Is an ILUSTRATED POETRY
- Shows you MUSIC and face of verses
- Has verses from SOUL


WHY "THE POETRY OF FUTURE"?

- Using QR codes for MUSIC VIDEOS
- Is MULTIART
- Can reach people of EVERY AGE and  TASTE
- Is NEW
- Is UNIQE


* THE 1st MULTIDIMENSIONAL poetry collection in SLOVAK REPUBLIC *


WHO GAVE LIFE TO THE MUSIC?

Music Producer Jan Zborovjan and love of my life :) https://www.janzborovjan.com

 Do you wanna LISTEN to something from Abusus of love? ENJOY! 
https://youtu.be/9zE8SZL5TO0


WHO GAVE WORLD THE ILUSTRATIONS?

Two  SISTERS - I and my beautiful sister Ivana Tomanovova.

 Do you wanna SEE something from Abusus of love? It's possible to download a free mini PDF version with your email here:
www.abususlasky.sk


WHO GAVE THE POWER TO THE WORDS?

Monika Tomanovova - you can find me on Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/Poet-Monique-399779113...

 Do you wanna READ something from Abusus of love? It's free in SLOVAK (A mini PDF version in English is to be prepaired) here: www.abususlasky.sk 


WHY I'M DOOING THIS? 

I wanna SHOW you (girls, boys, women, men, humans or animals, anybody and everything who can feel) - I wanna SHARE. I wanna be WITH YOU and you will NEVER FEEL ALONE. 
I'm HERE. Honest and Strong, for every lost crying heart, every hurt soul I'm ready to catch your tear and make a DIAMOND out of it.
I'm here to say :  " YOU are UNIQE. SPECIAL. AWESOME."  I'm here to say: "It's OK. It's NORMAL. It HAPPENS." And I'm here to say: ,,Reach for your DREAMS, YOU CAN DO IT, BEAUTIFUL! You are more than ENOUGH, HANDSOME!"


WHAT DO I NEED? 

*1. I need to TRANSLATE my BOOK - collection of poems - Abusus of love (for the beginning) into ENGLISH LANGUAGE. 

*2. I need to PRINT my BOOK - collection of poems - Abusus of love and make a PAPER version too.


More LANGUAGES - More CONNECTIONS!

I want to HELP more people. Now the book is available only in my mother tongue - Slovak. 
Help to connect the whole WORLD with WORDS! Make ART heal and inspire.

story:
Le Premier Tome is the first volume of L'amour Déshabillée (love undressed). The L'amour Déshabillée: Graphic Illustrated Haiku Series is a collection of illustrated haikus by Fine Art Creator Doris Faye Jones. Each volume has ten haikus illustrated with single page artwork and a second three-panel story page. The single-page pieces convey the overall theme of each haiku and the three-panel story pages fully illustrate each line of the haiku. Le Premier Tome features hand-painted symbolic artwork digitally enhanced by the artist. Lettering was completed by the artist using her own personally created font set.

Each volume has a 2nd coloring edition. This edition is the creator's contribution to mental wellness by offering a coloring book for the therapeutic benefits of art therapy.

Doris Faye Jones 

Dori is a Creator using myriads of mediums. She is primarily a fine art painter and poet. She is also an actress, director, producer, comic, voiceover talent, videography & photographer; as well as spoken word performer. In 2021, she wrote, produced, and distributed her first full-length spoken word album with music she personally composed. The album is a companion piece to a tribute poetry collection: The Magic Man Collection: A Tribute to Van Bates, BLACK HESHER.

https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4uqn3J1YBbw...

 

The Impact: This campaign will assist in launching me into the world of serial publishing. The illustrated haiku series with my artwork brings this poetic form to an entirely different level. The illustrations bring to life the personal and intimate meanings of the poetry. This also gives me the unique opportunity to share the vulnerable side of my creativity in a multitude of ways.

The contributions for this campaign will assist me with the continuation of this series, as well as enable me to transition to some use of digital illustrating. In the forthcoming future, it is my further aspirations to complete the illustrations for children's books I have written, complete the current poetic story collection I'm working on ('This is NOT Emotional Burlesque'); as well as other projects I have planned. 

 

The Impact for Others: Art is Life. Life is complicated, challenging, and often downright cruel. The power of painting, writing, sketching, reading, movies, games and all things of the imagination bring joy to the human spirit. My artwork in the simplest of terms is all 'labors of love'.

There is a story within the stories behind every piece of artwork I've ever created. This illustrated haiku series was the first project where the artwork was conceptualized directly from the poetry and the meaning of the words. This was definitely a challenging project, but one well worth the time and effort as the payoff creatively is immense.

The haiku poems are brought into a multi-dimensional presentation that invokes the reader's passion for words and art simultaneously. 

Just who am I?

Professionally, I've maintained a solid foundation and footing within the field of Healthcare; a successful career that spans three decades. Creatively, I've been creating in one form or fashion for decades beginning with photography at the age of 9.  Studio portrait photographer was my only primary employment role outside of Healthcare. 

I began filling notebooks with my poetry in junior high and wrote comedy in one way or another for much of my life. I was affectionately nicknamed, The Amazon Beauty in 10th grade. In 2006, I began my comedy career doing standup and used this as my comedic persona; and have done so since. This year, I launched two Webtoons series (haiku & comedy). I have aspirations to also formally create a printed comic series as well.

In 2015, I transitioned from primarily working on paper with charcoal to fine art canvas paintings using a variety of mediums, primarily watercolors. I also seal most of my art with a high gloss acrylic spray to enhance the shine, sheen, look and overall effect conceived 'in my artist brain'.

My artistic endeavors also include, but are not limited to, talk show host, directing, comedy writing, acting, and more. I've also been a ghostwriter to a few comics over the years. 

In addition, I am Diva Dori of Diva Daily Living. "Diva Daily Living encompasses a myriad of human engagements of Life. Our topics have no limits. We do demand providing a safe space to hold for all survivors and loves needing healing, support and comfort. We're here to remind you that YOU MATTER & you can CHOOSE LIFE TODAY. I am literally NOT here for me. My creator put me here… For you. - Diva Dori

Risks & Challenges

Risks? Honestly... I don't see any risks here. Unless we are talking about the soul-baring epic levels of OH MY GOD! .... I'm going to let people 'get to know me?'!!!

In the general sense, this project is already a success. It is fully written, illustrated and the edition one author's copy is in hand. There will be challenges to the upcoming process of 'my first campaign, oh my God!'.

I will humbly be challenged by the intensity of self-promotion, networking, marketing, and letting people 'see me'. The honest real core me? would rather stay in the background and just create. I do have an upcoming plan to transition away from my traditional employment role in healthcare and more critically devote my time and energy to publishing, creating art, and producing entertaining content. It is my purpose and mission to share as much Art with others as I possibly can to ease the overwhelming exhausting experience of being Human.

Thank you for taking the time to give this a look. If you can't contribute, please feel free to share the campaign to get the word out using the Indiegogo share tools.

Otherwise, please pretty please ask me anything you may think of. 

Peace & Love, Dori

 

and now.... BEND

 

FLIP...

 

and STRETCH!!!!!!! 

At 50% funding, ALL backers will receive a 5x7 postcard of 'Sweet Girl' and a patch. The Sweet Girl postcards were created using handpainted artwork which has been graphically enhanced digitally. *pending finalization of postcard design.

*Final patch design pending.

At 75% funding, all physical backers will receive a set of 'Speed Dori' stickers. 

The 'Speed Dori' Design by Dori; Design contributor and consultation by: Shae the Red: https://twitter.com/GhastLight 

 

 

At full funding, all physical backers will receive a page of handpainted artwork (randomly chosen by me) sent with fulfillment. 

150% full funding, all physical backers will receive an assorted artwork sticker page. 

More than that?? To be determined! I am doing the legwork, getting quotes, designing images for stickers and MORE. 

Can't back just yet?! DO NOT EVEN FRET! 

Just show you care and share, share, SHARE! You can still support by spreading the word about my campaign, give my YouTube channel a follow, tune into a live art stream and just be You, boo. 

and DEFINITELY.... GOOOOOOO sign up!!! for an account at for a free thank you gift from me to you.

https://dorisjoneslaborsoflove.com/m/create-acc...


****WORKING on my kudos high-five list of A LOT of Creators that have guided me on this path; WAY MORE names to add to this list****!!! so, don't fret if your name isn't here (yet):

For now, Thank you to:

Shae the Red (for getting message after message.... after message... from me, and replying always! with eagerness and willingness to give freely of your time and support); and our Speed Dori design is FIRE!!

CY.borg Valkyrie & Shae, Red Valkyrie: for prepping & hosting my launch event!

Thank you Aria Blackness for your editing eyes and assistance with fine-tuning. Thank you for all that you do for creators and the wisdom you bring to us all.

Special extra thanks to: Mike Jimmy Lortia de Bruin for keeping me company tons of times while I painted, always cheering for my success and inspiring me to become better, brighter and far more confident Creating my art in a whole NEW WORLD. 

and THANK YOU Pops Van Zant for the infamous phrase "why don't you illustrate your poetry?" !

The haiku poems are brought into a multi-dimensional presentation that invokes the reader's passion for words and art simultaneously. 


Just who am I?
Professionally, I've maintained a solid foundation and footing within the field of Healthcare; a successful career that spans three decades. Creatively, I've been creating in one form or fashion for decades beginning with photography at the age of 9.  Studio portrait photographer was my only primary employment role outside of Healthcare. 
I began filling notebooks with my poetry in junior high and wrote comedy in one way or another for much of my life. I was affectionately nicknamed, The Amazon Beauty in 10th grade. In 2006, I began my comedy career doing standup and used this as my comedic persona; and have done so since. This year, I launched two Webtoons series (haiku & comedy). I have aspirations to also formally create a printed comic series as well.
In 2015, I transitioned from primarily working on paper with charcoal to fine art canvas paintings using a variety of mediums, primarily watercolors. I also seal most of my art with a high gloss acrylic spray to enhance the shine, sheen, look and overall effect conceived 'in my artist brain'.
My artistic endeavors also include, but are not limited to, talk show host, directing, comedy writing, acting, and more. I've also been a ghostwriter to a few comics over the years. 
In addition, I am Diva Dori of Diva Daily Living. "Diva Daily Living encompasses a myriad of human engagements of Life. Our topics have no limits. We do demand providing a safe space to hold for all survivors and loves needing healing, support and comfort. We're here to remind you that YOU MATTER & you can CHOOSE LIFE TODAY. I am literally NOT here for me. My creator put me here… For you. - Diva Dori
Risks & Challenges

Risks? Honestly... I don't see any risks here. Unless we are talking about the soul-baring epic levels of OH MY GOD! .... I'm going to let people 'get to know me?'!!!
In the general sense, this project is already a success. It is fully written, illustrated and the edition one author's copy is in hand. There will be challenges to the upcoming process of 'my first campaign, oh my God!'.
I will humbly be challenged by the intensity of self-promotion, networking, marketing, and letting people 'see me'. The honest real core me? would rather stay in the background and just create. I do have an upcoming plan to transition away from my traditional employment role in healthcare and more critically devote my time and energy to publishing, creating art, and producing entertaining content. It is my purpose and mission to share as much Art with others as I possibly can to ease the overwhelming exhausting experience of being Human.
Thank you for taking the time to give this a look. If you can't contribute, please feel free to share the campaign to get the word out using the Indiegogo share tools.
Otherwise, please pretty please ask me anything you may think of. 
Peace & Love, Dori

 
and now.... BEND

 
FLIP...

 
and STRETCH!!!!!!! 

At 50% funding, ALL backers will receive a 5x7 postcard of 'Sweet Girl' and a patch. The Sweet Girl postcards were created using handpainted artwork which has been graphically enhanced digitally. *pending finalization of postcard design.
*Final patch design pending.

At 75% funding, all physical backers will receive a set of 'Speed Dori' stickers. 
The 'Speed Dori' Design by Dori; Design contributor and consultation by: Shae the Red: https://twitter.com/GhastLight 
 

 
At full funding, all physical backers will receive a page of handpainted artwork (randomly chosen by me) sent with fulfillment. 

150% full funding, all physical backers will receive an assorted artwork sticker page. 
More than that?? To be determined! I am doing the legwork, getting quotes, designing images for stickers and MORE. 
Can't back just yet?! DO NOT EVEN FRET! 
Just show you care and share, share, SHARE! You can still support by spreading the word about my campaign, give my YouTube channel a follow, tune into a live art stream and just be You, boo. 
and DEFINITELY.... GOOOOOOO sign up!!! for an account at for a free thank you gift from me to you.
https://dorisjoneslaborsoflove.com/m/create-acc...
****WORKING on my kudos high-five list of A LOT of Creators that have guided me on this path; WAY MORE names to add to this list****!!! so, don't fret if your name isn't here (yet):
For now, Thank you to:
Shae the Red (for getting message after message.... after message... from me, and replying always! with eagerness and willingness to give freely of your time and support); and our Speed Dori design is FIRE!!
CY.borg Valkyrie & Shae, Red Valkyrie: for prepping & hosting my launch event!
Thank you Aria Blackness for your editing eyes and assistance with fine-tuning. Thank you for all that you do for creators and the wisdom you bring to us all.
Special extra thanks to: Mike Jimmy Lortia de Bruin for keeping me company tons of times while I painted, always cheering for my success and inspiring me to become better, brighter and far more confident Creating my art in a whole NEW WORLD. 
and THANK YOU Pops Van Zant for the infamous phrase "why don't you illustrate your poetry?" !

story:
Fingering the Mundane

Fingering the Mundane is a collection of my early poetry chapbooks from 2017-2019. These chapbooks are out of print and one of them was never even released. These include:

  • All My Friends Are Dead
  • The Exhausted Bird
  • Ingrown Air
  • Acid
  • DNF'd
  • and the unreleased Rats
  • all together it's over 250 pages of poetry
  • limited to 125 copies

 

What I Need & What You Get

Here is the break down:

  • $1200 for the 125 books to be printed and shipped to me so I could then sign them and number them and send them out to you.
  • Perks include ebooks, audiobooks, your names in the book, me coming to your town to give a reading, me giving a Poetic Anarchy 1 Day Crash Course, plus some really cool stretch goals if we get that far.
  • No matter what this book is coming out. If we don't make the goal, it may be a little slimmer, LOL. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about Fingering the Mundane!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for joining me on this awesome journey!

story:
Our Story

We are raising money to create twin monuments in USVI and Denmark commemorating resistance against colonial rule. The project is initiated by La Vaughn Belle/U.S. Virgin Islands and Jeannette Ehlers/Denmark-two artists connected by their shared Caribbean roots and colonial histories. We debuted a mock-up in March 2018 in front of the West Indian warehouse in Copenhagen in commemoration of the 100th anniversary of the sale and transfer of the Danish West Indies (now the U.S. Virgin Islands) to the United States. As the first monument to a Black woman in Denmark, I Am Queen Mary made international headlines as a symbol that celebrates and centers the story of people who resisted Danish colonialism in the Caribbean. In 2020 the Danish government granted permission to permanently install I Am Queen Mary in front of a former colonial warehouse in Copenhagen, acknowledging the work's shift  from a temporary artwork to an important landmark in the city.

In December 2020 a winter storm severely damaged the monument in Copenhagen. The figure was removed and an Augmented Reality version of the sculpture was developed to activate new dialogues. More information about our project can be found at www.iamqueenmary.com.

What We Need & What You Get

So many people along the way have asked us how they could help make this work permanent in Denmark and how they could help bring the monument to the Virgin Islands. Here is your chance. Your donation will help make our goal a reality, and make you a part of the project as this also belongs to you. We are raising in total over 7 million Danish kroner (1 million USD). This crowdfunding campaign is an essential part of our larger fundraising strategy. We are well on our way, as the Danish government pledged 1 million Danish kroner ($160,000 USD) with the condition that we raise the rest. 

As a part of our campaign we have developed a series of amazing rewards in exchange for your generous support. We have a beautiful partnership with the All Power To The People Project to do an exclusive edition of t-shirts, hoodies and tote bags to support raising funds for I Am Queen Mary.

All Power To The People Project exists to inspire and empower each generation by creating products that communicate the history and global impact of the Black Panther Party.

Our pose in the figure of I Am Queen Mary was inspired by the iconic image of one of its leaders, Huey P. Newton. As President of the Dr. Huey P. Newton Foundation, his widow, Fredrika Newton together with designer Rachel Konte, co-own the brand All Power To The People Project. We are thrilled to be working with them. 

We also designed exclusive prints that combine images from rubbings from the coral stones that were cut from the ocean by enslaved Africans with the image of the 3D body scan renderings that were used to create the figure in I Am Queen Mary.

We also recognize that some people do not want to receive any material reward for their donation. We honor that by offering a series of "eco-options".

If you are not able to donate to our project you can still help. Please share in your networks the links to our campaign and tell your friends and family about the project.

The Impact

At the time of the inauguration in 2018 our project was featured in over 100 media outlets around the world in over 20 countries with an estimated global reach of over 1 billion. This coverage demonstrated that our story resonated with so many people because colonialism and resistance against it is a global story. Since then, I Am Queen Mary has been featured in blogs, academic journals, books, textbooks, TV shows and documentaries. This has been the project's greatest impact- the ability to create powerful and transformative dialogues.

Risks & Challenges

There have been many challenges along the way. We first had to raise the money to even get a temporary installation-we did that. Then, we had to work on getting the permanent permission in Denmark-we did that too! We are in the process of finalizing the permission in the Virgin Islands and having enough funds is a part of that. Regardless of whether we reach our crowdfunding campaign goal, our plan is to continue fundraising money and seeking philanthropic foundations for their support. We are determined to make this project a reality.

story:
Chara Unlock: Usagi is a design created by myself, channelSQUARE!

This campaign is funding the second pre-order of the Chara Unlock: Usagi Acrylic Standee!

The  standee is  100mm x 150mm of Clear Acrylic, Single-Sided, and includes 3 Uprights, 1 base, and a Collectors Card verifying it's an official artwork by channelSQUARE!.

✧ Exclusive Items Discount ✧  Exclusive to this indiegogo campaign, you have the chance of snagging other Chara Unlock Usagi items at a huge discount!

This is a limited run item.

Don't miss out on the details! My design not only features everyone's favorite bun-head Usagi, but also Luna, the Orgel (a.k.a. Star-Shaped Locket), Tuxedo Mask's mask and rose, and a 90's Sailor Moon anime inspired cityscape.  The text reads "Character, Unlock! Usagi".

I am a huge fan of Sailor Moon, seeing it for the first time back in 1995. My goal was to show my love and appreciation for this beloved series, and also create something for the ultimate Sailor Moon fan!

Funding will go towards an initial print of the acrylic standees, shipping, bonus goodies, Indiegogo processing fees, and taxes.

 

Includes one:

✧ 100mm x 150mm standee and Collectors Card

Includes one:

✧ 100mm x 150mm standee and Collectors Card

✧ 5” x 7” iridescent foil print on light cardstock gloss

Includes one:

✧ 100mm x 150mm standee and Collectors Card

✧ 5” x 7” iridescent foil print on light cardstock gloss

✧ 40mm Acrylic pin 40mm with pink rubber heart clasp

The artwork is done and a printer has already been lined up! I have worked with this printer for 4 years now and printed a few standees with them already, I can guarantee good work in return. I have successfully run an online shop for 8 years and have managed and fulfilled large orders. I will keep my Indiegogo backers up to date on how the project is going, opting for full transparency. If there is anything that will delay the standee getting to your hands I will definitely let you know and have the experience to deal with it quickly.

Please be sure to share this campaign on your social media, and with friends and family.

Please review the FAQ section before sending a message! I only ask because sometimes I am not able to respond right away, and your question might already have an answer :D Thank you so much for taking the time to consider this campaign!

story:
Bringin' back the plush!

In 2018, fans of beetles and cute plush alike came together to fund the 16 inch, poseable, oh-so-soft Spike the Beetle plush. With wired mandibles, this Spike plush can hold just about anything!

 

We've been sold out of this plush for over a year now, and there have been many people asking for a restock. Here it is... but we need your help! High quality plush have a large minimum order, and there's no way to restock the plush without enough preorders beforehand. This will be our first and last ever restock of this big boy, so if you've ever wanted a bug to snug, this is your chance!

Preorder bonuses!

This is a restock, but we wanted to give those kind enough to contribute to the campaign something extra. Every Spike plush order will come with a vinyl decal in a random color. Stick 'em on your laptop! Your water bottle! Your friends and family!

Risks & Challenges

We will be restocking through the same manufacturer that helped us make both the original large Spike plush and the mini Spike Jr plush. They are a trusted source for quality plush. There may be some delays due to COVID, but backers will remain updated along the way if so.

Thank you!

Thank you so much for taking a look. If we hit our goal, we can fund a restock of this big bug friend. Bugs for all!

story:
ABOUT THE MIND'S EYE AND ITS CREATOR

The Mind's Eye is a 22-foot surrealist sculpture CURRENTLY being built by artist Launa Eddy in Tonasket, Washington. Awarded an Honoraria grant from Burning Man a week before lockdown began in 2020,  The Mind's Eye is an ambitious large-scale steel artwork that is determined to stand tall despite all the uncertainty and struggle we've faced in the last year. 

Colorful, playful, absurd - this sculpture represents the human ability to transform adversity and trauma into something beautiful and unknown. The face, with its bright red lips representing vitality and beauty, stands tall while blue streams pour through its eye. The streams are our life force, our experiences, our struggles flowing through us. They are the leverage that holds the face in the air above the world so it can see from a new perspective. The stream travels through the eye, rising up through the mind's cloud - our consciousness, and transforms into wild creatures that were formerly unseen and unknown. The creatures are kinetic, they are movable and swing with the wind... impermanent and always changing. If you dare,  climb the stream and sit inside the eye to challenge your assumption as being just a viewer of the piece. The Mind's Eye invites you to become part of it and see the world from a new angle, if you desire. 

Launa Eddy is a multidisciplinary artist based in New York City. Her work is playfully surrealistic, figurative, and animalistic. Through sculpture, 2D forms and multi-media performance, she exposes the absurdist nature of humanity, the animal within, and an ever-present humor shining through the realities of human darkness and struggle.  Born in Rhode Island, Launa was raised within a family of Offshore Lobstermen, and raised Alaskan Timber Wolves in the woods of New Hampshire. Her upbringing was split between deep sea fishing rigs, raising horses, breeding wolves, and a variety of eclectic animals. Her wild upbringing influenced her relationship to the world and shows up in her art.

 

BUILDING AND EXPENSES

The Mind's Eye is being built right now - with a projected completion date of October 1st, 2021. Meeting our fundraising goal is essential to bringing this sculpture to life and to make sure the artist has the help she needs. 

Through this Indiegogo campaign we are expecting to raise at least $20,000, but are hoping to raise more. Donated funds will help pay for  materials, labor, specialty services, shop rentals, expenses, transportation of the piece for 2021 and 2022, and possible storage. Any amount over $20,000 will help support the artist and the crew and the inevitability that unexpected issues will arise. Costs have gone up in every direction. Steel is 3x its pre-pandemic cost. Transportation alone is estimated to cost at least $10,000 to move the sculpture from Tonasket, WA to a temporary home, then to Burning Man in 2022. 

 

CREW SPOTLIGHT

Victor Valencia - - - Bad-ass artist and fabricator, Victor has all the skills, a no BS attitude, and also brings the smiles. He is # 1 lead on The Mind's Eye and he also came with a new rescue pup / super sweet shop dog, Chido. 

 

Quill Hyde - - - Artist, Engineer, and owner of the Hyde Made Shop where we are building. Quill is the engineering mastery behind The Mind's Eye. CAD drawings, calculations, and problem solving - Quill has a history of building some wildly complex kinetic pieces. Anything is possible with this man on your team.

Steven Spencer - - - Eternally grateful for the one and only Steven Spencer who flew out from NYC to help assist in fabricating one of the metal creatures, and helped to shoot beautiful photos and video. He slayed it in every direction. 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Share this campaign - help us gain more exposure to ensure we meet our goal. 

www.launaeddy.com 

Follow IG stories for The Mind's Eye work-in-progress: https://www.instagram.com/launa.eddy/

The Mind's Eye on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=suFiFbWe-Dw&amp...

Volunteer! In person, or from afar. How can you help? Reach out. We are working hard over here and can always use some fresh blood. themindseyeart@gmail.com 

Show The Mind's Eye at your business / park / vineyard from October 2021 until August 2022. This piece wants to find a temporary home where it is appreciated and loved. 

 

STAY TUNED

Expect regular updates, videos, photos, and special surprises from now until October 2021. We are on a journey and you're invited for the ride. Without you this wouldn't be possible, so strap in and get ready, you're riding shotgun (but not in the Lebaron, because it incinerated).

Expect regular updates, videos, photos, and special surprises from now until October 2021. We are on a journey and you're invited for the ride. Without you this wouldn't be possible, so strap in and get ready, you're riding shotgun (but not in the Lebaron, because it incinerated).

story:
We're back.

While we have found a printer who actually prints these types of cards, we figured we would create a regular Pamela Coleman Smith Neon Tarot based on her imagery.

Imagine a Rider Waite Smith with neon colours.

We have seen foiled versions, pastel versions, bright versions but not a NEON version. If funding is successful we will add UV which means the colours will also be bright under black light. 



Dont miss the opportunity to own one of these neon Waites. There arent many creators from what weve seen experimenting with true neon. The cost is high and believe me there's a lot of work that goes into creating neon coloured card decks.

Why you should back this campaign.
 

First to guarantee a deck.
 

Dont miss out on one of these amazing creations. Due to the specialty nature of the ink used in our neon fluorescent tarots the printer orders just enough ink to complete the job. If more is needed at the end it cannot be added. We will be ordering more or less just what we need. These inks are expensive and the cost of shipping cards to the UK is frightening, so reserve yours now dont miss out.

Why should I buy your neon cards there are other bright decks out there? 
There are other bright  cards that is true but most of them are not true fluorescent, ours is the real thing. Check out our many reviews from the Hermit's Cave , Youtube  and our many customers on Etsy and etc,,. Our cards are the real deal.  We are also experienced working with these incredible inks. 

Second -  The cost of self publishing tarots has gone WAY up. We want to get this project out there while the price is still doable .With the ever increasing cost of postage and materials there is no guarantee we will be able to offer this deck in the future.

Third - Many small businesses are struggling because of the Covid restrictions. We understand a lot of this was necessary to prevent the spreading of the virus however it's been a blow to small independent creators like ourselves who like to offer these unique and experimental tarot decks.

 Again just to make clear , it deserves restating because of the many emails we get after a campaign ends.. The printer orders all the neon ink upfront due to the neon fluorescent / inks being specialized and therefore more costly. In other words, For example If we order 200 decks from the printer, they will only buy enough ink to print those 200. So reserve yours now. 


This will be a limited run. If funding is successful we will add the UV feature.


Thanks for your continued support in these hard times. 
C and J

story:
hello, trekkies!

i wanted to properly honour captain michael burham with a pin, so here we are! i'm so excited for season 4 of disco and the chance to actually see michael in the captain's chair where she belongs. i hope this pin will help us all celebrate that! ALSO EVERYONE GETS A FREE STICKER OF THE PIN DESIGN BECAUSE ILU.

the pin

the captain burnham pin is 2 inches tall. it's an enamel pin made with a combination of hard enamel and silk printing for her facial features and hair, allowing for maximum detail. each pin comes with 2 backing posts and 2 rubber clutches.

funding goals

the initial goal for the michael pin is $400USD for the pins, which will cover the cost of the manufacturing of 50 pins and the mold that they're cast in. (also, indiegogo requires we set the goal at $500CAD.) if we sell more, i can order more! no worries on that front. you'll be charged shipping separately, and i'll do my best to keep shipping as low as i can. US customers can expect around $6-8USD shipping fees. international will be $10-12.

stretch goals

if we raise more than our goal, i have stretch goals planned out! i'm really excited about this, because i love the challenge and the fun of unlocking bonuses as a buyer. 

there's a special pink variant of michael's uniform that will be unlocked, as well as some unlockable add-ons like mini pins. the mini pins are: a special edition 32nd century combadge, a tiny discovery, and a set of stars.

as each stretch goal is reached, you'll be able to add extra pins to your order. the mini pins come in black and pink.

risks & challenges

the only risk here is the timetable! enamel pins are handmade and take time to make. the tentative finish date is late november 2021, shipping december (yes, in time for the holidays!)

if the stretch goals aren't reached, rest assured the michael pin will still be funded, made, and sent to you. our goal here is to get her made — the rest is just extra fun.

post-funding

after the campaign, the burnham pins will be available on my site for a slightly higher price. backers receive a discount!
