story:
8/12/2018

We are no longer taking pre-orders from Indiegogo! Visit our website: www.thebuttresspillow.com for more info and to Grab. That. Butt!!!

The Buttress Pillow along with the Butt Box Set has been finalized and she is even better than our prototype. Production is finished and the Buttress Pillow will launch in early September!!! Claim your butt soon to get first dibs our next batch of the natural, ergonomic, functional and most Bootyful pillow in the world: The Buttress Pillow.

Butts for all,
Jia and the Butt Bringers

----------------------------------

One day not too long ago, while laying down to take a nap after speaking with my  woman, I felt like I would sleep a lot easier if I had my hand placed tenderly on her butt...

Light bulb! How many people in this world like butts? Even children's movies like Minions or Sing feature butts and the kids love it. How many more people would benefit from having a beautiful life size butt nearby as they are laying down getting ready for sleep? To sleep on, to hold, to rest their hand on our even bury their faces in! 

Introducing The Buttress. The ultimate life size natural latex butt pillow and support. It will be available in the Original Double Bubble (ODB) size and if we hit $50,000 of funding, the Oh My God Look at that Butt (OMG) size will be unlocked!! Each Buttress will be made of 100% premium natural latex material and come with a basic black, aqua or white spandex yoga-pant like pillow cover. It includes an adjustable strap for easy carrying and an easy clean Buttress case. Additional colors for pillow cases will be available soon with additional material! Feel free to dress your Buttress with a pair of undies, or any kind of pants as well!!!

The Squeeze

My Twins all tucked in!

 

Everyone in our diverse group of friends smiled when they first beheld the natural, pleasing form of the Buttress. They were pleasantly surprised that it was so comfortable to hold, to slap, to squeeze, to use as a back support and to rest your head on, not just to look at. The 2 part interior design of the Buttress allows the thighs and cheeks to comfortably cradle your head. It's like getting a nice hug for your neck, spine and skull! It's unique shape allows it to be positioned in many different ways to fit its many uses and make it suitable for most kinds of sleepers. There is also a certain indescribable joy that people have reported when they put their faces in it. We've been told 'it's like a kind of magic'. My great friend, Becca Taylor, claims that the Buttress is 'the new teddy bear' as she lifted her face from its soft, smooth cheeks. I personally keep the Buttress on my bed every night and use it all the time! It's functional, ergonomic, fun, natural, elegant and bootyful. What's not to love!

The ODB Buttress is the perfect balance between comfort, function and of course... Booty. We spent months perfecting this piece of Buttech and we want you to experience our baby. With your support, we hope to share The Buttress with the world and help make lives warmer, more fun, playful, comfortable, and help people sleep. With my experience with butts and my connections abroad, Team Buttress and I will produce the highest quality Buttresses. After all, we can never give butts a bad name!

The Final Molding-Ready 3D Buttress!!! Isn't She Gorgeous!!? (There will be a permanent yoga-pant-like covering so your Buttress will NOT look naked)

 

The 1st Edition ODB Buttress is funded and ready for production. We have our costs calculated, our manufacturers ready to go and are creating the final mold right now. This sweet booty is on her way home and she'll be safe on our beds within a few months! To show our thanks and loyalty, we are proud to announce that we will be giving our Buttress Backers an exclusive membership into the Original Butt Fans Club (OBFC) that offers discounts for all Buttress products future, present and forever!!! This club will be for pre-order backers only so that you can give the gift of BOOTY sleep to your friends and family. Support the Buttress for happiness, peace and love... and butts everywhere!

 
 

  

FAQ

Why the Buttress?

In this world of new technologies and complicated issues, I feel like a lot of people just want to go back to the basics. Sometimes people think too much and get too far away from nature.

I know that the Buttress won't cure a terrible disease or be the next level high tech gadget but to me, the Buttress is a classic. It reminds me to appreciate the 'stupid' things, laugh, stop always thinking about what is correct and relax, be one with the universe and to love naturally and honestly. I believe that many people in this fast paced, high stress world of today would benefit from the Buttress and we hope to share it with them.

Friends of the butt

 

This is how I sleep... I got options and you can too!

Who is Jia?

I am Jia, a fan of butts and a motivated professional of 25 years. I am an immigrant and came to the US at 5 years old and am now an American citizen and consider myself as an American. I work as a buyer for an esteemed e-commerce company, graduated from Wake Forest University with a Political Science degree. I produce my own music, do graphics design work for several small businesses and have many connections in China that I can depend on to jump start production. I have lived all over the world in Spain, Italy, China, Singapore working for employers including Save the Children, Holiday Inn, NIDA and taught English and art abroad. I have had a steady girlfriend for the past 2 years and am a zealous admirer of her. She recently moved away and the Buttress with her undies and her favorite perfume, is a great comfort to me. I hope to share the simple, beautiful, stupid, funny and comforting representation of love to the world. 

This is my first crowdfunding project and I know it doesn't have thousands of dollars of marketing material like some of the other projects but the Buttress was created in love and passion and with the help of my girlfriend and my partner, we personally created the video, the photos, the music, everything ourselves. Its always been a dream for me to become an entrepreneur and create things that people will appreciate. I am ready to give the Buttress the devotion and the time that she deserves!

What are the specifications and how is it made?

This is a big butt made out of the highest quality 100% natural latex material! The base is about 14 inches x 15 inches and the crest of the cheek reaches 8 inches!!! There are 2 parts to the design of the Buttress: the cheeks and the thighs. The cheeks are softer than the thighs allowing your head to sink in while the thigh offers neck support. The outer yoga-pant-like Buttress Pillow Case ties together at the top (like the waist tie on trousers) and secures the strap. The adjustable and separable strap allows the thighs to open or close and allows you to dress your Buttress. The total weight is 3 pounds. The Buttress is crafted intuitive, strong and will last you a lifetime.

2 Part Buttech

Why Natural Latex?

After a couple trials, I decided to use natural latex as the main material for the Buttress. Natural latex is made from the sap of trees, very natural, is very high quality, has a close feel to butts and of course is very safe to sleep on unlike some man-made materials like memory foam. The butt is natural so the Buttress will be natural. It is also very comfortable, clean, pure, ergonomic, and durable. You never need to fluff it and it has small holes throughout to keep you cool. It is considered one of the highest quality materials for bedding and pillows.

The natural latex will never come into contact with skin and the protein that causes allergies is almost completely eliminated from the material. It will be protected by 2 layers of cotton and spandex covering. However, if you are highly allergic to latex, the material may still cause discomfort.

What's included in my Butt Box?

Included with the Buttress will be a pillow case with adjustable strap, easily washable, the Mini Buttress Keychain, and a sticker featuring the unique Buttress Logo. Also, included is a discount coupon code for 1 additional pillow case at 50% off! (10 new designs ready to redeem by July 2018) The Butt Box will be an experience from receiving our custom box to unwrapping our neatly designed set and finally, to holding up your new, big and beautiful Buttress and caressing its slopes for the first time.

How do I clean it?

The Buttress is very easy to clean. Simply remove the pillow cover by untying the easy open top, and you can wash the cover in any washing machine! Just like you would wash your clothes.

Our Schedule

We have been working hard to make sure you get your hands on the Buttress ASAP. The final design is already completed and the molding is underway. We plan to have the Buttress delivered before May, but not at the cost of quality. Guaranteed delivery time will be set in June. I will make sure everything from the packaging to the pillow cases to the Buttress itself will make our backers smile and say 'this is even better than I expected!'

The future of the Buttress?

In the future, we want the Buttress to be customizable to match the shape and size of your own butt or the butt of your significant other! Celebrity butts are in the plans as well. There will also be custom pillow cases and many more creative variations. We will maintain the highest quality and comfort and always keep the essentials. Here are our stretch goals!

We'll try our best with the D-O-Double-G :D If not, then Mix-a-Lot is a close second

 

End Note:

We do this for Butt Fans everywhere and deeply appreciate your support. The thing about butts is... that everyone in the whole world has one! And we choose to appreciate this natural and universal wonder that we can't help but love. 

Sincerely,

Jia and the Butt Bringers

story:
Short Summary

I am looking to fund production and fulfillment of a limited edition custom made 1 oz 999 Fine Silver coin

Features hand drawn character artwork with four-leaf clover symbols.

A mint is already lined up and setup artwork being produced. Silver price is locked in at time of agreement.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to get the funding to purchase the silver as well as create the dies needed to form the coins. In return you'll get a limited edition one-of-a-kind Aputannia 2021 coin with a Serial# based on your perk level.

Die Charge - $400, $200 per side. One time charge

Strike Cost - $8.50 per coin

Plastic Capsule - $1.50 per coin

Serialization Cost - $0.10 per coin

Silver Price - Spot price locked in at time of agreement

Plus all applicable fees and taxes

Risks & Challenges

With any manufacturing unexpected delays should be expected (see Suez Canal).

The manufacturer has provided a lead time of 4-6 weeks, plus ship time to me, plus fulfillment time to you.

With a background in manufacturing and fulfillment, I will be in contact with the manufacturer to ensure everything is going smoothly and to provide updates due backers.

Shipping - $6 shipping fee includes USPS First Class Mail $3.30 w/ Signature Confirmation $2.70

Hobby Protection Act Disclaimer
This silver round is not a currency in any country. It is not meant to resemble any actual currency. This is a collectible sold as part of a fundraising event. The round will have a strike date of 2021, reflective of its actual striking date.

story:
The Space Tarot

The Space Tarot brings a retro sci-fi look to the popular Waite Smith card deck. We've created decks inspired by the psychedelic 60's, decks inspired by black light posters, and now we've decided to visit the mysteries of space.

A combination of human astronauts, robot travellers, tentacle armed aliens, reptilian folk, crab clawed visitors from another galaxy and beautiful worlds and planets can be seen throughout the deck.

Despite being given the outer space makeover, the cards will be clearly understandable as to which card they are, and also include the titles so there is no doubt, (titles on the Majors, Aces and Courts)

The decks will consist of 78 cards in total and if fully funded, will guarantee a full color tuck box.

The Cups stay the same, but have taken on a more crystal form.
The Wands stay the same but are multi-colored.
The Swords are still swords but are more "light swords"
The Pentacles have been replaced with meteorites, but will still be named Pentacles for practicality.


 

The Goal
 

The goal is to get the funds to produce a print run of this deck. As always, if you contribute you will recieve the deck at a much discounted price.

By contributing, you help us bring you new and exciting products that we would not be able to do otherwise. Campaigns also help us gage interest in a project. If we can come even close to being fully funded, you're telling us that it's a deck you want to see in our store.

 

Risks & Challenges

There may be some delays in shipping backer rewards, and initial shipment deliveries from the printer due to the ongoing pandemic, but we are confident that if there are delays, they will be managable and not cause significant disruptions. If you were a backer of our Black Light Tarot campaign, you will see that there were not significant delays during that campaign, despite the lockdowns, postal shortages etc.
 

If you find you can't contribute to the campaign, we would very much appreciate it if you could share it on social media, blogs, etc. That will really help us too.
story_txt: The Space TarotThe Space Tarot brings a retro sci-fi look to the popular Waite Smith card deck. We've created decks inspired by the psychedelic 60's, decks inspired by black light posters, and now we've decided to visit the mysteries of space.A combination of human astronauts, robot travellers, tentacle armed aliens, reptilian folk, crab clawed visitors from another galaxy and beautiful worlds and planets can be seen throughout the deck.Despite being given the outer space makeover, the cards will be clearly understandable as to which card they are, and also include the titles so there is no doubt, (titles on the Majors, Aces and Courts)The decks will consist of 78 cards in total and if fully funded, will guarantee a full color tuck box.The Cups stay the same, but have taken on a more crystal form.The Wands stay the same but are multi-colored.The Swords are still swords but are more "light swords"The Pentacles have been replaced with meteorites, but will still be named Pentacles for practicality. The Goal The goal is to get the funds to produce a print run of this deck. If you were a backer of our Black Light Tarot campaign, you will see that there were not significant delays during that campaign, despite the lockdowns, postal shortages etc. If you find you can't contribute to the campaign, we would very much appreciate it if you could share it on social media, blogs, etc. That will really help us too.

story:
Hi! I’m Courtney Blazon–I am an artist from Missoula, Montana.

This campaign is to raise funds for my upcoming show at the Missoula Art Museum in Montana, opening September 22, 2016. This show represents the next level in my artistic evolution, allowing me to fully integrate my love of deep research with my drive to create art that engages people and expresses my love of historical events.

With your help, I will be able to produce my best work yet. Supporting myself as an artist is not easy, and a lot of my time is spent meeting with clients, producing small objects, completing commissions, and selling my work on a one-on-one level. But with this financial support—particularly from this community that has always encouraged me—I will not be stuck pulling all-nighters to make sure my electrical bills are paid, and will be able to give this time and energy that this project deserves.

I need to raise a minimum of $5,000 to make this possible. This will cover the majority of the costs of framing the work for the show. I’ve set my goal at $6,500, because I know that additional expenses and last-minute changes  come up when you least expect it. With that extra cushion, I will be able to sleep soundly at night without worrying about how I am going to feed myself over the winter.


Whatever money I raise will help me to continue to make art. Making the best possible art I can and devoting myself to my work, is what your contribution will allow me to do. Without raising my minimum goal, I will have to fund my entire show out of pocket and take on more commission work—burning my candle at both ends. 


This year I was fortunate to be voted Missoula’s Best Artist in The Independent, something I am thrilled about! I am currently represented by Radius Gallery in Missoula, Montana, and my work has been shown in galleries all across the country–all the way from Missoula and Bozeman to New York, Portland, and San Francisco.

My project is valuable not only to my own artistic growth, but to the art community of Missoula—and ultimately for raising awareness about this fascinating historical event and the echoes of it we are still feeling to this day. 2016 marks the bicentennial anniversary of The Year Without A Summer—the one that followed Tambora’s eruption. That year, 1816, catastrophic weather events were recorded around the world due to an aerosol cloud from the volcano—events that are very similar to what we’re seeing today due to fossil fuel emissions.

In order to produce my best work, I need to focus my energy without the distraction of figuring out where my next check is coming from. I want this show to demonstrate what I am truly capable of, and I want it to speak to people. Opening September 22, 2016, at the Missoula Art Museum, The Year Without A Summer will include approximately 60 pieces of art, ranging from 9" by 12" ink on vellum portraits to 8-foot by 4-foot tableaus in pen and marker integrating the various events that transpired and were inspired by Tambora’s devastation.



I am offering a range of Perks for this campaign, from T-shirts to stickers and much more! Every Perk has been designed to reflect the works and the elements that make up the show. There is so much that is linked to this one fascinating and devastating event: from the birth of Gothic horror literature to the opening of the Northwest Passage. The historical links that I have researched make such a wonderful and  intricate web–I have worked hard to include  the most fascinating aspects of this story in the designs for the Perks, so please check them out!

Thank you for watching my video and checking out my campaign—every donation makes a huge difference to me. If you cannot donate or choose not to donate, please consider telling somebody you know about my project and my goal. The Indiegogo tools make it super simple. And if you are able, please come and see the show! 

Thanks again!

 - Courtney

story:
IMPORTANT SHIPPING INFORMATION !!

Due to VATS and other new laws going into effect in July, I will NOT  be shipping to the UK or the EU through indiegogo! Do not fret, if the project is successful, all unlocked items will be coming to my Etsy shop! Thank you for understanding!

 

Hello, I'm Elizabeth!

  I am an illustrator based out of Pennsylvania who loves creating work around wildlife and cryptozoology. I also run an online shop selling my work as prints, pins, and stickers! This will be my third crowdfunding campaign, this project will be focused on creating a collection of gold-plated hard enamel Cryptid-themed keychains.

   The initial funding goal will unlock the Jackalope Keychain, the stretch goals following this will unlock more keychain designs and other add-on goodies! If we unlock all current stretch goals, I would love to add more.

FINAL DESIGNS ARE SUBJECT TO CHANGE

  • LATE JUNE - Campaign Launch
  • JULY - Campaign Ends & Surveys Sent Out
  • MID-JULY - Campaign funds will be processed after the campaign ends and production will begin.
  • SEPTEMBER 2021/OCTOBER 2021 - Orders will be sent to backers!

To get updates on other projects I am working on check out my Instagram! Check out my Etsy for other items like stickers, prints, & more!

Risks and challenges

This is my third crowdfunding campaign, I am very confident that this project will run smoothly! Due to COVID-19 or other events out of my control production could be delayed for the keychains or other stretch goal items. I am in constant contact with my manufacturers throughout production and will notify you of any issues via updates on the project page. I will do everything in my power to make sure rewards are sent to you in a safe timely fashion. If you need to contact me with any other questions or concerns, feel free to message me and I will get back to you ASAP!

Sustainable Distribution

In an effort to lessen our environmental impact, all orders are being sent out in biodegradable mailers or mailers using recycled materials! Most of our packaging is also focused on using recycled materials and materials that can be recycled by backers when they receive their rewards. We try to use a very minimal amount of plastic.

story:
The Artbook

With your help, I plan to produce “Autonimus Trex Book One,” an art book collecting 20 works as well as additional pages of close-ups offering a closer look the level of detail and texture of the paintings. The finished book will include approximately 40, full-color pages.

The art book will be a signed, full-color, 8.5in x 11in, beautifully printed softcover with a crisp square spine. The high-resolution scans will preserve the texture of the watercolor paper and the look of the originals. If we meet certain stretch goals, additional pages with material like sketches will be included.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise a minimum of $3500 in order to make this project viable. We have a printer, the art, and the technical skills to produce the finished files.

As a supporter of this campaign, you will receive a copy of a very limited edition artbook. You will also have the opportunity to receive additional perks at higher levels of support including sketches and original art.

The Impact

This project started with creating the artwork and led to the building of an online community of fans. Now we have the opportunity to turn this support into an artbook that can become a part of your personal library. A book that will inspire your imagination and bring you joy as you flip through its pages.

The degree to which you support this project will determine the extent of the possibilities for my artwork going forward. I want to have the opportunity to spend more of my time making art and publishing art books. I can't overstate the impact that a massive wave of support for this project will have on my family.

Our Team

My wife and I are both artists and designers. We've self-published, illustrated, lettered, and designed for our own projects and those of others. I’ve worked as an artist creating comics, trading card art, and concept art.

We are organized, driven, and committed to delivering you a book that we hope will be the start of an ongoing publisher/customer relationship. We humbly ask for your support and we value your hard-earned money.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out about this project and thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this artbook.

***STRETCH GOALS***

$8500 STRETCH GOAL - EVERY backer will receive access to an exclusive hour-long instructional video showing how I use opaque watercolors and gouache, as well as the process that I teach my students!

UNLOCKED! $5000 STRETCH GOAL - Everyone’s book will include 10 additional pages and a new section showing my process and materials. This will include new art and increase the book’s page count to 50 pages!

story:
Overview

Following in the footsteps of my first artbook, "Shanth Enjeti Art, Book Two: Rigor Mortrex" showcases the spookier side of my fantasy and science fiction art. My passion for classic horror fiction and visuals and my love of creating detailed and visually rich gouache and watercolor art is fueling a body of work that will make for a worthy collection of art for my second book. With the support of 140 backers, I was able to crowdfund my first artbook on Indiegogo this past March. The final product is now being delivered and came out far beyond my expectations. I have the art, the experience, the printer, and the layouts. Now, all I need is your support!

The Artbook

With your help, I plan to produce "Shanth Enjeti Art, Book Two: Rigor Mortrex," an art book collecting 20 works as well as additional pages of close-ups offering a closer look at the level of detail and texture of the paintings. The finished book will include approximately 40, full-color pages.

The artbook will be a signed, full-color, 8.5in x 11in, beautifully printed softcover with a crisp square spine. The high-resolution scans will preserve the texture of the watercolor paper and the look of the originals. If we meet certain stretch goals, additional pages with material like sketches will be included.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise a minimum of $5000 in order to make this project viable. We have a printer, the art, and the technical skills to produce the finished files. We've already seen our first book through to print and the result was stunning. This book will be no different.

As a supporter of this campaign, you will receive a copy of a very limited edition artbook. You will also have the opportunity to receive additional perks at higher levels of support including sketches and original art.

The Impact

These books started with creating artwork and led to the building of an online community of fans. With your support, we have the opportunity to create an artbook that can make this artwork a part of your personal library. A book that will inspire your imagination and bring you joy as you flip through its pages.

The degree to which you support this project will determine the extent of the possibilities for my artwork going forward. I want to have the opportunity to spend more of my time making art and publishing art books. I can't overstate the impact that a massive wave of support for this project will have on my family.

Our Team

My wife and I are both artists and designers. We've self-published, illustrated, lettered, and designed for our own projects and those of others. I’ve worked as an artist creating comics, trading card art, and concept art.

We are organized, driven, and committed to delivering you a book that we hope will be the start of an ongoing publisher/customer relationship. We humbly ask for your support and we value your hard-earned money.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out about this project and thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this artbook.

story:
Summary of Project

“Let the children come to me, and do not prevent them; for the kingdom of heaven belongs to such as these.” (Matthew 19:14)

Be part of history! To our knowledge and research, this painting entitled "Let the Children of Divorce Come to Me" by the artist Michael Corsini, commissioned by the independent, non-profit Life-Giving Wounds, will be the first-ever Christian sacred art meant specifically for the healing of the one million plus children and adult children a year that suffer through their parents' divorce or separation (in the United States alone - as there are millions more each year throughout the world). These children need beauty in their lives that speaks to the heart of their experience and offers a restorative and healing experience.  

This painting will be a dialogue with modern art and in particular Picasso's masterpiece The Tragedy, which profoundly and deeply captures brokenness in family life. One interpretation of Picasso's painting could be that the family is suffering the hardship of alienation, separation, or divorce within family life. However, Picasso never revealed what the particular tragedy is. Here in our new painting, the parents are now not even facing in each other's direction, as in Picasso's painting, depicting a certain finality of their broken relationship through divorce. Yet the new painting does not just depict the pain, but also hope for the children and the family.

It depicts Christ on the same beach as Picasso's Tragedy, yet Christ walks on the ocean water, stepping towards the child, who also takes a step toward him. Christ lovingly receives the child and gently lifts the child's head to meet his eyes. Without saying a word, Christ's gaze says to the child all that is needed for him to hear in his heart as a warm, gentle light is cast from Christ's wounded hand into the hand of the child, and then to his parents and beyond. The child's open hand is a gesture full of rich symbolism; one meaning can be that of openness and love towards his parents. Likewise, the parents' expressions are full of various, diverse meanings; one of which can be that they are interested in what is happening with the child and are subtly drawn, almost mysteriously, into this healing and compassion between the child and Christ. 

This art was born from many conversations over the years we have had with adult children of divorce, processing and grieving their pain and experiencing their joy of healing together side-by-side in our ministry. We have learned through this ministry that we need tangible reminders of God's invisible love for us and we hope this art is one of those tangible means for all of us children of divorce. We pray this art makes children of divorce feel less invisible and more seen, and ultimately inspired, comforted, and healed in many ways we can't even anticipate through this artwork.  

This sacred art will be available as prints and used on a unique prayer card with an original prayer composed by our ministry. The text of this original prayer is listed in the images above.

Help our non-profit Life-Giving Wounds make this painted, sacred encounter a real-life encounter in the lives of children of divorce through the mass production and distribution of this beautifully, unique artwork and prayer card.

WHO WE ARE: LIFE-GIVING WOUNDS

Life-Giving Wounds is an independent 501(c)3 non-profit that exists to give voice to the pain of adult children of divorce and to bring Christ's healing to them through peer-based retreats, support groups, resources, social media, and more. 

Dr. Daniel and Bethany Meola are the founders and directors of Life-Giving Wounds. Dan is an adult child of divorce and holds a PhD from the John Paul II Institute in D.C.; Bethany has a master's degree from the Institute (which is where they met). The Meolas live in Maryland with their two young daughters.

WHO WE ARE:  MICHAEL CORSINI

Michael Corsini is a painter and illustrator, with a BFA in Illustration from Ringling School of Art and Design and an MTS from the John Paul II Institute in D.C.  

Michael believes that beautiful sacred art is both prophetic and healing.  He also believes that art is an essential part of the Church’s proclamation of the Gospel.  Michael often says, “The spiritual healing and renewal needed in our time, begins through an encounter with Beauty; the kind of beauty that reveals Christ, and allows for Him to do His Work.”     

Michael currently lives in Northeast Pennsylvania with his wife and five young children, where they are growing a small family farm.

Goal

We need $7,500 for the mass production, distribution, and marketing of this image in various print sizes (including as a unique prayer card in both English and Spanish) so that we can distribute and sell it to as many children of divorce as possible. What you get is a copy of the image for yourself and other goodies (depending on your contribution), and the ability to join us in this mission! 

Our extended goal is $20,000, at which point everyone who funds at any level will receive a free pack of 50 Holy Cards. This extended goal will help us further in the above costs, will support the mission work of Life-Giving Wounds, and will go towards planning and hosting events with the image, including to groups that cannot otherwise afford to host events with us, such as inner-city young adults.

Any extra money raised will go towards these same goals, and will further extend our reach with the image to touch a larger audience.

 

Risks & Challenges

This is a very low risk project. Through a generous benefactor, we’ve already secured funding for the artist Michael Corsini's time and supplies to create the original painting, so the pre-ordered prints you order will go out no matter what. The only risk is that if we don't hit our goal, then we won't be able to market, mass produce, and distribute the image as prints as we would like to do so in order to reach as many children of divorce as we would like. And we wouldn't be able to travel or do events as widely as we hope with the image. However, we feel very confident that we will be able to raise enough money to at least make the image available as a prayer card in both English and Spanish, which is on the lower side of costs to produce.

The other challenge is that we will be handling all of the prints ourselves as an independent non-profit from working with the printers and a small fulfillment company to deliver them to you. This may extend the timeline on delivery of prints, but we will personally vouch for each patron's order to be completed if you donate to this project. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to support the project but can't financially back the project, there are other ways you can help me reach my goal. These include:

Share the project on Facebook and Instagram using our social media posts on those platforms.

Share our non-profit ministry page found on Facebook and Instagram.

Send the project to specific people who you think would be interested in it or benefit from it.

Share our webpage www.lifegivingwounds.org 

Thank you for your support!
story_txt:
Summary of Project
“Let the children come to me, and do not prevent them; for the kingdom of heaven belongs to such as these.” (Matthew 19:14)
Be part of history! To our knowledge and research, this painting entitled "Let the Children of Divorce Come to Me" by the artist Michael Corsini, commissioned by the independent, non-profit Life-Giving Wounds, will be the first-ever Christian sacred art meant specifically for the healing of the one million plus children and adult children a year that suffer through their parents' divorce or separation (in the United States alone - as there are millions more each year throughout the world). These children need beauty in their lives that speaks to the heart of their experience and offers a restorative and healing experience.  
This painting will be a dialogue with modern art and in particular Picasso's masterpiece The Tragedy, which profoundly and deeply captures brokenness in family life. One interpretation of Picasso's painting could be that the family is suffering the hardship of alienation, separation, or divorce within family life. However, Picasso never revealed what the particular tragedy is. Here in our new painting, the parents are now not even facing in each other's direction, as in Picasso's painting, depicting a certain finality of their broken relationship through divorce. Yet the new painting does not just depict the pain, but also hope for the children and the family.
It depicts Christ on the same beach as Picasso's Tragedy, yet Christ walks on the ocean water, stepping towards the child, who also takes a step toward him. Christ lovingly receives the child and gently lifts the child's head to meet his eyes. Without saying a word, Christ's gaze says to the child all that is needed for him to hear in his heart as a warm, gentle light is cast from Christ's wounded hand into the hand of the child, and then to his parents and beyond. The child's open hand is a gesture full of rich symbolism; one meaning can be that of openness and love towards his parents. Likewise, the parents' expressions are full of various, diverse meanings; one of which can be that they are interested in what is happening with the child and are subtly drawn, almost mysteriously, into this healing and compassion between the child and Christ. 
This art was born from many conversations over the years we have had with adult children of divorce, processing and grieving their pain and experiencing their joy of healing together side-by-side in our ministry. We have learned through this ministry that we need tangible reminders of God's invisible love for us and we hope this art is one of those tangible means for all of us children of divorce. We pray this art makes children of divorce feel less invisible and more seen, and ultimately inspired, comforted, and healed in many ways we can't even anticipate through this artwork.  
This sacred art will be available as prints and used on a unique prayer card with an original prayer composed by our ministry. The text of this original prayer is listed in the images above.
Help our non-profit Life-Giving Wounds make this painted, sacred encounter a real-life encounter in the lives of children of divorce through the mass production and distribution of this beautifully, unique artwork and prayer card.
WHO WE ARE: LIFE-GIVING WOUNDS
Life-Giving Wounds is an independent 501(c)3 non-profit that exists to give voice to the pain of adult children of divorce and to bring Christ's healing to them through peer-based retreats, support groups, resources, social media, and more. 
Dr. Daniel and Bethany Meola are the founders and directors of Life-Giving Wounds. Dan is an adult child of divorce and holds a PhD from the John Paul II Institute in D.C.; Bethany has a master's degree from the Institute (which is where they met). The Meolas live in Maryland with their two young daughters.
WHO WE ARE:  MICHAEL CORSINI
Michael Corsini is a painter and illustrator, with a BFA in Illustration from Ringling School of Art and Design and an MTS from the John Paul II Institute in D.C.  
Michael believes that beautiful sacred art is both prophetic and healing.  He also believes that art is an essential part of the Church’s proclamation of the Gospel.  Michael often says, “The spiritual healing and renewal needed in our time, begins through an encounter with Beauty; the kind of beauty that reveals Christ, and allows for Him to do His Work.”     
Michael currently lives in Northeast Pennsylvania with his wife and five young children, where they are growing a small family farm.

Goal
We need $7,500 for the mass production, distribution, and marketing of this image in various print sizes (including as a unique prayer card in both English and Spanish) so that we can distribute and sell it to as many children of divorce as possible. What you get is a copy of the image for yourself and other goodies (depending on your contribution), and the ability to join us in this mission! 
Our extended goal is $20,000, at which point everyone who funds at any level will receive a free pack of 50 Holy Cards. This extended goal will help us further in the above costs, will support the mission work of Life-Giving Wounds, and will go towards planning and hosting events with the image, including to groups that cannot otherwise afford to host events with us, such as inner-city young adults.
Any extra money raised will go towards these same goals, and will further extend our reach with the image to touch a larger audience.
 

Risks & Challenges
This is a very low risk project. Through a generous benefactor, we’ve already secured funding for the artist Michael Corsini's time and supplies to create the original painting, so the pre-ordered prints you order will go out no matter what. The only risk is that if we don't hit our goal, then we won't be able to market, mass produce, and distribute the image as prints as we would like to do so in order to reach as many children of divorce as we would like. And we wouldn't be able to travel or do events as widely as we hope with the image. However, we feel very confident that we will be able to raise enough money to at least make the image available as a prayer card in both English and Spanish, which is on the lower side of costs to produce.
The other challenge is that we will be handling all of the prints ourselves as an independent non-profit from working with the printers and a small fulfillment company to deliver them to you. This may extend the timeline on delivery of prints, but we will personally vouch for each patron's order to be completed if you donate to this project. 
 
Other Ways You Can HelpIf you want to support the project but can't financially back the project, there are other ways you can help me reach my goal. These include:Share the project on Facebook and Instagram using our social media posts on those platforms.Share our non-profit ministry page found on Facebook and Instagram.Send the project to specific people who you think would be interested in it or benefit from it.Share our webpage www.lifegivingwounds.org Thank you for your support!

story:
“To him who thirsts I will give of the fountain of the water of life freely.” – Revelation 21:6

St. Joseph, Father of All, is a painting by Michael Corsini.  It is a depiction of the first approved vision of St. Joseph by a shepherd in France.   Read the story here!  

On June 7th 1660, a 22 year old shepherd named Gaspard Ricard, was herding his sheep on Mount Bessillon in France. Around 1pm the heat grew stronger and harder to bear. Gaspard became very tired and thirsty, so he decided to lay upon the rocky ground for a rest.  Suddenly a tall man stood next to him and pointed to a nearby rock saying: “I am Joseph, lift the rock and you will drink.” The startled young man saw that the large rock looked heavy, asking how he would move it alone as it would take about eight men to move it. St Joseph again said, “lift the rock and you will drink.” Gaspard rose and obeyed. He moved the rock and found fresh water flowing from underneath. He began to drink but when he looked up, found that St Joseph had disappeared. He ran into town exclaiming this news to the villagers and within three hours the small spring of water had become a fountain of abundant water.

BIO

My name is Michael Corsini and I am a painter.  I am a husband, to my beautiful wife Jessie, and father of five little ones.  I have been creating works of art for healing and renewal for nearly two decades.  I have a BFA from Ringling School of Art and Design as well as a MTS from the John Paul Institute for Studies on Marriage and Family.  I also spent 5 years in temporary vows as a member of the Franciscan Friars of the Renewal, in discernment of religious life and the priesthood.  Accordingly I have a deep love for fatherhood!  I believe this painting will bring healing and renewal to people of all backgrounds but is especially dedicated to those who are husbands and fathers (natural or supernatural). My intention is to bring the painting to parishes all over the country to lead people in prayer and musical holy hours for the restoration of fatherhood.  Will you join me In this mission?  

 

GOAL

I need to gather at least $5,000 to get this project funded… that’s mostly supplies and time. What you get is a copy for yourself and other goodies (depending on your contribution), and the ability to join me in this mission!   My extended goal is $10000, at which point everyone, who funds at any level, will receive a free pack of (50) Holy Cards.  More importantly, this goal will allow me to travel with the image to parishes that can not afford to host the event!    

 

Risks & Challenges

My biggest challenge is that I am doing this on my own… (well with lots of moral support from my kids!) I will be handling all the prints and fulfilling orders myself. I’ll be personally working with the printers, doing the packaging, and in some form, delivering them to you. This will extend the timeline on delivery, but I will personally vouch for each patrons’ order! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to support the project but can't financially back the project, there are other ways you can help me reach my goal. These include:

Share the project on Facebook and Instagram

Share my artwork found on Facebook and Instagram

Send the project to specific people who you think would be interested in it

www.michaelcorsini.com

Thank you for your support!

 

Stretch Goals

$7,500 - Most Chaste Heart of Joseph print!  

$10,000 - To be Announced!  

 

Samples of Recent Work

story:
My name's Verena, I'm a professional photographer living in Munich, Germany. Five years ago I first got in touch with Burlesque when I attended a workshop at a dance studio. A little while later I did a photographic exhibition about Munich's Burlesque performers that was very well received. At that time Burlesque already had me hooked and I even started to perform as well. The more shows I saw, the more performers I met and the more I learned about Burlesque, the more I fell in love with the art form.

Burlesque has made my life so much more fun and I've made it my mission to teach as many people as possible what I've learned through Burlesque and introduce the world to the wonderful performers I've met. 

What is Burlesque? Well, if you ask ten different performers, you'll probably get ten different answers. My answer is: Burlesque is a performing artform that is open to people of all genders, races, body types and ages. It is about loving who you are, making an enormous effort to create your own world for the five minutes that you are on stage and sharing that world with the audience. And about glitter, of course.

By preordering the book and supporting this campaign, you are helping me to bring my vision of a lovingly produced photo book about 48 of Germany's best Burlesque performers to life.

I've spent my last money on travelling around Germany and photographing burlesque performers. But to have the first 250 copies of the book printed in high quality and to make the book available on Amazon, I need 7.700 € - that's were you come in.

Here's in detail what I need the money for:

- editorial office (for the texts that go with the pictures; all texts will be in english)

- graphic design (I want to hire my favourite Burlesque-flyer-designer)

- ISBN registration

- printing & binding the book (with some extra glitter on the cover, wooohooo!)

- Indiegogo- & Paypal-fees

- taxes

- shipping

What you can expect from the book:

- foreword by Berlin's Burlesque-mama Lady Lou

- photos of 48 of Germany's best Burlesque performers (1 portrait in their stage costume, 1 portrait with their everyday look & 1 photo of the performer on stage plus a personal text)

- backstage photos

Should the fundraising goal be exceeded, the extra money would be used to include more stories in the book, for example about Burlesque costumes and -makeup.

Performers in the book (in alphabetical order):

Aphrodite DeVine

Bana Banana

Belle La Donna

Betty Badda-Boo

Champagne Sparkles

ChiChi Bouvet

Clea Cutthroat

Coco Clownesse

David Pereira

Diva DeSaster

Dixie Dynamite

Erochica Bamboo

Eve Champagne

Evilyn Frantic

Ferkel Johnson

Frau Pepper

Ginger Synne

Golden Treasure

Greta Qamar

Hedoluxe

Honey Lulu

Hurricane Irina

Jack Woodhead

Julietta LaDoll

Koko LaDouce

La Viola Vixen

Lada Redstar

Lady Lou

Lilly Tiger

The Lipsi Lillies

Mademoiselle Parfait de la Neige

Mama Ulita

Marlene von Steenvag

Melody D'Amour

Nick Naughty

Orphelia DeWinter

Rose Rainbow

Rosie Riot

Roxy Diamond

Sandy Beach

Scotty the Blue Bunny

Sheila Wolf

Stormy Heather

Sweet Chili

Tara LaLuna

Tronicat La Miez

Xarah von den Vielenregen 

Other ways to help

If you're short on money you can still help me out by sharing this campaign online and telling people about it. You can use the social media tools under the video.

Risks and Challenges

If I don't reach my fundraising goal I would have to produce a low budget-version of the book.

story:
Please read entire description for complete info, and check out the FAQ section! <3

(6/01/21) Second Stretch Goal Announcement - $1200 USD raised will mean everyone who’s backed above the ‘supporter’ tier will receive a 2x2” machine-embroidered patch of the requiem album print for free!!

(05/26/21) Stretch Goal Announcement - $800 USD raised will mean everyone who’s supported above the ‘supporter’ tier will be given a additional brand-new Doctor Carmilla print - drawn by myself - free!

 

About Me!

Hello, My name is Isabel! I'm a genderqueer artist specializing in character illustration and concepts. I run a small online shop over at https://ko-fi.com/stolenstardust offering commissions and official Dr. Carmilla prints in collaboration with Maki Yamazaki.

 

About This Campaign!

This campaign will help me fund high quality, gold foil accented postcard prints of a recent Dr. Carmilla release cover art design that I co-created with Maki, as shown above. It will also allow fans of the Dr. Carmilla series to receive exclusive prints signed by both myself and Maki! 

These prints will hopefully be up on my store at some point in the future, though without the opportunity to get them signed, receive bonus prints, and shop discounts.  My store will also be selling them at a slightly higher price than what they will be here.

This campaign is currently set to run for two weeks but may be extended if interest is still high!

About The 吸血鬼のｒｅｑｕｉｅm Prints!

Let's get into specifics! 

What makes these prints so special is their aforementioned gold foil accents - gorgeous, slightly raised sections of the piece that really pop. The surface of the gold foil side is extra smooth without being glossy. The back of the print will be an identical version of the front, minus the gold foil, if you happen to prefer that.

The size of these prints will be 4.72 x 4.72 inches - similar in size to an A6 print, though obviously with different proportions. Perfect for making wall collages, putting in a small picture frame for display, or hanging on a magnetic surface!

 

What I Need

Indiegogo requires the campaign to be set at a minimum goal of $500.

The minimum amount I would like to raise is $125. This is a flexible funding campaign, meaning that orders will still be fulfilled even if the minimum amount of $125 is not reached!

Reaching $125 will cover not only the initial order price, but also helps towards the cost of transporting the signed prints, postage materials for sending out orders, and cover the Indiegogo fees.

All extra funds received will be used to expand my shop's available products!

 

What You Can Get!

Here's some examples of what donating to this campaign could get you:

  • Exclusive signed gold foil 吸血鬼のｒｅｑｕｉｅｍ prints
  • Discounted 'standard' Dr. Carmilla prints
  • Potential discounts on future orders from my shop
  • Free shipping on some campaign-placed orders
  • Free art from myself

...and more!

Choosing Additional Standard Prints

 

 

In the event that you choose an add-on perk that allows you to receive a standard print (aka a non-album cover print), please reference the photo above so you know which ones you are choosing!

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

Sharing this campaign and my social media links would be an immense help to not only reaching this campaign goal, but to expanding my reach as an independent artist looking to make a living from doing what I love.

Twitter: https://twitter.com/stolen_stardust

Ko-Fi (shop, commissions, and more): https://ko-fi.com/stolenstardust

Carrd (main 'hub', visual arts portfolio, business contact, past creative experiences): https://stolenstardust.carrd.co

story:
Glass in The Glassary

This project has been in my mind for a long time now, so I’m very excited to finally reveal it to you. The idea has been growing over the past few years but was put on hold due to Covid-19, although this did give me a chance to further evolve and diversify it.

My aim is to develop my glass art studio, A Touch of Glass Studio, which is nestled in the heart of a small Scottish Glen, Kilmichael Glassary. I've been working with glass for over  20 years now, six of which were from my existing studio. The space has become a little tired and I have outgrown it somewhat, so I am in need of more space and some extra equipment. 

This year has understandably caused a huge shift in the way we work, with sales predominantly online now, so I need somewhere to store this work, whilst still having room to create my bespoke pieces and customer commissions. I also have some valuable equipment in storage that a fellow glass artist donated to me when she retired. More space would allow me to install this equipment, which includes another kiln, enabling me to develop this space further into an area specifically designed around the growing needs of the studio.

The day to day needs of the business are not the only reason why I hope to expand, I have several plans for the new space that I can now reveal and cover in more detail below.

Throughout my career I’ve taken part in several community art projects, and I strongly believe these types of projects are more important now than ever. I hope to use the new space to run community art projects and workshops, specifically designed with plenty of room for everyone to be able to come and take part together.

Mental health, art and nature are all very closely related, and I feel very passionate about opening up a creative space surrounded by nature to offer a mindful experience and relief from a crazy world. Something that everyone can benefit from, whilst enjoying being part of something, all within a safe and inspiring environment.

So far I have secured some funding from Business Gateway to develop the business side of this project through their Local Growth Accelerator Program, and my studio has also secured help in the form of a loan from SJ Noble Trust. I feel incredibly honored to have secured this financial backing from both bodies, all of which is helping to contribute towards my goal.

It is, however, a big project and we have a shortfall in funds, mainly for kitting out the space to function for more than just myself. The aim is to be able to offer a space that is safe for all, not only from possible accidents in a workspace but also with Covid-19 social distancing in mind, and to meet current government guidelines.

The year of 2020 has been monumental for my studio, which has had an unprecedented amount of support from the community during these uncertain times. This in turn encourages me to give back to the community more than ever, to offer somewhere for everyone to have a safe space to create and enjoy. 

I look at the project as more of a chance to invest in us, rather than looking for donations. We have various rewards that are available, and funds raised from these rewards will be invested into the project. Saying that, donations are gratefully, very welcome no matter the size, as it all adds up and helps contribute towards the end goal. You can support us in other ways too,share the project, talk to people about it, and maybe you have skills to offer that can help with the project or events that will hopefully take place in the future too!

 

The campaign is an all or nothing, so if we don't reach our target, within 50 days from launch, the rewards are returned. If the target is reached, not only will I be happy dancing for weeks, but the development can begin! This is when your rewards will be created and sent to you, many of which are in form of gift experiences that you will be able to use once the development is complete and operational, which I am hoping will be by early summer 2021.

 

Thank you for taking the time to look at our story and here is to a lighter and brigter 2021,

Kirsty
story_txt: Glass in The GlassaryThis project has been in my mind for a long time now, so I’m very excited to finally reveal it to you. The idea has been growing over the past few years but was put on hold due to Covid-19, although this did give me a chance to further evolve and diversify it.My aim is to develop my glass art studio, A Touch of Glass Studio, which is nestled in the heart of a small Scottish Glen, Kilmichael Glassary. I've been working with glass for over  20 years now, six of which were from my existing studio. The space has become a little tired and I have outgrown it somewhat, so I am in need of more space and some extra equipment. This year has understandably caused a huge shift in the way we work, with sales predominantly online now, so I need somewhere to store this work, whilst still having room to create my bespoke pieces and customer commissions. I also have some valuable equipment in storage that a fellow glass artist donated to me when she retired. More space would allow me to install this equipment, which includes another kiln, enabling me to develop this space further into an area specifically designed around the growing needs of the studio.The day to day needs of the business are not the only reason why I hope to expand, I have several plans for the new space that I can now reveal and cover in more detail below.Throughout my career I’ve taken part in several community art projects, and I strongly believe these types of projects are more important now than ever. I hope to use the new space to run community art projects and workshops, specifically designed with plenty of room for everyone to be able to come and take part together.Mental health, art and nature are all very closely related, and I feel very passionate about opening up a creative space surrounded by nature to offer a mindful experience and relief from a crazy world. Something that everyone can benefit from, whilst enjoying being part of something, all within a safe and inspiring environment.So far I have secured some funding from Business Gateway to develop the business side of this project through their Local Growth Accelerator Program, and my studio has also secured help in the form of a loan from SJ Noble Trust. I feel incredibly honored to have secured this financial backing from both bodies, all of which is helping to contribute towards my goal.It is, however, a big project and we have a shortfall in funds, mainly for kitting out the space to function for more than just myself. The aim is to be able to offer a space that is safe for all, not only from possible accidents in a workspace but also with Covid-19 social distancing in mind, and to meet current government guidelines.The year of 2020 has been monumental for my studio, which has had an unprecedented amount of support from the community during these uncertain times. This in turn encourages me to give back to the community more than ever, to offer somewhere for everyone to have a safe space to create and enjoy. I look at the project as more of a chance to invest in us, rather than looking for donations. We have various rewards that are available, and funds raised from these rewards will be invested into the project. Saying that, donations are gratefully, very welcome no matter the size, as it all adds up and helps contribute towards the end goal. You can support us in other ways too,share the project, talk to people about it, and maybe you have skills to offer that can help with the project or events that will hopefully take place in the future too! The campaign is an all or nothing, so if we don't reach our target, within 50 days from launch, the rewards are returned. If the target is reached, not only will I be happy dancing for weeks, but the development can begin! This is when your rewards will be created and sent to you, many of which are in form of gift experiences that you will be able to use once the development is complete and operational, which I am hoping will be by early summer 2021. Thank you for taking the time to look at our story and here is to a lighter and brigter 2021,Kirsty

story:
MARTIAL ART:

A PICTORIAL HISTORY OF BRUCEPLOITATION POSTERS

 

What is Bruceploitation anyway?

In 1971, martial arts icon Bruce Lee exploded on the cinema scene like a meteor and then would pass through it just as quickly.  His impact and popularity in action cinema is almost unparalleled by any other film actor, which is why the effort to fill the vacuum left by his absence is also unrivaled by any other genre.   Capitalized on by shrewdly thinking producers and hastily constructed films, the genre that would later be dubbed "Bruceploitation" would thrive for nearly a decade.   

Titles such as The Dragon Lives, Bruce Lee's Deadly Kung Fu, Bruce Lee Fights Back from the Grave and Enter the Game of Death flooded the "grindhouse" cinemas to nourish the martial arts starved public.  The campaigns and imagery were intended to both confuse and entice the audience with films that may have either featured the "King of Kung Fu" or at least have been supported by his presence, fighting philosophy or even students in some fashion.

Within many of these bizarre and in some ways unique productions were a plethora of artists and future stars making their early marks in martial arts cinema history.   Chuck Norris, Yuen Woo Ping, Lo Meng, Sammo Hung and Jackie Chan to name just a few would cut their action teeth on this sub-genre of Hong Kong and Taiwan cinema.

But the exploitation of cinema's Kung Fu icon was not exclusive to the production's screenplay or leading actors as it can be argued that some of the most colorful and blatant examples were in the film's advertising:

THE MOVIE POSTER 

These tools of the trade, the loud and splashy advertising campaigns, have in recent years become a focus for both art exhibits and many collectors of cinema history, art and pop culture.  

Creative and even at times shameless, the publicity pushes would feature well known artists (Neal Adams, etc.,), misleading text and even images from Bruce Lee's own films to convey their tone.  These colorful treasures continue to fascinate older fans of the genre and even serve as vintage art decor in homes and offices for the newly initiated connoisseurs of pop culture art.  Unfortunately, like the original celluloid elements to the films themselves, the posters and lobby cards have become scarcer and scarcer over the decades with no effort to any quality conserved format.  

MARTIAL ART: A PICTORIAL HISTORY OF BRUCEPLOITATION POSTERS

This book will seek to take a nearly 40 year old collection of posters and advertising, many of them obtained by actor/filmmaker/martial artist Michael Worth as a young movie going genre fan.  In most cases, the art work on display is directly from the theaters that showcased them in their initial showings in Oakland and San Francisco, California where Worth would collect them after each run of the features.  Bound in a beautiful large coffee-table style hardcover book, each poster will get special attention along with a brief description and even personal history.  Not only will the book be a beautiful and fun way to enjoy and study this decade of cinema history, but will help to preserve many of these rare posters in high definition scans on beautiful thick art-book paper. 

These books will be produced in limited qualities, catering to the collector and the fans wishing to own reproductions of these posters in their own book library.  There will be the option for donors to obtain an exclusive signed version of the book only available to the indiegogo backers.  An accompanying book by Michael Worth (The Bruceploitation Bible) that exhaustively covers the history of the genre along with his personal recollections of growing up on these films, is also in the printing phase and will be released in 2020, serving as a great companion to this release. 

(a small sampling of the posters, lobby cards, stills, etc., where the material will be drawn from)

What We Need & What You Get

Here is how the funding is directed:

We will take the stored 200 plus poster collection and pick the best, the most provocative and most rare posters of the lot.  Each delicate poster will be scanned by a qualified printer in High Definition Raw images and prepared for publication in a manner standard in the publishing industry.  The images will be arranged on the highest and most professional quality materials,  bound and ready for impressive display and proud ownership of any cinephile, film art fans and martial arts devotees.  Think the style of books produced by Taschen Publishing. 

Proper scanning and organizing of all the library of images: $1,400

The book printing for 150 full color books between 150-170 pages on #80 to #105 paper weight will be around $4,900.

Expendables: $600

Each poster image printed in the book will also include information on the release as well as a small commentary on the poster's history, art and other notable aspects.  (NOTE:  COVER BEING USED FOR DEMONSTRATION PURPOSES ONLY.  The final cover will be different).

                                          (Book Cover example is not final)

Author and contributor Michael Worth will write a lengthy introduction to the book about the history of the posters within and will personally help sort and arrange the advertising art and the chapters.  Other contributors are lined up to add both commentary and even material to the book's contents.

PERKS

Perks will begin with catering to the simple curiosity seekers who want private emailed updates on the book's process all the way up to larger donors who will receive the signed numbered editions paired with actual original posters from the collection!  And even a few signed items by the genre's most notable stars and the piece de resistance, an owned personal photo by the man that started it all: Bruce Lee!  We are making an effort to preserve and share these wild works of cinema art and exploitation with a generation of fans and collectors alike.  

The donations received will cover the labor and material costs of caring, transporting and photographing the posters for printing.  The rest will fund working with a proper publishing house to keep this unique art book affordable but beautifully produced to show off to friends and admirers alike.  Our stretch goals if attained will be split between creating more books available and fitting more material into the volume itself.

Preserving the History of Bruceploitation 

(The Lux theater in its heyday, where many of the posters in this book originated)

These film posters like the actual 35mm celluloid they represent are fading to the basement of history with little effort maintaining them in a form that modern fandom can continue to relish.  Worth and a team of others in his group have spent the last 7 years trying to save and restore actual film elements for future generations (upcoming blu-ray restorations on the schedule).  These posters are no different in their importance to the genre and its history.  

Like the spaghetti westerns and Blaxploitation films of that era, Bruceploitation is a widely under studied and only recently appreciated film genre that is still an important part of cinema's past.   This book is an attempt to chronicle and preserve one of the more conspicuous aspects of this bygone movie viewing era so they don't vanish with the silver screen they once played in.

(The former Lux Theater in Oakland, California where it is now a second hand clothing store)

We are making the effort to try and save as much of what is left of this misrepresented genre with all its outrageous bluster for future fans and aficionados.  This book is as much an effort to secure the fading and fragile posters of history as it is an effort to create a fun and entertaining visual experience for old and new fans alike.  

If you are unable to contribute to the campaign, please pass us around!   Let those know we are here to try and share a four decade collection of Kung Fu cinema history with the world.  Use the share tools on the page to get out on Twitter, Facebook and even instagram!   

Thanks for looking and hope to be sharing with you very soon!

(Actor and Kung Fu star Bruce Li looking over many of the posters being used in the book with Michael Worth and crew, 2017)

story:
Artists as Art

Art always looks good. In 2021, it will never look better. After a challenging 2020, we’re unwrapping a shiny new show: Clique21, bringing together 21 of southern New Jersey’s most talented and provocative artists and photographers.

By and for South Jersey

It was created by and for the southern New Jersey arts community. Together, the artists and photographers live and work in all eight counties of southern New Jersey; Atlantic, Burlington, Camden, Cape May, Cumberland, Gloucester, Ocean and Salem.


As with the 2016 debut event, Clique21 aims to shine a spotlight on the creative force that drives the arts in South Jersey, the artists. The show will provide both superb documentary photos to the artists and striking portfolio opportunities to the photographers. 


A production of ArtC and Strobe NJ,  Clique21 continues the tradition, with 21 of the region’s most celebrated photographers and artists in a 2021 show. Five photographers will create portraits of 16 visual and performing artists.

Budget

The show will cost approximately $15,785, to cover:

Photography fees

Artists’ stipends

Professional framing with conservatory glass 

Archival photo printing  

Promotion and marketing

Project management

Opening receptions

 

Clique21 will nourish the local economy. ArtC  has contracted exclusively with local printers, framers, caterers and other professionals to produce and promote the show. More importantly, as with the 2016 premiere event, it will boost morale and pride in the South Jersey art community.


If we raise more than the $15,000, the surplus will be used to create a fund to help South Jersey artists ready their art for exhibition, with framing and other preparation required to meet professional gallery standards. 

Please share!

Please share this campaign to your friends and social networks—and thank you for your continued support of the arts in southern New Jersey.

story:
I am Tukwasiibwe Kennedy male Ugandan aged 21 years. Am staying in Kabale, Uganda based in East Africa.

I am a student at Kyambogo University located in Kampala, Uganda. I am of recent carrying out “Computer Graphics Design Course” which I am very interested in because of its high reasoning and creativity in it.

About the Campaign.

The reason for rising up the “Fine Art and Graphic Designs improving lives” campaign are genuine; the Campaign first and foremost is about how one especially the Artists and Graphic designers can use their talents to develop or be more creative. This is where there’s the aid of electronic devices like computers, printers, scanners and materials for producing Fine Art and graphic design products like, t-shirts, banners, flyers, calendars, logos, stickers and among many others. Graphic designs are first drawn with the aim of sketching and use of art pencils. After the sketches are transferred to the computer by the aid of the scanners to scan the images drawn in pencil into software to improve them into digital format. Some of the software include:

Adobe Photoshop, In-design and adobe illustrator.

I have only got the old laptop which am using for the work that am designing for my clients, which work at the same time is also difficult for me because of not having enough equipment and people to work on them I am forced to take the work in software format to others to finish for me thus making me lose some of the profits and time. It also makes me lose some of the customers. The profits from the business I use in paying partly to my tuition and other necessities in addition to what my parents contribute to for me for tuition, accommodation and other necessities. When I get the support I am requesting for I will be able to purchase the necessary equipment and complete my work myself thus saving more time and money. I will also be able to work with my course mates who will also be able to get income and foundation for self employment after university. I also do fine art with my hand. It is these fine artworks and graphically designed ones that will too compose perks to you my contributors.

I have premise I am renting and am working from.

My works and orders from my customers depict daily life situations such as; climate change, protection of the environment, water and sanitation, human and animal rights, health eating and living, poverty eradication etc.

Necessities of the campaign.

I need some of the equipment to set up the Fine Art  and Graphic Design studio. The equipment for the studio  are as below:

  • Computer set                             Uganda Shillings (U Shs) 1,800,000/=   USD 500
  • Printer                                         Uganda Shillings (U Shs)  2,520,000/=  USD 700           
  • Digital Professional Camera        U Shs1,440,000/=  USD 400
  • Printing papers(A1,A2,A3,A4,A5)      U Shs720,000/=  USD 200
  • Materials (painting colors, printing screens, painting brushes)         USD 200

                              TOTAL:           U Shs 7,200,000/=                                U.S.D 2000

 

  1. The target of the project.

When I raise the targeted amount and buy the necessary equipment and when the initial business grows; I will set a branch in my home town area where there will be employment opportunities to many people like the youths especially those who are engaged in art and design sector.

Then some of the profits from the Graphic design studio will also help in the community work especially for town cleaning, contributing to some of the needy groups like physically and mentally handicapped (disabled), paying of the taxes from the income obtained, employment which will help in youth personal development both individually and at home for the better future.

Any amount of contribution is highly welcome for the well being of the Fine Art and Graphic Design Studio to improve the lives of many different people in my community.

Contribute using the “BACK IT” Button on the campaign.

Contact me through: kennedytukwasiibwe@gmail.com

                                  https://m.facebook.com/kennedy.tukwasiibwe

                                 +256787904400 whats-app.

                              TOTAL:           U Shs 7,200,000/=                                U.S.D 2000 The target of the project.When I raise the targeted amount and buy the necessary equipment and when the initial business grows; I will set a branch in my home town area where there will be employment opportunities to many people like the youths especially those who are engaged in art and design sector.Then some of the profits from the Graphic design studio will also help in the community work especially for town cleaning, contributing to some of the needy groups like physically and mentally handicapped (disabled), paying of the taxes from the income obtained, employment which will help in youth personal development both individually and at home for the better future.Any amount of contribution is highly welcome for the well being of the Fine Art and Graphic Design Studio to improve the lives of many different people in my community.Contribute using the “BACK IT” Button on the campaign.Contact me through: kennedytukwasiibwe@gmail.com                                  https://m.facebook.com/kennedy.tukwasiibwe                                 +256787904400 whats-app.

story:
Hey Guys, I need to Get to London in 6 Days for the Royal Academy Summer Exhibit Artist Varnish Day.

Hi  My Name is Louise Cutler and I am an Artist in Fort Collins Co. I found out on the 4th of Sept my painting "Alone ll" was just selected to exhibit at the Royal Academy of Arts in London and was sent the invite to Varnish Day. 

 Varnishing Day is one of the most colourful traditions associated with the annual Summer Exhibition. Originally the day when artists would put the finishing touches to their works within the galleries, it is now a day of celebration that we share with the artists who have been selected for the show. The Summer Exhibition is the world’s oldest open submission exhibition – which means that anyone can enter their work to be considered for inclusion. It’s happened every year since 1769, and each year an artist coordinates the exhibition. 

This year’s Summer Exhibition committee

This year, the Summer Exhibition will be coordinated by renowned artist Yinka Shonibare RA. The exhibition will explore the theme of ‘Reclaiming Magic’ and celebrate the joy of creating art.

Yinka Shonibare will be working with a committee of Royal Academicians, chaired by the President of the Royal Academy, Rebecca Salter. The members of the 2021 Summer Exhibition committee will be: Tony Bevan, Vanessa Jackson, Mali Morris, Humphrey Ocean, Eva Rothschild, Bob and Roberta Smith, Emma Stibbon and David Adjaye.

This will be a lifelong experience for me. I have applied for the Royal Academy Summer Exhibit 3 other times without getting in. This was my 4th year applying for the Exhibit and this year my work was accepted.   So to have been chosen this year is more than one can imagine. 

 

The process starts with the online application. You buy the application online and you can pay to submit one or two pieces for the first round of juring. If you are accepted for the first round the second round of juring requires the art to be in London to be presented to the panel for the final Juring. The pieces are passed in front of the Juring Artist one at a time. If your work is selected  from here you get in.

In order for someone from the states to submit their work for the final juring they must submit their work through a paid transportation service. So the work has to be shipped to the transportation service where they unwrap it and transport it to the Royal Academy on your behalf. The royal Academy does not accept shipped or unwrapped work. 

The notification for exceptate came out on Sept 4 along with the Varnish date of  Sept 13 so I had little time to get a low fare Airline  ticket. The airline ticket will cost me anywhere between $1500-$2000 Hotel stay will cost me anywhere between $150 - $250 per night.  I will be staying in London one week for the exhibit and to visit a few of the galleries there as well. I am looking to raise somewhere between $5- $6,000 for my trip. 

This is an amazing honor for me to be accepted and to be able to attend such a prestigious event where I will meet and interact with other Artist from all over the world.  It is one that I will cherish for a lifetime. There will be nothing like working the hallowed halls where other greatest artists in the world have tread.
