story:
Project Overview

The Journey of the In-Between is a painting series and story that will then be printed into a book in both hardback and paperback. This book is intended for children and adults alike. It will consist of 18 to 20 paintings, 4' x 4' and 4' x 5' in size. These paintings will be pages of the book that will be 8.5" x 11" in size. These paintings and the accompanying written story will be based on the teachings of The Tibetan Book of the Dead, which is considered a handbook of living and dying in the Tibetan Buddhist tradition. Once the series is finished, the paintings will also be turned into an exhibition so viewers can "walk" through the pages of the book and read the story alongside the art. The goal is to have this exhibition travel to hospitals, hospice, centers, spiritual centers, and art galleries.

 

Who We Are

Kyra

My name is Kyra Coates, and I am an artist, writer, and long-time student of Tibetan Buddhism. My art has principally focused around emotional and psychological experiences of feminine power. You can see more of my art at www.kyracoatesart.com.

Recently I was diagnosed with early cognitive decline leading to Alzheimer's disease. I'm 39 years old, so this came as a huge shock. Ironically, for years I worked on the side as a caregiver in hospice and for the elderly. I helped many people die, in particular, many people with Alzheimer's and dementia. I realized from these experiences that, as the brain degrades, we are left with our emotional imprints. These can be intense trauma's or simply peace for those who lived a life open to change and wonder. Either way, I would see people's personalities "disappear" along with their memories, as our personalities are really just a composite story made up of all our experiences throughout life (with a bit of hereditary impulses thrown in there). It was with these hospice clients I began to wonder. What existed there behind these stories, when the mind is gone? With my current diagnoses of facing Alzheimer's myself, this question is more poignant then ever.  Together with my partner Robert Cooper (who was too camera shy to be in the video), we will dive into this journey with the best of our talents; through art and story.

Robert

My name is Robert Cooper, and I am a long-time student of Tibetan Buddhism. After I had a kundalini awakening, which is a profound spiritual experience, at the age of 19, I became very interested in examining near death experiences by people all over the world.  So I read anything I could find about NDE’s.  Later when I encountered the Tibetan Book of the Dead, I realized just how accurately the Tibetans had used Buddhist mind training to thoroughly document the "bardo", or transition phases during death, as a means to enlightenment, or at least to a better rebirth process.  I also saw how deeply related the NDE’s are; I realized they are a universal process and driven by our own thinking and experiences in this very life.  It seemed like magic. 

Somewhere around age twenty-six, I decided I must explore this bardo realm thoroughly before I die to have any hope of recognizing the nature of mind.  So I began vision questing in the desert.  I would prepare to die for 30 days, then I would take my body to the limits in fasting, exposure to the elements and sacred medicines.  I was driven from my body time and time again to explore these bardo realms and experiences.  I developed a profound trust and confidence in not only my own capabilities but of the accuracy of the The Tibetan Book of the Dead.

It is my sincerest wish to produce a book that is not just visually beautiful, but also accurately depicts in a nonsectarian way the process that was laid out by the great Master Padmasambhava in the 8th century.

As a father of 4 children, I have sought ways to communicate these deep teachings of Awareness and mind to them in ways they can understand.  It has also been a dream of mine to use the The Tibetan Book of the Dead as an inspiration for the communication of how to awaken in death for more people than just those interested in Tibetan Buddhism.

 

The Story

The story features four young girls who are sisters. They will be represented by our four daughters. The girls try very hard to be fair and stand up for what is right. But they come to their mother/ mentor (Kyra) sad and frustrated that there is still so much suffering in the world. She teaches them that there can never be true peace until they find it within themselves first. She guides them through a visualization process that connects them to higher states of clarity and peace, until they finally recognize that these states have been within themselves all along. She then tells them it is her time to die. As she begins dying, she teaches them about the "bardos", which are the transition phases everyone experiences after death. She explains these bardos are merely reflections of one's own mind, and that as we journey through them, we have the opportunity to identify with the blazing brilliance of unrestricted wisdom and clarity, which is our true nature. Or, we can be lulled into the comfort of our familiar restrictive emotions of anger, passion, greed, and fear, and be reborn to experience them all over again. As she traverses through these bardos herself, she recognizes her true nature of absolute wisdom, and dissolves into a brilliant "rainbow body", where the flesh itself becomes so clarified by the recognition of truth it dissolves into rainbow light. Witnessing this, the girls themselves realize their own true nature, and are grateful for this final beautiful lesson from their mother/mentor. Our hope is that this can be a tool for others to change the narrative of fear of death to one of something beautiful and liberating.  

The artistic style in this series will be a combination of expressionism, abstract, and realism. We will be purposely excluding any traditional Buddhist symbolism and iconography specifically to maintain a more secular narrative that can speak to a Western audience. There will be mandalas in the paintings, but not shown in a traditionally eastern way. This series is meant to convey the teachings themselves, separate from the religious and cultural association they are typically represented in. 

It is also very important to us that all these characters are female. As in all religions, Buddhism has had a very limited representation of women as teachers and wise figures. Representation matters!

 

What We Need & What You Get

For this campaign, we are asking to raise $14,000. This covers:

  • publishing fees for the book 
  • art supplies to create the series 
  • the cost of fulfilling all the amazing rewards you crowd-funders will get to enjoy by contributing to our campaign. 
  • creative time in making the series and story. 

 

What YOU get is the opportunity to pre-order your signed copy of this book in either hard cover or soft cover, and/or receive beautiful art at a discounted price! All the art in this series will be available for sale, either as originals or giclee reproductions. These will all be discounted 20% or more from what Kyra would normally sell them for the month of this campaign only! This discount also applies to Kyra's current Feminine Power series of paintings, so if there is a piece you've had your eye on, now is the time to contribute and save some money! If you select art from the current series you will receive your reward by Christmas 2019, so it is also a great gift option. If you select a reward from The Journey of the In-Between, you will receive your reward in December 2020.

Kyra also will be offering to do commissioned art a discounted rate! 

 

The Impact

Our vision is that The Journey of the In-Between will become a tool people of all ages can use. As both of us are long-time students of Tibetan Buddhism, we recognize that these teachings are often presented with Tibetan cultural symbolism that can be confusing to a westerner. By bringing a human story to these teachings with a simple explanation, as well as a strong visual experience, our hope is that it will serve many for years to come. Art is a powerful tool for connecting with experiences beyond words. We hope this book can speak to all minds and hearts.

 

Our Background

Kyra has been an artist since she was 18 months old, no exaggeration! She studied at the Corcoran School of Art, and the Maryland Institute, College of Art. She became a full-time professional artist at the age of 21. At that time, she had a profound spiritual experience. She left everything behind and became a nun in a Hindu tradition, and lived that way for 3 years, doing deep spiritual practice and humanitarian work. At age 26, she realized the life of renunciation wasn't in alignment with her deepest spiritual experiences and left that world behind. She went on to study at Naropa University, which is a small Buddhist-inspired University in Boulder, Colorado that was founded by Chogyam Trungpa Rinpoche. It was there she dove deep into the Buddhist teachings, focusing on understanding the psychology of enlightenment. While studying there, she  worked as a caregiver in hospice and with the elderly. She helped many people die along the way, and learned much about human psychology in death. These experiences have deeply informed this project.

Kyra returned professionally in 2014 to the art world with a focus on spiritual and psychological expressions of women's empowerment. She  founded Infuse Gallery. This art gallery partnered with several women-focused nonprofits, and gave those served in the gallery a platform to sell their art. 

Robert is originally from Topeka, Kansas.  Born smack in the middle of the country raised on a ranch he developed a keen connection with the earth and her animals.  A kundalini awakening at age 19 sent him in a profoundly different direction than he had been raised. He left for Naropa University a few years later and received a degree in Religious Studies. 

Robert has studied with his Buddhist Teacher for 21 years, in addition he is an entrepreneur, a father to four young dakini’s, a partner and a friend to all beings. He loves creating mandala chalk art, and will be collaborating with Kyra on the paintings by adding in some of his geometric creations. Kyra and Robert will be co-writing the story together.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute today we understand. However, you can still support this project by sharing the heck out of it on your social media and with friends! 

Thank you so much, and we are incredibly grateful for your belief, trust, and support of our vision to make this project a reality! Thank you!

Kyra Coates and Robert Cooper

story:
Why Women's History?

As a kid, I loved learning about and sharing history. Seeing women in history books when I was a kid changed the course of my life; I realized I could be whomever I wanted, even if that wasn't who I was 'supposed' to be. I love to share that feeling with everyone I can, especially through art, my career and passion.

Why 100 Women?

In June of 2016, as Hillary Rodham Clinton took the stage as the first woman nominated by a major party for Presidential candidacy, the weight of history was overwhelming. It was a great night full of optimism, and I got to share it with so many people, but my mind was drawn to the countless number of influential women who'd been forgotten or left behind by common memory. There I was inspired to create the #100Days100Women series, where I drew a historical woman each day in the 100 days leading up to the 2016 election.

The Impact

Through the 100 Days 100 Women series I was able to bring attention to forgotten (and a couple famous) women who've made history and changed lives. In 2017, with your help, we were able to print and distribute posters of the 100 Days 100 Women series all over the world. With immeasurable joy I got to see photos and hear stories of the fascinated, inspired kids and adults as they studied the faces of the amazing women.

Now, in 2018, I am asking for your help again. I want to go further in inspiring the minds and sparking the imaginations of kids and adults by funding a print run of a 100 Days 100 Women coloring book, complete with short biographies.

Why A Coloring Book?

A coloring book offers the option to engage in a fun, creative, and immersive activity while learning about history. You can connect with these women not just through the written word, but by bringing your own artistry to their portraits. In this volume, we're offering short biographies alongside remastered and sharpened line work, allowing a deeper look at the subjects' lives and impact.

Along with the 200+ page coloring book, I'm offering a printable-pdf version, multi-book bundles, sets of 25 select full-color postcards, and the original #100Days100Women Poster. In addition, I'm opening a limited number of custom portraits where I will draw a woman of your choosing (please see below FAQ for details) and the option to turn your favorite woman into a printable, color-able illustration!

Remastered Art Examples

The Goals

Our goal of $6,500 will fund a small print run of the book, associated postage, taxes and fees, as well as pay for the campaign extras and a professional editor, Nicole Boose. Should we raise more than our goal, I have some fun stretch goals planned, including several add-ons to the book and additional art!

I'm very excited for the chance to bring this book to you, to pass along my love for the women of history, and to share their names, faces and stories with the world, to bring history further into our lives. If you're excited too, help us make some books and spread the word!

Risks & Challenges

My background is in print design and production. With this knowledge I will design and source the book, resulting in a professional, durable product. I have 5 years of experience crowdfunding, and have learned vital knowledge about budgeting, both time and money, so I can pledge a smooth fulfillment for backers. Additionally, I am keeping this campaign streamlined with book-focused backer tiers and manageable perks. Should unavoidable setbacks occur I will maintain communication and transparency with my backers while working to fulfill the campaign.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out! Sharing this campaign through social media and email can make a huge difference! I appreciate every share. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

About Rori!

Rori! is an illustrator, cartoonist, and designer from St. Louis, Missouri. She has previously published several comics, including the autobiographical Tiny Pink Robots. She is currently developing several stories and illustration series focusing on indomitable women and girls. She loves her cats, mostly, and her lumberjack-beatnik husband, always.

In addition, I'm opening a limited number of custom portraits where I will draw a woman of your choosing (please see below FAQ for details) and the option to turn your favorite woman into a printable, color-able illustration!
Remastered Art Examples

The Goals
Our goal of $6,500 will fund a small print run of the book, associated postage, taxes and fees, as well as pay for the campaign extras and a professional editor, Nicole Boose. Should we raise more than our goal, I have some fun stretch goals planned, including several add-ons to the book and additional art!
I'm very excited for the chance to bring this book to you, to pass along my love for the women of history, and to share their names, faces and stories with the world, to bring history further into our lives. If you're excited too, help us make some books and spread the word!





Risks & Challenges
My background is in print design and production. With this knowledge I will design and source the book, resulting in a professional, durable product. I have 5 years of experience crowdfunding, and have learned vital knowledge about budgeting, both time and money, so I can pledge a smooth fulfillment for backers. Additionally, I am keeping this campaign streamlined with book-focused backer tiers and manageable perks. Should unavoidable setbacks occur I will maintain communication and transparency with my backers while working to fulfill the campaign.


 
Other Ways You Can Help
Get the word out! Sharing this campaign through social media and email can make a huge difference! I appreciate every share. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

About Rori!Rori! is an illustrator, cartoonist, and designer from St. Louis, Missouri. She has previously published several comics, including the autobiographical Tiny Pink Robots. She is currently developing several stories and illustration series focusing on indomitable women and girls. She loves her cats, mostly, and her lumberjack-beatnik husband, always.

story:
Hello, welcome to my 2020 Indiegogo Sketchbook campaign. 

My name is Gary Shipman, and I have been making art for more than 30 years working on comics, movies and other properties. I'm probably best known for my comic book series Pakkins' Land that was nominated for Eisner, Harvey, and Russ Manning Awards. My work has been published through Disney Publishing, Caliber Press, Image Comics, Alias Comics, Cryptozoic, and Zondervan. I have been exploring different styles of art throughout my life, with no formal art training. 

I am excited to share this campaign for my 2020 sketchbook entitled The Somewhat Gothic & Sometimes Ugly Sketchbook, This volume collects some of my more unusual pieces of art in a full color 8.5" x 11" large format, 100-page, hardcover edition. 

My expression in art means nothing without someone like you to share it with. Your support helps me to keep doing the art I love. So thank you for all you do. 

Providing a quality product is the goal. I hope you are as excited about this campaign as I am. I need enough for the printing, distribution, and fees to create this sketchbook. Anything beyond that helps to make other projects possible. 

The perks are simple, and the prices as low as possible:

• $10 DIGITAL: gets you a Digital Download 2020 Goth & Ugly Sketchbook

• $20 SKETCHBOOK: gets you a hardcover copy of the 2020 Goth & Ugly Sketchbook with Digital Download. All Stretch Goals Included.

• $25 SKETCHBOOK: gets you a signed hardcover copy of the 2020 Goth & Ugly Sketchbook with Digital Download. All Stretch Goals Included.

• $50 HEADSHOT: gets you an original hand drawn headshot on the inside of a signed hardcover copy of the 2020 Goth & Ugly Sketchbook, with Digital Download. All Stretch Goals Included.

• $75 TORSO: gets you an original hand drawn torso on the inside of a signed hardcover copy of the 2020 Goth & Ugly Sketchbook, with Digital Download. All Stretch Goals Included.

• $100 FULL-BODY: gets you an original hand drawn full-body shot on the inside of a signed hardcover copy of the 2020 Goth & Ugly Sketchbook, with Digital Download. All Stretch Goals Included. 

 

Please check the perks out for more specific details!

• 1K STRETCH GOAL - LOCKED - Te be announced

• 2K STRETCH GOAL - LOCKED -Te be announced

 

Some Ways You Can Help

If you like this campaign and just want to help you can, by getting the word out and sharing on your social media!

That's all there is to it folks.

story:
In our society today, we are going through an evolutionary change. You can no longer ignore what is going on within you and all the shifts and pivots around you.  

Stress and anxiety are prevalent and wreak havoc on the body, mind and Spirit. 

Having the tools and techniques to get to the root causes and open up to your deeper yearning is what's needed. Learning how to trust your own guidance is priceless.  And Intuition is a skill that you can learn and strengthen with practice.

It doesn't have to be hard. 

Unlock the ancient power of the Tarot to gain a deep insight into your future, get clear guidance on major decisions and even reveal your life's true path.

In a world gone off track and now trying to get back on target, trusting your own gut instinct is a must.. it's a survival tool.

What we are Creating

During Covid, my work shifted, as did everyone’s.  I found myself somewhat lost and confused.  How do I change?  What changes do I need to make?

As an Energy healer and Spiritual Counselor, I am grateful that I have the tools to help me with these questions.  

And these were big questions I found myself as well as my clients asking.

And sure enough… out would come the Tarot Cards.  

One of the things I teach in my private mentoring is developing Intuition. One of the tools I use for this, is the Oracles and the Tarot.

In my private mentoring, I use the oracles and the Tarot as a way to access intuition and develop trust in your inner guidance. I truly believe that the more you access your intuition, the more it will grow. Using the Tarot teaches you how to look for the signs and symbols in your life. It will help you uncover hidden information for your life.

One day, I was speaking to one of may former clients, Lorri Hanna, an amazing and talented artist.  She said she had been looking for a spiritual art project and I said I wanted to create a Tarot deck.  Although she  had minimal experience with the Tarot and a little with oracle cards…. she was interested.

And thus we began the journey!

I guided.. She Illustrated, 

This journey of the Empowered Spirit Tarot deck comes from a combination of the teachings of the Tarot and working with my client and in the Empowered Spirit Program.

The journey of the Spirit moves through all the elements of life and the major challenges we all go through.. from stepping out of your comfort zone and growing a business, trying new adventures to the ups and downs of life, the love, the loss, the abundance, the work.. the Empowered Spirit Tarot came to life.

Each of the images are original, yet based on the Tarot with its own unique elements to it.

While I recognize there are many Tarot decks already available, this deck offers, what I think, is a modern update and interpretation to working with the Spirit for your life.  The artwork is original, created in vibrant, whimsical, watercolor and ink inspired by the Empowered Spirit Program. The artwork was then photographed, digitally, to produce the cards

In a dismal and changing world, art always comes in to inspire the Spirit.

It’s important to me to inspire others in the Healings Arts and find ways to raise awareness of just how important creativity is to the Spirit.  

Why the Tarot:

Intuition emerges from the subconscious.  The subconscious can bypass the logical mind and ego. But the logical mind and ego can talk you out of believing in intuition.

The Tarot is storytelling.  It has a way to distract your logical mind with the story. While your logical mind is distracted, your subconscious mind and intuition are engaged.

With intention, you can take the process further and actually work with your Spirit, Source energy and Guides to further enhance your intuitive development.

The Tarot offers a foundation. It is set up with elements and brings in numerology, signs, symbols and  sacred geometry, in a way that allows your imagination to open so that you can look at your life with a different perspective.

Learn to unlock the ancient power of the Tarot to truly change your own life and the lives of those around you... FAST!

Having a Tarot Reading is like have a therapy session with your Spirit!

 

What We Need

We have our deck produced and off for the first prototypes.  We need this crowdfunding to help with the high cost of printing large quantities in high quality.

In exchange, we have some amazing perks for you to choose from including prints of the original artwork, 1st edition decks, Tarot readings, a journal, workbook, a Tarot class, Woo Circles and more.

Choose the perk that fits your excitement and help us bring this out into the world for others to be able to Empower their Spirit and learn to develop their Intuition. 

Note:  Each Empowered Spirit Tarot Deck includes a 98 page booklet to guide you through the cards.

Funding:

Our budget is set with a goal of $7,777.  Why? Because 7's are spirituality.  7777 represents prosperity, success, and wisdom. It is brimming with abundance and will help those who are looking to build upon their wealth.  We need your help which in turn will help you as well. We need help with the printing cost associated with producing large quantities needed to print and package the cards to bring them out into the world at an affordable cost.  The funding will determine how many decks will be printed. 

We will also use a portion of the funding to produce and print the Workbook and Journal that supplements the Empowered Spirit Tarot deck so that you can go even deeper in learning about your journey and how it relates to the journey through life.

Each and every dollar submitted, including shipping, will be added to our fundraising total! So if do you want to support us by purchasing more than one perk, you will have to do it multiple times.

The Impact

In our society today, we are going through an evolutionary change. You can no longer ignore what is going on within.  Each of us must take responsibility for our path.

Stress and anxiety are prevalent and can wreak havoc on the body, mind and Spirit. 

Having the tools and techniques to calm the mind, to ask the deeper questions and interpret the meanings is priceless.

The same 'ole searching out there just isn't working.

Trusting your own gut instinct is a survival tool!

The Tarot can help you to learn more, practice more and build that muscle up!

It’s time to Empower Your Spirit with the Tarot!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, know that you can still help getting the word out.  Share this campaign and make some noise for us!

Who We Are:

Terri Ann Heiman

Terri Ann Heiman, creator of the Empowered Spirit Tarot Deck, is a Reiki Master Teacher and Spiritual Mentor. She offers Spiritual Upgrades for the Modern Day Women with the Mystical teachings of Spirituality. She helps you to create your own spiritual practice. Through her Empowered Spirit Programs, she teaches tools and techniques to regain your confidence and trust your Intuition for decision making purposes.

She is the host of the podcast, The Empowered Spirit Show. She has been interviewed on ABC TV and published several times in Reiki News Magazine. 

Her book, Confessions of a Shower Tapper - The Ultimate Guide to Living Your Purpose with EFT is available on Amazon.

She offers individual Energy Sessions,Tarot readings and private mentoring in her Empowered Spirit Program.

Connect with her on Instagram and Facebook @terriannheiman or visit her website at TerriAnnHeiman.com.

Lorri Hanna

The Artist: Intuitive artist Lorri Hanna created the vibrant watercolor and ink whimsical cards inspired by the Empowered Spirit Program. Trusting her inner guidance, Lorri’s reimagined 78 cards are soulful expressions of her interpretation that bring meaning and purpose to the cards. Lorri’s adventurous spirit, love for nature, dance/yoga, world travel and spirituality are inspirations for her work. She was featured as an Emerging Artist in Art Galleries & Artists of the South Magazine and a featured artist for Color & Whimsy on Artsy Shark, a web based publication.

A psychotherapist, deep transformational coach, adventure guide and artist, Lorri is passionate about working with others to cultivate an authentic, purposeful and deeply connected life while navigating the landscape of the soul.

As a “champion for love,”  Lorri is the founder of Barefoot Souls, a body-centered wellness practice in Birmingham, AL and co-founder of Soltreks, offering adventures for the soul in Two Harbors, Minnesota. 

To learn more about Lorri visit www.LorriHanna.com   and www.barefootsoulswellness.com.

story:
Welcome to the Pollinators 2020 Calendar Presale Campaign!

I'm Martha Knox, a woodblock printmaker, teaching artist, and sole proprietor of Words On Woodcuts Press.  

Those who purchase the calendar or associated original artwork through this presale campaign get 20% off the retail price plus free shipping in the United States.  

NOTE: All orders will be filled by the last week in November. Only AFTER the pre-orders are filled will the calendar be offered for sale, at full price, to the general public.

What I Need & What You Get

Printing even a small edition of calendars requires money up front. Not to mention all the paper, ink, and blocks I go through creating the original artwork in my studio. By running these pre-sale campaigns, I raise most or all of the material costs for these projects. Without enough up-front capital, I cannot do bulk publishing of projects such as Pollinators 2020, and without bulk publishing, I cannot keep my prices competitive. 

By ordering during the pre-sale campaign, fans of my artwork get special perks: signed copies, discounts on calendars and original artwork, free shipping (in the USA), and you receive the work before anyone else.

Risks & Challenges

I am no stranger to crowdfunding. Four years ago I founded Words On Woodcuts Press with an Indiegogo fundraising campaign that raised nearly $4,000 (198% of its original goal.) In less than a year I collected the seed funds to publish my first two books, Cats A-Z and Owl and Cat In Love (each in editions of 500). I successfully crowd-sourced funds to publish 12 Owls in 2017, and a third picturebook, The Nautilus and the Ammonite (edition of 300) in 2018. I know fundraising is a lot of work, but can also be a lot of fun.

As always, I'm so grateful to all the family, friends, colleagues, and collectors of my work who have supported all my past endeavors and given me the confidence to not only maintain my studio practice, but also get my work out to a broader audience. Thank you, all!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to this campaign or this art is simply not your thing, you can still help this campaign and support Words On Woodcuts Press by getting the word out. Please share this campaign through social media and using the Indiegogo share tools. Thanks!

story:
We’re celebrating a special language from our parallel universe by making cookie cutters and the first dictionary of these words.  But we need your help to do this.  Baking is one of those wonderful family and community activities that's been around for a long time for all linear humans. And these shape words are a lot of fun too!  Please join us on the journey of inviting folks to look at the world in new ways. 

For 17 years, we’ve been installing a parallel universe story (actually many interlocking stories) with the incredible support of communities around the world.  Many of you are already part of this community—and we thank you so much for that.  And we hope you will find this a happy extension of the project.  And, for those who are newer to these stories, we hope when you join us in this endeavor, you'll enjoy being part of this wonderful community.

For those that don't know all this yet—Kcymaerxthaere (pronounced "ky-MAER-icks-theer") is a parallel universe that coexists to a certain degree with our own—and it isn't virtual! It's also a global installation art project, with 142 storytelling sites that you can actually visit in 30 nations— so far! Each installation site honors events from the parallel world in our world. Most include written stories (in bronze, concrete and stone usually)—but it is not only what is written but where you experience reading the story (and, often, the forms that help tell it). Some installations are fairly elaborate—two are actually buildings, another is a couple hundred yards long.  This article does a great job of explaining it: A Bizarre Journey Beyond Earth’s Borders. To explore more of the details of Kcymaerxthaere, visit our homepage.

This year—which needless to say has been quite difficult and unique—we are trying something new here at KcyCentral. Due to those many widely-known constraints, installations are proceeding very slowly. But—we're embracing this time in a very sweet way: we are launching our very first limited edition Kcy Cookie Cutters!  We hope they will be fun for all . . . what's more, they also will introduce still more folks to shapes and forms of the language known as Beshwa Nyelvate.  This takes us towards a much larger goal (and preparing for our grandest project to date, which we'll elaborate on momentarily).

The process towards that goal (making Kcy cookie cutters and sharing them with you!) and the end-goal itself are two sides of the same coin: celebrating the Nyelvate shape language. We hope to share that joy with our community and beyond—and spread it through the shared love of baking.

But wait—what is "Nyelvate"? And what are shapewords?

The Nyelvate language, often referred to as a shape language, requires that the speaker create shapes (words) that have 12 to 16 dimensions at once (through a process called psycheforming; so instead of uttering syllables verbally, words are created through the manifestation of physical shapes with one's own mind). Since not every rezhn has the same dimensions, a pidgin Nyelvate has developed usually requiring only 2 - 5 dimensions. This dialect is known as Beshwa Nyelvate. The cookies you make with your exclusive Kcymaerxthaere cookie cutters are a delectable sub-dialect of their own!

So what is our end-goal? 

Two-Fold:

First: We want you to have fun with the Cookie Cutters and make your own messages (and post your favorites)!  And if you are a collector?  We want you to have one of the only Limited Edition Cookie Cutters we've ever heard of.  It is limited by time--the first edition of these shapes stops being made around February 14, 2021.  

Second: We want publish a dictionary of over 400 Nyelvate shapewords—and creating this extensive publication necessitates your help. 2021 is when the Nyelvate language takes a larger role in the stories than ever before, and we want to have that dictionary done in time for the installation of The Great Tenderness in the Northern Atlantic (spanning about 1,200 miles—see the map below).  There is also trekking between shapeword-based installations in Nepal (see one that already exists there: Strands of Thought, in Solukhumbu). 

The beginnings of The Great Tenderness have already begun to take shape (pun intended!) with an introductory marker placed in Madeira, Portugal: Where Tenderness Began (Origem da Ternura). However, installation of the seven-pointed constellation spanning from Lisbon to the Azores to the deep seas of the Northern Atlantic has yet to begin. 

What We Need & What You Get

SO, what we need is your help bringing these words out into the world--in both edible and readable form.  If we meet our goal, we'll be able to publish our Nyelvate Shape Language dictionary by next Summer.

What you get: In the end, of course you get what we think are pretty nifty perks.  But even if you don't order the book as a perk,  by supporting our campaign at any level, you too will have your name included in the credits section of the BPDBN (The Baker-Physicist's Dictionary of Beshwa Nyelvate--and receive one (if you choose that kind of perk)! 

We’ll also distribute this book across the globe to the Kcymaerxthaere host communities that have made many of the physical installations happen.

That's because it is part of the spirit of the project to enrich the connective tissue between our various communities.  And while our website can be part of such enjoyment, something more tactile like a book in each community is critical (and, besides, not everyone has fast internet!)

What we are offering you is a chance to make some very eloquent cookies during the end of year holidays and, if you choose, to get your own copy of the first edition, signed (and further ornamented a bit for this campaign) by the author.  And, as we said before, you will be acknowledged by name for your support.  You'll have a personalized first edition of the first book to let you really explore this evocative language from the parallel world.

Risks & Challenges

The risks are the risks of the world today--disruption of the pandemic, the vulnerability of anyone to COVID-19, fragility in general.  Such things could stop the campaign or fulfillment in its tracks.

Within that framework, however, we have developed a good team for the Cookie Cutters and fulfillment, so we are confident the orders will be fulfilled. The Cookie Cutter maker does an excellent job with the shapes.  As for the book, we have already gathered the data and have a skilled printer that we have worked with before.  If the campaign only sells a small number of books, we will digitally print whatever books are required to fulfill our obligations (and those will be super rare!).

Also: the Cookie Cutters are not for Children under 3 and should be used with Adult Supervision.

Other Ways You Can Help

If this is not a good time to contribute to our campaign, please help us reach others by sharing our Indiegogo link with friends or using IndieGoGo share tools to help us spread the word on your social media and blog platforms! Every bit counts and helps us as we try to reach our goal!  

But most of all tell people what we are doing!

Instagram: @kcymaerxthaere

Facebook: @Kcymaerxthaere

Twitter: @kcym

WHAT IF WE RAISE EXTRA MONEY?

After the shapeword dictionary is published, we still have the actual installations to complete. The project that spans 1,200 miles across—The Great Tenderness—is going to require a lot of time and resources. So any funds raised above our goal will go towards installation expenses.

THANKS SO MUCH!!! 

For checking out our campaign, we are so proud of what we have accomplished so far, appreciative of all the help we have gotten, and committed to being sure communities around the world experience communal connection through Kcymaerxthaereal storytelling, with the deep, simple joy of baking!

We are creating a global connection through story.  Please help—and follow the updates for other ways you can experience the stories.

Don’t hesitate to post or email questions.

And please spread the word--especially on Facebook and Instagram.

Shóaf Kepl Poets,

Eames Demetrios

Geographer-at-Large
story_txt:
We’re celebrating a special language from our parallel universe by making cookie cutters and the first dictionary of these words.  But we need your help to do this.  Baking is one of those wonderful family and community activities that's been around for a long time for all linear humans. And these shape words are a lot of fun too!  Please join us on the journey of inviting folks to look at the world in new ways. 

For 17 years, we’ve been installing a parallel universe story (actually many interlocking stories) with the incredible support of communities around the world.  Many of you are already part of this community—and we thank you so much for that.  And we hope you will find this a happy extension of the project.  And, for those who are newer to these stories, we hope when you join us in this endeavor, you'll enjoy being part of this wonderful community.
For those that don't know all this yet—Kcymaerxthaere (pronounced "ky-MAER-icks-theer") is a parallel universe that coexists to a certain degree with our own—and it isn't virtual! It's also a global installation art project, with 142 storytelling sites that you can actually visit in 30 nations— so far! Each installation site honors events from the parallel world in our world. Most include written stories (in bronze, concrete and stone usually)—but it is not only what is written but where you experience reading the story (and, often, the forms that help tell it). Some installations are fairly elaborate—two are actually buildings, another is a couple hundred yards long.  This article does a great job of explaining it: A Bizarre Journey Beyond Earth’s Borders. To explore more of the details of Kcymaerxthaere, visit our homepage.

This year—which needless to say has been quite difficult and unique—we are trying something new here at KcyCentral. Due to those many widely-known constraints, installations are proceeding very slowly. But—we're embracing this time in a very sweet way: we are launching our very first limited edition Kcy Cookie Cutters!  We hope they will be fun for all . . . what's more, they also will introduce still more folks to shapes and forms of the language known as Beshwa Nyelvate.  This takes us towards a much larger goal (and preparing for our grandest project to date, which we'll elaborate on momentarily).

The process towards that goal (making Kcy cookie cutters and sharing them with you!) and the end-goal itself are two sides of the same coin: celebrating the Nyelvate shape language. We hope to share that joy with our community and beyond—and spread it through the shared love of baking.


But wait—what is "Nyelvate"? And what are shapewords?

The Nyelvate language, often referred to as a shape language, requires that the speaker create shapes (words) that have 12 to 16 dimensions at once (through a process called psycheforming; so instead of uttering syllables verbally, words are created through the manifestation of physical shapes with one's own mind). Since not every rezhn has the same dimensions, a pidgin Nyelvate has developed usually requiring only 2 - 5 dimensions. This dialect is known as Beshwa Nyelvate. The cookies you make with your exclusive Kcymaerxthaere cookie cutters are a delectable sub-dialect of their own!

So what is our end-goal? 
Two-Fold:
First: We want you to have fun with the Cookie Cutters and make your own messages (and post your favorites)!  And if you are a collector?  We want you to have one of the only Limited Edition Cookie Cutters we've ever heard of.  It is limited by time--the first edition of these shapes stops being made around February 14, 2021.

The beginnings of The Great Tenderness have already begun to take shape (pun intended!) with an introductory marker placed in Madeira, Portugal: Where Tenderness Began (Origem da Ternura). However, installation of the seven-pointed constellation spanning from Lisbon to the Azores to the deep seas of the Northern Atlantic has yet to begin. 


What We Need & What You Get
SO, what we need is your help bringing these words out into the world--in both edible and readable form.  If we meet our goal, we'll be able to publish our Nyelvate Shape Language dictionary by next Summer.
What you get: In the end, of course you get what we think are pretty nifty perks.  But even if you don't order the book as a perk,  by supporting our campaign at any level, you too will have your name included in the credits section of the BPDBN (The Baker-Physicist's Dictionary of Beshwa Nyelvate--and receive one (if you choose that kind of perk)! 
We’ll also distribute this book across the globe to the Kcymaerxthaere host communities that have made many of the physical installations happen.
That's because it is part of the spirit of the project to enrich the connective tissue between our various communities.  And while our website can be part of such enjoyment, something more tactile like a book in each community is critical (and, besides, not everyone has fast internet!)

What we are offering you is a chance to make some very eloquent cookies during the end of year holidays and, if you choose, to get your own copy of the first edition, signed (and further ornamented a bit for this campaign) by the author.  And, as we said before, you will be acknowledged by name for your support.  You'll have a personalized first edition of the first book to let you really explore this evocative language from the parallel world.

story:
120 PAGES OF ART AND AN ORIGINAL SKETCH!

This art book will figuratively punch you in your face with drawings! Does that sound unpleasant? IT’S NOT! You’ll want to take punch after punch as you turn page after page of artwork. Science hasn’t proven it will increase muscle mass as you browse through this mighty book, but it’s always a possibility!

EVERY BOOK COMES WITH AN ORIGINAL SKETCH IN THE BACK! And at over 120 pages of glorious full color, this art book is stable enough to defeat tornadoes! Proven by science? NO! But stranger things have happened!

I’ve worked on comics like Transformers, GI Joe, Doctor Who, and my own books William the Last and Gunship Thunderpunch. And when I'm done working for the day on those projects...I KEEP ON DRAWING!

 

 

 

 

Ever wonder how much work goes into developing a new comic book character? I’ve included a section of development sketches for my book, GUNSHIP THUNDERPUNCH. There you’ll find unused sketches and designs as I slammed my head against the wall trying to arrive at a solid design. Unused, that is, until now!

Did I mention this book is only found at this particular point of time and space in the universe? It’s true! Nowhere else in the ENTIRE UNIVERSE (known and unknown) can this book be bought, browsed through, poured over, read through, and placed on a shelf of your choice in your own home.

It’s this level of quality and originality I’m committed to bring to you, dear reader.

 

Did you miss Volume One of this magically delicious series?

I have limited numbers of that available too!

 

Every book is signed by me! (because I made it!) Don't miss out again!

 

STRETCH GOALS!

 

$10k TRADING CARDS -

At $10k every book comes with a set of original trading cards featuring original characters! Art on the front, stats on the back! You know, trading cards!

 

More stretch goals to be announced soon!.

story:
"Go out with your love to the garden!"

Be Joyful Isidore, is my first all original children's book!  It follows the day in the life of St. Isidore as he discovers his place in God's saving work as a child of God!  This book will be a beautiful hard cover edition signed by me!  If you are looking for a great Christian children's book, with beautiful art and profound lyrical story, than this is it!  

BIO

My name is Michael Corsini and I am a painter.  I am a husband, to my beautiful wife Jessie, and father of five little ones.  I have been creating works of art for healing and renewal for nearly two decades.  I have a BFA from Ringling School of Art and Design as well as a MTS from the John Paul Institute for Studies on Marriage and Family.  One of our very important family traditions is the nightly reading of great stories!  Accordingly, I have seen my fair share of great and awful children's books.  In our family we find that it is difficult to find great Christian children's books that are beautiful and engaging.  I am determined to make this book one that you will cherish forever!  

GOAL

I need to gather at least $5,000 to get this project funded.  That is, around 200 books need to be sold in order for me to able to afford to have any books printed at all!  I am self publishing so the start up cost on a project of this scale is impossible for me to fund on my own.  What you get is a beautiful hard bound copy for yourself and the ability to join me in this mission!   My extended goal at $6000 will be printable coloring pages of every character in the book!  Most importantly, funding this project means that you have contributed to a wonderful project that will engage the imagination of children and help to lead them into greater relationship with God!  

 

Risks & Challenges

My biggest challenge is that I am doing this on my own… (well with lots of moral support from my kids!) I will be handling all the preparations and fulfilling orders myself. I’ll be personally working with the printers, doing the packaging, and in some form, delivering them to you. This will extend the timeline on delivery, but I will personally vouch for each patrons’ order! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to support the project but can't financially back the project, there are other ways you can help me reach my goal. These include:

Share the project on Facebook and Instagram

Share my artwork found on Facebook and Instagram

Send the project to specific people who you think would be interested in it

www.michaelcorsini.com

Thank you for your support!

 

Stretch Goals

$6,000 - Coloring Pages of every character in the book!

$7,500 - To be Announced!  

 

Some images of my recent children's book art! And art from THIS book!

story:
About the Zine

We Must Be Proud is a 30+ page collaborative digital charity zine featuring the works of 12 dedicated artists, aiming to donate money to Trans and LGBTQ+ Nonprofits and Organizations during Pride Month.

As Pride celebrations were cancelled following the global pandemic, many organizations were hindered in their ability to perform advocacy and provide material resources to LGBTQ+ folks. Our team decided we wanted to find a way to give back to our community through art!

Each of the twelve artists collaborated to create a total of 30+ stunning pages of artwork commemorating the full spectrum of LGBTQ+ identities, as well as paying homage to the incredibly diverse and profound representation in SheRa and the Princesses Of Power!!

All collaborators believe it is a zine in equal parts dedicated to helping LGBTQ+ folks, and a love letter to everyone who worked tirelessly to make television history with SheRa.


By contributing to this campaign, you are not only supporting LGBTQ+ artists, you are directly donating valuable money and resources to Queer and Trans folks who are affected by the pandemic and need help year-round. Help us celebrate the accomplishments of this momentous show and stand in solidarity with the LGBTQ+ Community. The festivities may be cancelled, but Pride is all-year-round!!

Contributors

Here are our lovely contributors! Be sure to check them out! 

| @artofkace | @elimnebe | @firnella | @fizzledlines |@junvii_arts | @monn_ney | @piningpotato | |@snersona  | @springmaidens | @summerfelldraws | @supersappho | @themaggiezine |

 

✧

Who Are We Donating To?

The organizations selected for donation include:

  • The Sylvia Rivera Law Project
  • 3rd Wave Fund
  • Trans Lifeline

Each organization provides unique and necessary resources to trans folks, LGBTQ+ people of colour, and those most affected by the current global pandemic. We hope to raise enough money to donate to all three organizations but we have chosen to the Sylvia Rivera Law Project (SLRP) as our 1st choice!

What We Need & What You Get

When you back this campaign, you will get:

Tier 1 - The PDF

$10 USD - Backers will receive a copy of the We Must Be Proud PDF, to be delivered via email on June 16th, 2020. 

Included Items:

  • Digital Zine PDF

Tier 2 - Larger Charitable Donation

$36 USD - This tier is for backers who just want the zine but want to make a larger charitable donation! Will include a Digital PDF of the zine to be sent after the Indiegogo campaign, and our many thanks!!

Included Items:

  • Digital Zine PDF
  • Our Gratitude!

Tier 3 - All of Etheria!

$72 USD - This is a limited tier with only 25 slots available! Backers will receive a digital PDF copy of the zine as well as a Sketch Card Commission of one of three characters (Catra, Adora, or She-Ra). Sketch cards will be signed and will include a handwritten thank you note! This tier will also receive a Catradora Pin should the stretch goal be reached!

Included Items:

  • Digital Zine PDF
  • Sketch Card Commission by Firnella
  • Catradora Pin
  • Our sincere thanks!!!

Funding

Funding for this zine has been broken down into four parts: 

  • Compensating Artists
  • Administration & Organization
  • Indiegogo Contingency
  • Donation to Nonprofits 

 

 

Currently, with the budget we have, 50% of our proceeds will be donated to Charity, but we don't want to stop there! If we can exceed our goal, we can move on to stretch goals!

 

 

Stretch Goal 1: $3500 USD 

If we are able to reach our First Stretch Goal, we will begin the production of a celebratory Catradora pride pin!

 

The pin will be hard enamel (cloisonné), with rose gold metal, two soft rubber backings, and a backplate that reads "Heart" in First One's script. Approximately $650 USD will go towards producing the pins!

All funding outside of production costs for the pin will be donated to SRLP for a total of $1600 USD (approx. $2,230 CAD)! New Tiers will be released upon reaching the stretch goal!!

Do you want a pin but the stretch goal hasn't been reached yet? Don't worry! Folks who have pre-ordered the zine before the stretch goal will have access to the 'just the pin' tier upon reaching our stretch goal.

Unlocked Pin Tiers Will Include: 

  • Zine & Pin - $25 USD / $35 CAD
  • Just the Pin! $15 USD / $20 CAD

There will be a limited amount of these (250 available!) so be sure to grab one ASAP if they become available! 

 

Stretch Goal 2: $5000 USD 

Currently we are prioritizing SRLP as our primary charitable organization to donate to, but we really want to donate to multiple LGBTQ+ organizations that prioritize Queer and Trans youth, and LGBTQ+ people of colour.

3rd Wave Fund is an exciting, younger charitable organization that provides life-saving grants to individuals all over America, and is entirely run by and for women of colour, intersex, queer, and trans folks under 35 years old in the US. We really believe in their advocacy work and would love to donate to them.

If we reach our Second Stretch Goal we will be able to donate $1600 USD to SRLP, and $1500 USD to 3rd Wave Fund (Over $3100 USD / $4320 CAD in charitable donations!) 

 

 

Stretch Goal 3: $10,000 USD 

 

If we reach our Third Stretch Goal - first of all, whoa!!! Thank you all so much!!!

Should we reach this goal, many of the contributing artists will create additional Catradora illustrations to be added on to the zine at no extra charge! These pages will be put in a separate folder titled "Thank you to our Backers!" and will be full colour illustrations. 

This goal will also grant us the ability to donate:

  • $2500 USD to SRLP
  • $2500 USD to 3rd Wave Fund
  • $2500 USD to Trans Lifeline

In addition, it will allow the organizer to compensate artists an additional $50 USD each for their hard work on this project.  

 

If Funding Is not Successful

There is always the possibility that we may not meet our funding goals, and if that happens, we as a team are prepared to consolidate the funding we receive and still prioritize the charitable donation above all else. We are so proud to have been a part of this community and the goal of this project is to give back, so should we not meet funding, we will still update backers with the total amount donated to charity! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

These are incredibly challenging times for all of us, and we know not everyone has the financial capacity to donate to this project. If you are unable to donate to the project, but still want to support us, as well as the organizations we want to donate to, you can:

  • Share this campaign on Instagram, Twitter, or with your friends!
  • Support the artists on their platforms! 
  • Reach out to us via email - sherapridezine@gmail.com !!! 

 

 

The fight for LGBTQ+ liberation never stops, and we are so proud to witness SheRa's legacy in that fight. Thank you for checking out this Indiegogo, and we hope we have earned your support!

Funding
Funding for this zine has been broken down into four parts: 

Compensating Artists
Administration & Organization
Indiegogo Contingency
Donation to Nonprofits 

 

 
Currently, with the budget we have, 50% of our proceeds will be donated to Charity, but we don't want to stop there! If we can exceed our goal, we can move on to stretch goals!
 

 

Stretch Goal 1: $3500 USD 
If we are able to reach our First Stretch Goal, we will begin the production of a celebratory Catradora pride pin!

 
The pin will be hard enamel (cloisonné), with rose gold metal, two soft rubber backings, and a backplate that reads "Heart" in First One's script. Approximately $650 USD will go towards producing the pins!
All funding outside of production costs for the pin will be donated to SRLP for a total of $1600 USD (approx. $2,230 CAD)! New Tiers will be released upon reaching the stretch goal!!
Do you want a pin but the stretch goal hasn't been reached yet? Don't worry! Folks who have pre-ordered the zine before the stretch goal will have access to the 'just the pin' tier upon reaching our stretch goal.
Unlocked Pin Tiers Will Include: 

Zine & Pin - $25 USD / $35 CAD
Just the Pin! $15 USD / $20 CAD

There will be a limited amount of these (250 available!) so be sure to grab one ASAP if they become available! 
 
Stretch Goal 2: $5000 USD 
Currently we are prioritizing SRLP as our primary charitable organization to donate to, but we really want to donate to multiple LGBTQ+ organizations that prioritize Queer and Trans youth, and LGBTQ+ people of colour.
3rd Wave Fund is an exciting, younger charitable organization that provides life-saving grants to individuals all over America, and is entirely run by and for women of colour, intersex, queer, and trans folks under 35 years old in the US. We really believe in their advocacy work and would love to donate to them.
If we reach our Second Stretch Goal we will be able to donate $1600 USD to SRLP, and $1500 USD to 3rd Wave Fund (Over $3100 USD / $4320 CAD in charitable donations!) 
 
 
Stretch Goal 3: $10,000 USD 
 
If we reach our Third Stretch Goal - first of all, whoa!!! Thank you all so much!!!
Should we reach this goal, many of the contributing artists will create additional Catradora illustrations to be added on to the zine at no extra charge! These pages will be put in a separate folder titled "Thank you to our Backers!" and will be full colour illustrations. 
This goal will also grant us the ability to donate:

$2500 USD to SRLP
$2500 USD to 3rd Wave Fund
$2500 USD to Trans Lifeline

In addition, it will allow the organizer to compensate artists an additional $50 USD each for their hard work on this project.  
 
If Funding Is not Successful
There is always the possibility that we may not meet our funding goals, and if that happens, we as a team are prepared to consolidate the funding we receive and still prioritize the charitable donation above all else. We are so proud to have been a part of this community and the goal of this project is to give back, so should we not meet funding, we will still update backers with the total amount donated to charity! 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
These are incredibly challenging times for all of us, and we know not everyone has the financial capacity to donate to this project. If you are unable to donate to the project, but still want to support us, as well as the organizations we want to donate to, you can:

Share this campaign on Instagram, Twitter, or with your friends!
Support the artists on their platforms! 
Reach out to us via email - sherapridezine@gmail.com !!! 

 
 
The fight for LGBTQ+ liberation never stops, and we are so proud to witness SheRa's legacy in that fight. Thank you for checking out this Indiegogo, and we hope we have earned your support!

story:
Introduction:

Hi, I'm Martha Knox, a woodblock printmaker, teaching artist, and sole proprietor of Words On Woodcuts Press. I trained at the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts and maintain a studio in Philadelphia. 

This is a pre-sale campaign for my latest project: 12 Owls. The project is a series of linoleum cut prints of 12 different owl species, offered in 3 forms: 

  1. Black and white versions of all 12 prints reproduced as a 8.5" x 11" coloring book 
  2. Full color 12" x 12" 2018 calendars featuring all 12 prints 
  3. Original artwork - pick and choose your favorite prints, in black and white or hand-colored

NOTE: All orders will be filled by the first week of December in time for holiday gift giving. 

What I Need & What You Get

Printing even a small edition of calendars and coloring books costs a lot. Not to mention all the paper, ink, and blocks I go through creating the original artwork in my studio. By running these pre-sale campaigns, I raise most or all of the material costs for these projects up front. Without enough up-front capital, I cannot do bulk publishing of projects such as 12 Owls, and without bulk publishing, I cannot keep my prices competitive. 

By ordering during the pre-sale campaign, fans of my artwork get special perks, such as signed copies, discounts on original artwork, and receiving the work before anyone else. ​

Risks & Challenges

I am no stranger to crowdfunding. Two years ago I founded Words On Woodcuts Press with an Indiegogo fundraising campaign that raised nearly $4,000 (198% of its original goal.) In less than a year I collected the seed funds to publish my first two books (each in editions of 500) through successful pre-sale campaigns and crowd-sourced small business loans (loans now paid back in full.) Earlier this year I ran a successful pre-sale campaign to create an edition of 100 of my press's first handmade book "A Wise Old Owl." I know fundraising is a lot of work, but also a lot of fun.

I'm so grateful to all the family, friends, colleagues, and collectors of my work who have supported all my past endeavors and given me the confidence to not only maintain my studio practice, but also get my work out to a broader audience. Thank you, all!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to this campaign or owl art is simply not your thing, you can still help this campaign and support Words On Woodcuts Press by getting the word out. Please share this campaign through social media and using the Indiegogo share tools. Thanks!

story:
Hello we are designers and anime fans based in London, looking to fund the production of our enamel pins. All unlocked designs will be listed on Etsy and our store(under construction) at a higher price after the campaign with very limited quantity, so pledge here if you want to save money.

First 50 Backers Receive Free Wizard Acrylics 

Please contact us via https://www.instagram.com/hederahelix_art/ , email or sending dm via Indiegogo.

Almost all designs are already unlocked on Kickstarter campaign, please feel free to pledge for whichever design you like! 

New designs will be added to this campaign as the campaign goes on. If it goes well, more of everyone's fav characters such as the "prince" will be revealed and unlocked.

 

Kickstarter backers

pledge as you please here on Indiegogo, you will receive "free shipping for Kickstarter Backers "(pledged item will be added to your pinmail). 

OR

please contact us if you are interested in any of the new designs, 

 

(This is our first Indiegogo campaign, we might make mistakes with the platform, if it happens, please bear with us to get the issue fixed)

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

More designs to be revealed and be available for pledging 

if campaign goes well on Indiegogo (our first time)

 

 

 

We prefer retaining our designs value and make them collectable instead of flooding the market, hence we do not restock. If you are interested in any of your past designs, they have retired from the market, however pindrop may be available. Please let us know via dm or email, we will check stock for you.

 

 

 

The Indiegogo fee : is roughly the same with Kickstarter fee, but with slightly higher transaction charge for us.

 

 

Shipping Fees  

Worldwide £5

UK £3

Kickstarter Backer £0

*Tracked Signed upgrade option available upon request.

Packaging - All pins will be protected with proper packaging to avoid damage.

Custom Fees - Please note that you will be responsible for any customs or VAT charges that may occur, (Customs may charge fees based on jewellery prices which might end up being higher than necessary, so we will attach a customs invoice to avoid unnecessary cost. We can not mark the items as gifts as this is illegal (plus even gifts will still trigger custom based on their category).

Reward Tiers - Please let us know if you need any help to select the correct tier, we will be messaging every backer to confirm what designs you are pledging for. 

Add-ons - You can select any reward as an add-on if your pledging for more than one design and the combination you want is not listed as a reward tier. 

Pledge Now, Pay Later - Kickstarter is all or nothing, you will not be charged until the end of the campaign and will only be charged if the project is successful!

Before the end of the Campaign, you are free to edit or cancel your pledge.

Support - If you need any assistance selecting rewards and add-ons or have a query please feel free to contact us through DM on twitter / instagram , or email us @ hederahelixillustration@outlook.com. We will respond as soon as possible.

Updates - We will be posting regular updates throughout the campaign.

 

Risks and challenges

 

Manufacturing Risks - I am familiar with this manufacturer and the risks that arise with manufacturing enamel pins, I will be working closely with the manager to reduce the chances of any problems.

Covid 19 - May cause sudden delays to orders, if this happens we will provide regular updates.

Shipping - Shipment delays during the pandemic.

story:
Welcome!

We are Cora and José.  We create art that highlights the diversity, challenges, and shared humanity of peoples across the globe.  We call this project Art We There Yet and have created works together in China, Nepal, India, and Nicaragua.  Now we want to take the project to North, Central, and South America!  

The Bus Project

Let's dive right into the heart of the bus project.  We are currently converting a used school bus into an art and recording studio on wheels, which we will then drive from the USA to Argentina.  Check out the updates tab for the latest on the conversion!

The Impact

Art is powerful.  We will use art and music to boldly illustrate that diversity is our greatest strength. This message is important today, when many are losing sight of our shared humanity and the value of diversity in society.  Also, we believe everyone deserves access to public art and arts education.  So we will provide free arts education and public art in places that need it the most.

How to Help Fund the Project

We are passionate about this project, and it is something we cannot do alone.  Our biggest hurdle right now is covering the operating costs of the project.

1 - Purchase our art and music here on Indiegogo

Shipping in the USA is free!

Note on prints and paintings.  Please note the photo prints and original paintings are unframed and will ship to you rolled.  Paintings will need to be mounted on stretcher bars, which is a service offered by framing providers.  How to choose your photo(s): click here to see 36 photograph options and to submit your photo choice.  

Click here to see large, high definition images of the José Luis Vílchez Original Paintings for sale.

2 - Become a Sponsor

Directly support a workshop or mural in an underserved community.  We currently need sponsors for:

  • 18 murals (8 sponsored, 10 still need sponsors)
  • 36 art and music workshops (1 sponsored, 35 still need sponsors)

3 - Other Ways You Can Help

Share this project with friends, family, and your social networks!  We cannot express how helpful this is.  You can also consider becoming an ongoing patron of the project on Patreon.

How else are we covering the costs?  Applying to grants, sponsorships, and working jobs on the side.  We are hard at it!

Wait, so who are you guys?

José Luis Vílchez is a fine art painter, photographer, and musician from Nicaragua and the USA.  He is a graduate of the School of the Art Institute of Chicago, one of most prestigious art schools in the world, and he has traveled to over 70 countries.  He co-founded the Lido Art Center in Guangzhou, China where he also conducted portfolio reviews to help students gain acceptance to the world's top art schools.  His work has been shown in galleries in the USA, China, India, Nicaragua, and Romania.  Here is his website. 

Cora Rose is a singer-songwriter and record producer from the USA.  She began songwriting at 7, performing at 12, and released her first album at 15.  She has written with Dave Brainard, Michael Peterson, Roy Rivers, and Jill King, and she has had placements in TV and film, including NBC's Parks and Recreation and the acclaimed documentary, Taming Wild.  She developed a songwriting and recording workshop program, which she has conducted in public K-12 schools throughout the USA.  Here is her website.

Work We Have Already Done

It takes a lot of trust to support a large project like this.  Here is some of the work we have already done, to show we are committed to this project and can pull it off.

Risks & Challenges

Risks of the Road.  This is a massive project we are gearing up to do.  We are 100% confident we can pull it off, because of our experience.  Between us, we have traveled to over 72 countries and we have over 7 years of combined experience funding our travels with art.  We have never traveled with wealth and know how to make ends meet with very little.  We know what it is to be flexible, to navigate difficult border crossings, to deal with corrupt officials.  We know what it is to find opportunities in new communities, to pick up new language (we are Spanish/English bilingual), and to integrate into local life.  We were made for this trip. 

The Artist Residency 

We are inviting fellow adventurous and flexible artists to join us on the bus for a 1-4 week artist residency.  If you are interested, read all about the residency here and then get in touch with us!

The Artist Residency We are inviting fellow adventurous and flexible artists to join us on the bus for a 1-4 week artist residency.  If you are interested, read all about the residency here and then get in touch with us!

story:
HEALING WAVES TAROT DECK

It was definitely a tough year for many of us, with lots of unexpected changes and fears and challenges all over the world. Not only physically but also mentally and spiritually as well. 

I began my journey and came across tarot a few years ago, that was when my interest in spiritual path grew. Normally when my energy is low I naturally bring myself near the body of water. Watching the waves crashing the shores and the horizon of the sea meets the sky like they have magical power to calm and to heal.
But if I was not near the ocean, I would paint.
I have been a professional illustrator for more than 10 years. I do art digitally and traditionally. I can say I perform well on both. But my favourite method is always watercolor.

In water color painting, you can not rush, you cannot be too slow. It has its timing when things will workout as we work on it, and the time it will work on itself like magic. It helps me be in the moments, observe and feel the power of creativity. 

For that reason I decided to create a project that focuses on the healing aspects of all those elements combined. To paint 78 tarot cards illustrations in the theme of oceans and natures in watercolor painting. But instead of using tap water, I used the water collected from the ocean directly as my painting medium. As we know, the effect of salt water with watercolor will be different from normal water and it’s something I enjoy exploring.  

This deck is not only made as the artist’s collection tarot, but also created with an intention to help us explore the depth of their soul, to reflect, to heal.

 


About the deck

The healing waves tarot deck is based on the traditional Rider-Waite Smith messages.

The deck will be printed in full colored, round cornered, 7cm x 12 cm cards with a small paper handbook in the box. 

The deck will contained 78 cards, 22 Major arcana and 56 Minor arcana
Cardstock will be 330gsm smooth Germany black core paper with matte laminate coating.

The illustration on the cards will be painted with watercolor, using water that I collected from the ocean as a medium with an intention to combine the healing aspect of mother nature and art into artwork. All the illustrations are originally created in ocean related themes.  

The deck is independently produced in limited numbers and will not be sold on Amazon or public.

Some of the card, such as The fool, contained many of original Rider-Waite Smith visual elements.

Some has different visual elements, Ace of pentacle, but still telling the same message as the original.

So the key elements are still remained.

 

For the minor arcana cards, each suits are their elements. The earth for the pentacle suit, the fire for the wands/staves suit, the air for the sword suit and the water for the cup suit. They're represented by sea life and animal of the ocean, AND some mermaids (or divers) :D
They are mostly using the narrative and scheme from RWS, that they're easy for the reader to read. 

For the court cards they are represented by the creatures also, For example the albatross for the king of sword, sea salamander for the knight of wands.


 

The Energy of the Healing Wave tarot deck

The deck was fully created with intentions of healing, for the creator herself and also for others as water color is also one of the most popular methods in art therapy as well. 

With the light, calming and refreshing tone of watercolor pictures and natural looking of the illustrations the energy will toward soothing sides and the silver lining in the dark situations.     

As well as the depth of the ocean I wish the users can use the deck as a navigator to explore the depth of their mind and soul, as when they’re facing big waves, storms and also discover their pearls.  

 

Rewards

Please check the perks for the rewards such as
The custom made pendulum 

The tin box for the treasure chest package 

The premium design velvet bag for cards.

Goal 

As a professional illustrator myself. My goal is to deliver all the 78 cards illustrations and produce them into a fully physical tarot deck in the highest quality of illustration and production I can possibly achieve. If the original goal is reached my next plan is to improve it further.   

The stretch goal will be as follow,

6,200$ - fully funded 

7,000$ - Add 1 extra bonus card in each decks (Will be 22 Major + 56 Minor + 1 extra card)

7,800$ - Replace tucked paper box with substantial paper box for every decks

The estimated shipping time would be around late spring, May-June 2021 depending on the world’s situation. I want to make sure everyone gets the best quality of artwork and physical products.

  
Budget distribution

As in the chart below. Part of the campaign money will go to Indiegogo fee and taxes.
The rest will go to the production part. For the art supplies I use in painting such as colors and papers or graphic design softwares for cards and books layout I covered it myself :)

 

Challenge & Risk 

Due Covid-19 the production and shipping might be delayed. But I’ll try to have spare time as much as possible and will keep posting updates closely with everyone.   

 

 

About me

I have been a professional illustrator for 10+ years, both on traditional methods and digital. But usually I draw traditionally for healing and experimenting more than for commercial purposes. So now I’m currently working in digital art industry and only paint when I feeling drawn toward it.I passionate about bringing ideas into vision and observe the reaction of the mediums I used when they interacted with each others.I came across tarot and can also read it myself, surrounded myself with many talented readers who helped me expanded my knowledge and gave me the sparks to start this project.  

 

Link to my art page https://www.facebook.com/Shelter.from.the.world/
