But instead of using tap water, I used the water collected from the ocean directly as my painting medium. As we know, the effect of salt water with watercolor will be different from normal water and it’s something I enjoy exploring.  This deck is not only made as the artist’s collection tarot, but also created with an intention to help us explore the depth of their soul, to reflect, to heal. About the deckThe healing waves tarot deck is based on the traditional Rider-Waite Smith messages.The deck will be printed in full colored, round cornered, 7cm x 12 cm cards with a small paper handbook in the box. The deck will contained 78 cards, 22 Major arcana and 56 Minor arcanaCardstock will be 330gsm smooth Germany black core paper with matte laminate coating.The illustration on the cards will be painted with watercolor, using water that I collected from the ocean as a medium with an intention to combine the healing aspect of mother nature and art into artwork. All the illustrations are originally created in ocean related themes.  The deck is independently produced in limited numbers and will not be sold on Amazon or public.Some of the card, such as The fool, contained many of original Rider-Waite Smith visual elements.Some has different visual elements, Ace of pentacle, but still telling the same message as the original.So the key elements are still remained. For the minor arcana cards, each suits are their elements. The earth for the pentacle suit, the fire for the wands/staves suit, the air for the sword suit and the water for the cup suit. They're represented by sea life and animal of the ocean, AND some mermaids (or divers) :DThey are mostly using the narrative and scheme from RWS, that they're easy for the reader to read. For the court cards they are represented by the creatures also, For example the albatross for the king of sword, sea salamander for the knight of wands. The Energy of the Healing Wave tarot deckThe deck was fully created with intentions of healing, for the creator herself and also for others as water color is also one of the most popular methods in art therapy as well. With the light, calming and refreshing tone of watercolor pictures and natural looking of the illustrations the energy will toward soothing sides and the silver lining in the dark situations.     As well as the depth of the ocean I wish the users can use the deck as a navigator to explore the depth of their mind and soul, as when they’re facing big waves, storms and also discover their pearls.   RewardsPlease check the perks for the rewards such asThe custom made pendulum The tin box for the treasure chest package The premium design velvet bag for cards.Goal As a professional illustrator myself. My goal is to deliver all the 78 cards illustrations and produce them into a fully physical tarot deck in the highest quality of illustration and production I can possibly achieve. If the original goal is reached my next plan is to improve it further.   The stretch goal will be as follow,6,200$ - fully funded 7,000$ - Add 1 extra bonus card in each decks (Will be 22 Major + 56 Minor + 1 extra card)7,800$ - Replace tucked paper box with substantial paper box for every decksThe estimated shipping time would be around late spring, May-June 2021 depending on the world’s situation. I want to make sure everyone gets the best quality of artwork and physical products.  Budget distributionAs in the chart below. Part of the campaign money will go to Indiegogo fee and taxes.The rest will go to the production part. For the art supplies I use in painting such as colors and papers or graphic design softwares for cards and books layout I covered it myself :) Challenge & Risk Due Covid-19 the production and shipping might be delayed. But I’ll try to have spare time as much as possible and will keep posting updates closely with everyone.     About meI have been a professional illustrator for 10+ years, both on traditional methods and digital. But usually I draw traditionally for healing and experimenting more than for commercial purposes. So now I’m currently working in digital art industry and only paint when I feeling drawn toward it.I passionate about bringing ideas into vision and observe the reaction of the mediums I used when they interacted with each others.I came across tarot and can also read it myself, surrounded myself with many talented readers who helped me expanded my knowledge and gave me the sparks to start this project.   Link to my art page https://www.facebook.com/Shelter.from.the.world/

story:
'ATMOSPHERE: A GRAPHIC NOVEL ABOUT THE POST-PUNK MANCHESTER MUSIC SCENE' is the follow-up to the acclaimed 'NEW DAWN FADES: A GRAPHIC NOVEL ABOUT JOY DIVISION & MANCHESTER'. Written and drawn by Brian Gorman.

This new book covers the late 1970s and 1980s Manchester music scene. It will also encompass Manchester's entire history, leading up to the present day. Featuring New Order, The Fall, The Drones, The Smiths, Buzzcocks, and many more. The legendary T J Davidson Rehearsal Studios was the hub of the Manchester music scene, and many iconic bands honed their skills within its walls. The foreword for this new book will be written by none other than TONY DAVIDSON himself!

Brian Gorman with Tony (TJ) Davidson, at the site of the original rehearsal studios, Manchester.  Photo: Shay Rowan.

 

Living and working in Manchester, I am lucky enough to be at the heart of the story, and to know many people who played in the bands, saw the bands, and wrote about them. With their invaluable help, 'ATMOSPHERE' will provide a unique and accurate flavour of a very special time. 

 

Previously:

In 2013 I wrote & produced 'NEW DAWN FADES: A PLAY ABOUT JOY DIVISION & MANCHESTER' for the Greater Manchester Fringe Festival. The show sold out every performance, and received rave reviews. We have since toured the UK over several years, and played to full houses and standing ovations.

Photo: Shay Rowan

 

"I was crying. It was very emotional at the end. It captured everything perfectly. I loved it; it had everything – the music and the emotion... there was such a buzz in the building."

Rowetta, Happy Mondays

 

"...a spellbinding and brilliant play about one of the greatest bands of all time. I totally urge anyone left out there who believes in music to go and see it."

John Robb, Louder Than War

 

Joseph Walsh as Ian Curtis. Dancehouse Theatre, Manchester 2019.

The graphic novel adaptation of New Dawn Fades (with a foreword by acclaimed music journalist Mick Middles) was published in 2018, and was equally well received:

"Open ‘New Dawn Fades: The Graphic Novel’ and what you have is a packed portal into the turbulent and transformative historical layers which make up Manchester; encompassing public figures, key moments, chaotic creativity – and of course, Joy Division. The depth of Gorman’s sensitive, skilled drawing– by his own hand – creates not just a book, but a visceral experience. His skill for capturing likenesses is impressive, and when combined with his artistic technique of intense, symbolic imagery, it brings place alive on the page. See for yourself."

– Emily Oldfield, Louder Than War

 

'ATMOSPHERE' will feature a mixture of original black & white artwork, and full colour illustrations and paintings by Brian Gorman.

Joy Division (art by Brian Gorman)

 

Tony Wilson. Art by Brian Gorman

 

Mark E Smith. Art by Brian Gorman

 

The Smiths. Art by Brian Gorman.

I am raising funds to enable me to work full-time on the book, and to publish it independently. It will take me approximately 4 months to complete, which will include extensive research, writing, artwork, design, and PR.  This graphic novel would simply not be possible without your help.

Unique perks include:

Your name in the 'Thanks to' section of the book.

Signed and dedicated copies of the book.

Invitation to the book launch/party, at an iconic Manchester venue.

Your likeness as a character in the book.

Original sketches.

Original pages of artwork from the book.

 

I am 100% confident that 'Atmosphere' will be a success. With YOUR help, we can make it.

"The Hacienda MUST be built!"

Thank You!!

 

Biography:

Brian Gorman was born in 1964, in Wigan. He is a freelance writer, artist, and actor. He has written for The Liverpool Daily Post, The Big Issue, Starburst Magazine, and Revive Magazine. His artwork has featured in a variety of publications, and in ITV's 'Martina Cole's Lady Killers'. Recent published work includes 'BORDERLINERS: TRUE REALITIES', 'EVERYMAN: A CELEBRATION OF PATRICK MCGOOHAN & THE PRISONER', 'NEW DAWN FADES: A GRAPHIC NOVEL ABOUT JOY DIVISION & MANCHESTER', and the upcoming 'ANIMUS' (written by S M Worsey).

Brian has acted for over 35 years, and appeared on stage, tv, film, and in online web series. He won the 2018 Salford Star Award for 'Best Performer' for 'ONE MAN BOND: EVERY BOND FILM IN 60 MINUTES' (which he has toured across England, and performed at Pinewood Studios and the Starburst Media City Festival). He is never bored.

story:
Mighty Impressions for Strange Times

What I do isn't fancy – I put ink on letters and press them into paper. I believe that letterpress printing has immense power to tell stories, start conversation, spark movements, and empower people. 

That's why at the start of the pandemic, I launched a weekly letterpress-printed newspaper, featuring stories of 10 words or less submitted by YOU. Each story, ad, and feature was set by hand, letter by letter, from antique metal type. 

Now, for the first time, every issue of the New Day newspaper will be meticulously scanned, printed and bound into a book, taking these ephemeral stories and making a lasting keepsake. The book will also include extensive behind-the-scenes images of the making of the newspaper, and stories on how they came to be. The limited First Edition will include a letterpress-printed cover. The guts of the book will be printed by Smart Set, a union print shop in Northeast Minneapolis that is dedicated to operating as a values-driven small business.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I would like to print a first edition of 250 copies. The costs for this include time and labor in scanning, design, and writing, as well as the printing costs. Books will be printed and bound by the union shop Smart Set in Northeast Minneapolis, and with the cover designed and printed by me at Fontlove Studio using antique type.
  • You will get a copy of this first edition! There are other awesome stretch pledge opportunities, too.
  • If I don't reach the entire goal, the funds raised will still go to offsetting the costs of production. The book will be printed and produced regardless of reaching the goal, but I deeply appreciate your support so I don't have to go into the hole to do it!

Risks & Challenges

I am committed to this project, but I can foresee a few challenges: one is that I am moving my studio in early March, which may take up a lot of my time and cause delays in the design process. Also, I am a parent of young kids in a pandemic, so everything takes me longer than I think it will. That said, I can't imagine a delay of longer than a month or two to complete production.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Looking for other ways to support Fontlove Studio and the New Day?

  • Spread the word about this campaign!
  • Become a subscriber of the New Day over on Patreon

story:
9/5/2015 UPDATE: Order the books! 

I am awash with gratitude. I never expected this much of a response and so quickly. Hundreds of supporters shared my campaign andy GoGo Factor went through the roof. Thank you all so much! 


Since the success of this first campaign, I've published Cats A-Z and it is now available for purchase online. 

I'm currently running a pre-sale campaign for the second book, Owl and Cat In Love, in the hopes of being able to publish it in time for the holidays. Check that out here. 


Where It All Started: 

I'm a wood block printmaker based in Philadelphia. I received my training at the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts and have exhibited widely for over a decade, including in Philadelphia's City Hall and at the Delaware Museum of Art. 
I have finished two book projects and initially sought a contract with an established publishing house. Preferably a small, independent press that specialized in unique and beautifully produced books. While I had success contracting with an agent and received plenty of encouragement, I soon found myself with a growing aspiration to launch my own press.  

Words On Woodcuts began as my art blog in 2010. Over the years I've maintained a consistent readership, and now attract an average of over 3,000 unique views every month. While I regularly write about the work of historical and contemporary printmakers, new work for my book projects always attracts the most hits. 

I am launching Words On Woodcuts Press this year because now I am ready. I have built up my platform as an artist/author, and I have two products to bring to market. 

The Books

The first book to be published will be Cats A-Z, a cat-themed alphabet book for adults, illustrated with black and white woodcuts. It's not just another cute cat book. Light humor blends with sardonic wit and serious philosophical musings. It's a cat book for those who are intellectual, literary, artsy, or simply contemplative. 

A large portion of the earnings from the sales of the first book will go toward the publication of the second book  Owl and Cat In Love. This is a true picture book and reimagining of Edward Lear's poem The Owl and the Pussycat in full color woodcuts. 

I have several more book projects in the queue to complete in my studio. For instance, not a cat person? Are dogs more your thing? If so, know that the creation of a companion volume Dogs A-to-Z is definitely in my studio queue. Another project in the queue is a picture book illustrating the poem The Nautilus and the Ammonite, anonymously written, in which two aquatic cousins form a friendship, travel and witness great sights together, until the ammonite is lost in the same mass extinction that ended the reign of dinosaurs. 

But before I get ahead of myself with all the future books I'm so eager to create, I need to publish and bring to market the two books that are finished. 

Built To Last  

In addition to this campaign, I'm applying for a small business loan. Any donations I receive exceeding $2,000 reduces the size of the necessary loan, and thus strengthens this business's chances of long-term success. 

How will the money be spent? The books that will be published by Words On Woodcuts Press will be gift books and keepsakes, physical objects to enjoy over and over again. Today there are print-on-demand services, but going that route would mean high prices, and many interested art-lovers would be unable to afford the books. Producing and marketing these books in editions large enough to keep the prices competitive requires a serious investment. Specifically, to finance professional cover design, editing, printing and shipping, promotional materials and advertisements. 

A large portion of the earnings from the sales of the first book will go toward the publication of the second book, and so on. 

Risks & Challenges

Nobody gets rich starting a small press. While it would be great if Words On Woodcuts Press is successful enough that I can "quit my day job", I don't count on it, and that isn't why I'm doing this. 

My motivations are to earn enough to continue and further develop my craft, and to get my artwork out to a broader audience.

In my business plan, I'm seeking out the best deals and working to keep overhead costs (and therefore prices) low, but I won't cut corners where it matters, such as the quality of graphic design and printing/binding. 

The most challenging part of this endeavor will be getting the word out to the right audience. I'm braced for a big learning curve when it comes to marketing. I'm sure it will take time to figure out what tactics are most effective, which again, is why I need capital to get the ball rolling. 

The bottom line is that no one cares about these books as much as I do. No one is more motivated than me to get this work into the hands of book-lovers who will cherish it.  

What You Get

Of course any good fundraising campaign must offer perks! Goodies in this fund drive start at $20. and include original woodcuts straight from my studio and signed copies of Cats A-Z when it is published this summer. You can view the entire series of Cats A-Z prints to choose from on my Etsy Store. Also, check in with the Words On Woodcuts blog during this 42 day campaign where I'll be posting about the 8 art cards I am designing as a thank-you gift for donors. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, you can still help launch this press. 

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.

Thanks for your help!

story:
Short Summary

  The monochrome version of the Crowley tarot was well received and I decided that it could be enhanced with colours, so I spent a great many hours colouring the images in a way that reflected the old hand tinted photos from the era that the deck recalls.

Unlike the Thoth Tarot that was created by Aleister Crowly, this deck uses the Rider Smith Waite standard of divination. The images on the cards represent a number of individuals who were associated with the rising popularity of occultism during Crowley's time.

What We Need & What You Get

The deck arrives in a sturdy two part box with a durable glossy finish, and the first 78 pledges will receive a ltd. edition Hermit card. The cards are printed on beautiful 120 weight stock and measure the standard 2.75" X 4.75" size.

THE FIRST 78 PLEDGES WILL RECIEVE A RANDOMLY DRAWN GLOSSY CARD FROM A SINGLE DECK. (Which card will you receive and what will it tell you?}

The Impact

Your pledge will allow me to complete and deliver a unique deck to fans of tarot and art alike.

A guide to the Crowley tarot is available for free in pdf and E-book format.

Risks & Challenges

My main challenge is reaching a funding goal, however, with Indiegogo the option of receiving whatever funds you raise is much easier than attempting to reach a certain goal and failing to meet the mark. With this option I'm assured that the deck will be produced.

Other Ways You Can Help

Indiegogo has share tools you can use and word of mouth is most helpful so you can certainly help by spreading the word that you're supporting a fascinating tarot deck.

story:
Emergent Poise:

Pratt MFA 2020 Artist Collective Exhibition


Curatorial Section I & II
March 25th — April 25th, 2021
at Culture Lab LIC at Plaxall Gallery
Opening: March 26th, 5-9 pm

Curatorial Section III & IV
April 3rd — April 29th, 2021
at On Canal by Wallplay
Opening: April 3rd and 17th, 12-7 pm

 


About Our Project

The 2020 class of Master of Fine Arts cohort from Pratt Institute is organizing an exhibition entitled Emergent Poise. As Covid19 descended on NYC, our final thesis year was abruptly dismantled just as our thesis shows were about to debut. All shows were canceled, and, as a cohort, we were forced to withdraw from our studios and shelter in place, along with the community at large.

As this new reality settled in, we adjusted our approaches, found new spaces and working methods, and worked through the disappointment and heartache. We found our focus sharpened and distilled, remaining poised to make our move. We are now gathering together to launch a group showcase of the work of the class of 2020. The exhibition will include our thesis work and show how our individual practices have responded in this emergent world.  

We are raising funds to help us realize this exhibition and reaching out to ask for your help. As the world shut down, we all turned to the arts to offer perspective, comfort, and relief during this crucial time. Our strength has always been in our diversity and our earnestness toward our explorations, and we are asking for your support as we continue the conversation.

We’ve currently confirmed our bookings with Culture Lab LIC at Plaxall Gallery and On Canal by Wallplay; utilizing both spaces simultaneously will allow us to show all of our artists' works together at the same time. 

We will be paying for the rent, printing a simple catalogue, installing exhibition wall text and labels, building a temporary wall as the main costs for our show. We will also have transportation costs to rent vehicles, as we will be transporting and installing all participating artists’ work ourselves. Our goal is to raise $5,925, and we are accepting donations via IndieGoGo. You can find the campaign details on this page and see the original artworks our artists have donated as gifts in return for your generous contributions. We are thrilled to be bringing this show to fruition.

With much gratitude,
-Pratt Institute MFA Cohort of 2020



Our Team

  • Project Organizer: Kosuke Kawahara
  • Statment Supervisors: Duff Norris, Caito Stewart, Allie Stabile
  • Curators: Jerry Chan, Katie Croft, Evelyn Golden, Emmett Metier, Duff Norris, Caito Stewart, Meirav Zaks
  • Graphic Designers: Dasol Hong, Evelyn Golden
  • Digital Platform Designers: Stewart Bird, Chao Wang
  • Fundraising Members: Kosuke Kawahara, Jinyong Choi, Jerry Chan, Duff Norris



Curatorial Sections

Section I: Transcorporeaity
Curator: Emmet Metier
Artists: Stewart Bird, Jinyong Choi, Emmett Metier, Jackie Slanley, Chao Wang
Location: Culture Lab LIC at Plaxall Gallery
Date: March 25th - April 25th
Opening Reception: March 26th, 5-9 pm

Section II: Moisten Clay 
Curators: Jerry Chan, Meirav Zaks
Artists: Jerry Chan, Kosuke Kawahara, Kunkun, Allie Stabile, Meirav Zaks
Location: Culture Lab LIC at Plaxall Gallery
Date: March 25th - April 25th
Opening Reception: March 26th, 5-9 pm

Section III: Persona
Curator: Duff Norris
Artists: Evelyn Golden, Rodrigo Jimenez-Ortega, Josh Meillier, Duff Norris, Na’ye Perez, Alyssa Thornton
Location: On Canal by Wallplay
Date: April 3rd - April 15th
Opening Reception: April 3rd, 12-7 pm

Section IV: Assertion of Life
Curators: Katie Croft, Caito Stewart
Artists: Katie Croft, Dewy, Dasol Hong, So Ye Oh, Amber Peck, Caito Stewart
Location: On Canal by Wallplay
Date: April 17th - April 29th
Opening Reception: April 17th, 12-7 pm


Culture Lab LIC at​ Plaxall Gallery

5-25 46th Ave, Queens, NY 11101​
Culture Lab LIC is a new nonprofit (501(c)(3) pending) organization formed to support the efforts of local artists who have been running the Plaxall Gallery, and its significant community work and arts programming over the past three years. Culture Lab is supported by Plaxall Inc. and Hunters Point Parks Conservancy. Curatorial sections I and II plan to exhibit their works at this location.
 

On Canal

321 Canal St., New York, NY 10013
Over 20 storefront spaces on Canal Street are now operated by Wallplay. Each location is dedicated to hosting short-term brand rentals, installations & projects. Curatorial sections III and IV plan to exhibit their works at this location.



Stewart Bird (stewart-bird.com)
Jerry Chan (jerryccn.com)
Jinyong Choi (jinyong-choi.com)
Katie Croft (katiecroftart.com)
Dewy (art-by-dewy.com)
Evelyn Golden (@evelynlgolden)
Dasol Hong (dasolhong.com)
Rodrigo Jimenez-Ortega (rodrigojimenez-ortega.com)
Kosuke Kawahara (kosukekawahara.org)
Kunkun (kunkunlin.com)
Josh Meillier (joshmeillier.com)
Emmett Metier (emmettmetier.com)
Duff Norris (duffnorris.com)
So Ye Oh (soyeoh.com)
Amber Peck (amberpeck.com)
Na’ye Perez (@naye_davinci1914)
Jackie Slanley (jackie-slanley.com)
Allie Stabile (alliestabile.com)
Caito Stewart (caitlin-caito-stewart.com)
Alyssa Thornton (alyssathornton.com)
Chao Wang (chaowangart.com)
Meirav Zaks (meiravzaks.com)


 



Total: $5,925 

  • Space rental fee at On Canal: $3,000
     
  • Insurance for both Spaces: $500
    - Coverage for 30 days (including installing/uninstalling dates)

    To ensure our protection in the case of any unexpected damage to the artworks or exhibition spaces.
  • Promotional Materials: $800
    - Exhibition Posters (H 24” x W18”) / 10 prints: $100
    - Exhibition Postcards (H 4"x W 6") / 500 prints: $100
    - Exhibition Catalogue (H 8.5” x W 5.5”) / 400 prints: $600
     
  • Wall Texts: $250
    Curatorial statements and titles, along with relevant labels, will be produced and installed with the works.
     
  • Installation Costs: $1,225
    - Renting vehicles for load-in, load-out (five times): $275
    - Lumber, Sheetrock, Wall paint, Spackle, for building a temporary wall: $250
    - Pedestals & other display needs: $300
    - Lighting equipment rental: $200
    - Digital Equipment rental (projectors, monitors, etc): $200
    - Trash removal (temp wall): $150

    These are the bare minimum estimated costs of installation. They will cover shipping costs, installation materials, buying/renting required equipment. Installation costs will be one of the largest expenses necessary for this exhibition since we need to build a temporary wall at On Canal. 
     
  • Digital Platform Costs: $100

    The Digital Platform team will archive our exhibition and launch a virtual gallery for distanced viewing. It will provide an alternative way to view our work for those who are unable to visit the exhibition in person and beyond the exhibition schedule. This will include an online catalogue for the full group show.
     

​If we raise more than $5,925, we plan to donate a portion of the funds to Culture Lab LIC, an arts non-profit that has generously given us space for free. Also, we might have the option to extend our exhibition period and print our catalogue in large amounts, which would help us gain exposure as emerging artists.



These gifts are not only a token of our gratitude to donors; they also help us promote our work after the exhibition. Participants are all emerging artists who need exposure, especially now that the pandemic has severely limited our opportunities to share our work with the public for the time being. You will be supporting our careers when you donate funds, purchase and display our works in your home, or send postcards featuring our work to your friends and family. 

*Any fees for shipping these gifts to the United States are included in your donation amount.

 

  • $25: Support Us and Get Our Exhibition Catalogue
    In return for your donation of $25, you will receive our Exhibition Catalogue. Created by our curatorial team and featuring images of all participating artists’ work, it will serve as an archive of the exhibition, with a simple softcover and 32 full-color pages (h 5.5 x w 8.5 inches). Your name will also be included as a sponsor in the exhibition catalogue.
     

  • $50/$100: Support Us and Get an Original Artwork
    In return for your donation of $50/$100, you will receive an original artwork created and donated by one of our participating artists. You may choose from a list of donated artworks, but they are allocated on a first-come, first-served basis. Please see the sample images below. Your name will also be included as a sponsor in the exhibition catalogue.
     

  • $500+: Support Us and Get an Original Artwork
    We will contact you about the larger works we have to offer and which artist you might be interested in collecting. Your name will also be included as a sponsor in the exhibition catalogue.
     

*As of March 16th, we will send the catalogue data to the printing company. Your name will be only included if contributed by March 15th.


This list includes the donated works for Art Bag 50!
 

  • Handmade Postcards by Duff Noris (limited to 15 pcs)

Vagina postcard series, 2020, Mixed media, stencil, spray paint, 4”x6” 

​
 

  • Handmade Accesorries by Jinyong Choi (limited to 20 pcs)





 

This list includes the donated works for Art Bag 100!
 

  • Mini Sculptures by Dewy (limited to 24 pcs)

Small hopes, 2020. Resin and dye. 1 1/2"x1 1/2"x1/2"


 

  • Editioned Prints by Emmett Metier (edition of 10 each)



 

  • Editioned Prints by Dasol Hong (edition of 5 without signed/AP)

Wheel of Fire. 2020. Digital inkjet print. 10"x10" 


 

  • Original Mini Drawings by Kosuke Kawahara (limited to 24 pcs)

Disfigured Asteroids, Ink, ballpoint, pencil on Index Card, 2"x3"


*Sample images.






Thank you for taking the time to look at our project. We hope to include your support in realizing our exhibition Emergent Poise!

If you are unable to donate but would still like to support us, you can do so by sharing this campaign and news of our exhibition with others. Messages of goodwill and encouragement are also appreciated!​

Pratt MFA 2020 Artist Collective
emergentpoise.net
@emergent.poise
info@emergentpoise.net

About Our Project
The 2020 class of Master of Fine Arts cohort from Pratt Institute is organizing an exhibition entitled Emergent Poise. As Covid19 descended on NYC, our final thesis year was abruptly dismantled just as our thesis shows were about to debut. All shows were canceled, and, as a cohort, we were forced to withdraw from our studios and shelter in place, along with the community at large.As this new reality settled in, we adjusted our approaches, found new spaces and working methods, and worked through the disappointment and heartache. story:
“Look now on Scotland, which hitherto shadows have enveloped, lit and gleaming with a clear light, in all of its parts.”

– Dutch cartographer Joan Blaeu

The Atlas of Scotland is an ambitious new project to create the first major Scottish atlas for over 100 years.

Produced as a visually striking hardback book, combining text with illustrated maps, the Atlas will shed new light on Scotland's size and resources, its cultural and political history, as well as its long standing as one of the ancient kingdoms of Europe and the richness of its international connections.

As satellite images replace traditional paper atlases, modern technology leaves us with an incomplete picture of the nation. By returning to map-making in pen and ink, and by retelling the story of Scotland’s history and culture, this Atlas aims to delve deeper into the fabric of the land and reveal one of the world’s oldest nations in a whole new light.

What will be in the Atlas?

The Atlas of Scotland will explore:

  • Geology, mountains and rivers
  • Scottish history, culture and literature
  • Local history of towns and cities
  • Scotland's international connections

How will the money be spent?

All funds raised will contribute towards:

  • Materials (paper, pens, ink)
  • Printing costs for the finished book
  • Creative labour (estimated to span a year)
  • Short films for social media

How can you help?

Supporters can donate any amount towards the Atlas, but there are also a number of 'perks' at different levels. Here's how you can help the project:

  • Atlas Keeper: Donate £35 to receive a signed hardback copy of the Atlas.
  • Atlas Patron: Donate £75 to receive a signed hardback copy of the Atlas and have your name printed in the list of patrons.
  • Atlas Benefactor: Donate £150 to receive 2 signed hardback copies of the Atlas and have your name printed in the list of patrons.
  • Atlas Champion: Donate £500 to receive 2 signed copies of the Atlas, have your name printed in the list of patrons, and receive a large map of Scotland wall print (full size can be reduced to fit your space).

About the artist

I’m a writer and artist from Edinburgh, with a keen interest in Scottish literature, history and culture. In 2011 I was one of the co-founders of the arts campaign National Collective, and in 2016 I released my first book, Summer of Independence, published by Word Power Books.

Recently I brought out my second book, The Illustrated Declaration of Arbroath, which was published by the Saltire Society. The book was designed to be a creative and accessible celebration of the Declaration of Arbroath in the run-up to the document’s 700th anniversary in April 2020. The book was launched at the National Records of Scotland, and also led to a number of spin-off projects including the creation of schools packs in partnership with the National Records and Historic Environment Scotland.

The new Atlas of Scotland project is in many ways an expansion of the same idea, to make Scottish history and culture more accessible and more widely understood.

"The writer has a keen sense of power dynamics, history and literature, but more importantly he has imagination and talent. We can have faith in Scotland’s future with young writers like this." – Meaghan Delahunt

Other ways you can help

If you'd like to support this project but can't donate, I'd appreciate your help in getting the word out. Please consider sharing the link with your networks, and follow me on social media for updates:

Facebook: Andrew Redmond Barr

Twitter: @AndrewRBarr

Instagram: @AndrewRBarr

Website: AndrewRBarr.com

Any questions? Contact me: AndrewRBarr.com/Contact

story:
If you did not support this campaign & want the official Nailbot - join the waitlist!

 

1. Support us by Jan 9, 2016 @ 12 AM for early access to beta units.
2. You can paint your nails any color that is lighter than the art (you can use your own gel or standard polish)  - but white or light polish makes the art appear more vibrant. 
3. The Nailbot is for ANYONE that loves art, creativity & self expression!
5. Working Demo

 

 

 

The Nailbot prints unique art, emoji, pictures and your designs directly onto your fingernail from your phone in less than 5 seconds. The Nailbot is not only a beauty device, it's an innovative robot for play, fun & inspiration for anyone who loves nail art - especially girls and women.

 

 

Find more Nail Art on our Instagram page & our Campaign Gallery!

 

 

 

PERK ALERT: PROGRAM YOUR OWN PRINTER
Want to build your own DIY printer using an open source platform?
Our Maker Kit is one of the early Nailbot prototypes that we built!

 

 

MAKER KIT CONTENTS:

Written & Video Tutorial 

Electronics: Arduino Uno & Inkshield 

Inkjet Cartridge 

Screen

Power supply

Housing 

 

 

 


Could A Nail Art Printer Be Girls' Gateway To The Tech World? - NPR
Preemadonna Turns Your Smartphone Into A Nail Salon - TechCrunch
Nailbot Instant Nail Art Becomes Battlefield Finalist- WWD
A Nail-Painting Robot Controlled by Your Smart Phone - Upvoted
The Nailbot Robot Paints Your Nails and Empowers Girls - Yahoo Beauty 
The Nailbot of Our Dreams is Now Real - Cambio 
By women, for girls: Preemadonna challenges Silicon Valley’s boys club - The Next Web  

 

 

 

 


Risks & Challenges

While we have worked tirelessly building and refining our prototypes, there are also risks associated with backing a crowdfunding campaign.

Our working prototypes are being refined to a sleeker form factor. This requires additional engineering work. Given our ability to rapidly prototype and test products quickly in the field to improve the Nailbot, we are confident that we can transform our works like prototype to a stylish Nailbot. But we must execute quickly to meet the ship dates that we have proposed.

Manufacturing & QA
We spent January to May 2015 in Shenzhen, China making sure that we had a solid understanding of how to manufacture the Nailbot. We visited numerous factories, shortlisted contract manufacturers and researched how to design the next iterations of our prototypes for manufacturing. We plan on spending a significant amount of time in China again as we manufacture the Nailbot in 2016.
We have an outstanding manufacturing support system with our hardware accelerator, HAX, and numerous hardware advisors (from companies like Cisco & iRobot) with experience shipping millions of units of consumer electronics and complex consumer robotics products.

Formulation in Consumables
We are testing different formulations in our cartridges and polishes. While we expect to have this finalized in the coming weeks, there are third party certifications that we must meet to ship a cosmetic product both within the United States and internationally. Pree has personally attended a cosmetic and drug safety training over the summer and we will be working with specialist with decades of experience in personal care regulations moving forward.

 

FAQ

Product

Is the Nailbot Safe?

We have spent years working on various designs to ensure a safe product for our nieces, daughters, girlfriends and community. We are also finalizing our formulation and ink sourcing. We will be doing significant safety testing on the device before shipping and may seek a voluntary third party certification on the entire system.

How long do the Nailbot prints last?

They will last a few days - you do need to put a top coat to seal the image. We find that the traditional nail polish underneath will chip first before the prints actually fade.

How do I remove the Nailbot prints?

You can remove the prints with traditional nail polish remover or remover pads. We will also offer these on our website in time.

What happens if it prints on my skin or my daughter's skin?

We are working extensively on our accuracy - but you can remove with traditional nail polish remover or wipes. 

Do you use Bluetooth and/or WiFi to connect your phone to the Nailbot?

Yes. Prototypes built have used both. In the video, we use WiFi. Beta Units will use WiFi.

What resolution is possible with the Nailbot?

The resolution of the Nailbot is the same as traditional thermal inkjet products and can reach up to 1200 dpi. Note: While it can print with this resolution, the effective resolution for the Nailbot application will likely be less due to spacing constraints.

How is computer vision integrated?

Preemadonna has already proven our ability to develop and use computer vision in our products. Our first prototype, Gracie, was able to use the front facing camera to capture a picture of the nail and find the edges. Preemadonna's augmented reality app, which we are releasing, finds the edges of the nail in near real time using your smartphone’s camera to appropriately place the graphic onto the nail. For this Nailbot offered on Indiegogo, we will combine the computer vision functions of our augmented reality app with the printing functions to be able to automatically size the art to fit each user's nail size.

What kind of cradle or case is my phone sitting in when using the Nailbot?

The Final Nailbot for shipping will have adjustable cradle that is safe for your phone. And many girls have asked that we create mobile phone cases with the Preemadonna logo on it - so yes, those will come in time too. Make sure you keep tabs on our website.

What if I have small or big fingers or fingernails?

The cradle can accommodate most fingers/fingernails of girls. We use your phone's back facing camera and advanced computer vision algorithms to detect your fingernail - so we will be able to size your fingernail accurately!

Will the Nailbot paint my full nail with the white nail polish and pre-print polish automatically?

Not yet. We are working on a Nailbot that automates the 'polish change' - but it is not ready for shipment or orders. But we know this is what many women want!

Will I have to replace the cartridge?

The cartridge should last for over 5000 manicures (imagine 10 nails with 10 different images/art = 1 manicure). Should you mishandle the Nailbot or not use it for months (the ink may dry), then you will want to purchase a new cartridge which will be available on our website/app. However, it may be more beneficial to just upgrade the Nailbot when that happens.

Is the Nailbot Beta Unit  Battery operated?

That is the current plan for official Nailbot units down the road. However, this requires added development and our current prototypes do not have this feature. Our Beta Units will very likely NOT be battery operated and require a electrical plug outlet.

Timing & Shipping

Will it be available sooner? Do I really have to wait?

We know this is a long time to wait, but we prefer to be transparent with our backers. We WILL be hosting events through Ambassadors, Community Partners and Maker Faires, all across the United States in 2016 with a limited number of working Nailbots. Our App will also be released earlier for you to start discovering, creating and sharing cool nail art. If you can't wait for that long, buy Maker Kit and program a DIY printer!

Preemadonna is a global nation! When will you ship the Nailbot outside the United States?

Soon! There are additional certifications and requirements we must meet before shipping the Nailbot outside the United States. If the response is positive in the U.S., we will open up future campaigns to certain international regions.

The Nailbot is too expensive for me - will this be cheaper soon?

It's much more affordable to get the Nailbot on Indiegogo NOW with major discounts as the retail regular price of the Nailbot is $299 - our early backers reap rewards for supporting us early with beta units.

We need to stand by a pricepoint in our early days that allows us to buy inventory, continue building our team and shipping product.

How long have you been working on the Nailbot?

Pree had the idea in 2012 and we started working on it full time in January 2013.

Do you have intellectual property filed on the Nailbot?

Yes. We have patent filings on the entire Nailbot Product Family dating back to 2013.

Community

What is the Preemadonna Ambassador Program?

Our Ambassador program is a way to incorporate our pre-teen and teen supporters into our company and movement. Our Ambassadors are signing up as Hackers, Artists and Social Bees - our program and offerings are serious fun.

Who do you see using the Nailbot the most?

Girls LOVE the Nailbot. But really anyone that thinks art and tech are cool will get a kick out of the Nailbot.

Have you tested any of your prototypes on people?

Yep. Casey and Pree are also great guinea pigs:)

I identify as a male. But I want to use the Nailbot - is that OK?!

Sure! We welcome everyone that celebrates creativity into our company. You are definitely a Preemadonna!

Can I beta test the Nailbot first?

Our Indiegogo backers, Community Partners and Ambassadors get first access. You can find us at events across the country!

STE(A)M & Education

What is the “Maker Kit”? Can I buy one for my classroom or youth tech camp?

So many girls have asked if they could build their own printer. So we created a maker program for girls to program and build their own touchscreen printer. This printer is NOT to be used to print on fingernails - girls can instead print on paper or stickers. The Maker Kit uses Arduino and will come with written and video tutorials.

Can I build mobile applications on top of the Nailbot? That would be a great way to have your pre-teen and teen Preemadonnas contribute their computer science skills?

In time, YES! That is exactly our intention. Sign up as a Preemadonna Ambassador or if you are part of a social purpose organization, get in touch!

Can I or my daughter design art for the Nailbot?

YES! That feature will be integrated into our mobile app. In the interim, we are showing girls how to use digital software to create fun nail art. Learn more about our Artist program with our Preemadonna Ambassadors initiative.

Nailbot Roadmap

What happened to the first Nailbot we saw on your website and You Tube Channel?

We’ve been working on our Nailbots for a long time! Gracie – the early Nailbot – does work! But it is not ready for commercial sale. The touchscreen application is quite novel and we have significant IP filed – but it is not an ideal customer experience just yet. Stay tuned to our company’s progress and you will see it offered for sale in the future.

The Nailbot is so cool for my 13 year old daughter, but do you have a Nailbot for me?

YES! Though pre-teens and teens are our “power users,” our Nailbots are meant for everyone that expresses themselves with cool art and nail decoration, including our moms, millennial girlfriends and nieces. Even our nephews want the Nailbot!

Future Nailbots: We have been working on our entire product roadmap for three years. We want every girl and woman (or person that loves creativity!) in your family to have a Nailbot that decorates their nails - whether with art designs or full coverage polish! We are a transparent company and hope to involve our earliest supporters in our product development - so here's a sneak peek!

Funding

Do you have outside funding from venture capitalists or famous angel investors? Who is funding this venture?

 

Yes, over the past 2 and a half years we have raised a small amount of capital from friends, family, select angels and a hardware accelerator/seed stage venture capital firm. Some of these investors are also advisors and will be crucial as we manufacture. Without these individuals & YOUR support, the Nailbot would not be possible. Thank you!

 

* All nail prints shown are photographs of real nails.
story_txt:
If you did not support this campaign & want the official Nailbot - join the waitlist!
 1. Support us by Jan 9, 2016 @ 12 AM for early access to beta units.2. You can paint your nails any color that is lighter than the art (you can use your own gel or standard polish)  - but white or light polish makes the art appear more vibrant. 3. The Nailbot is for ANYONE that loves art, creativity & self expression!5. Working Demo 
 
 
The Nailbot prints unique art, emoji, pictures and your designs directly onto your fingernail from your phone in less than 5 seconds. The Nailbot is not only a beauty device, it's an innovative robot for play, fun & inspiration for anyone who loves nail art - especially girls and women.

 


 
Find more Nail Art on our Instagram page & our Campaign Gallery!

 
 

 


PERK ALERT: PROGRAM YOUR OWN PRINTERWant to build your own DIY printer using an open source platform?Our Maker Kit is one of the early Nailbot prototypes that we built!


 
 
MAKER KIT CONTENTS:
Written & Video Tutorial 
Electronics: Arduino Uno & Inkshield 
Inkjet Cartridge 
Screen
Power supply
Housing 
 
 
 


Could A Nail Art Printer Be Girls' Gateway To The Tech World? - NPRPreemadonna Turns Your Smartphone Into A Nail Salon - TechCrunchNailbot Instant Nail Art Becomes Battlefield Finalist- WWDA Nail-Painting Robot Controlled by Your Smart Phone - UpvotedThe Nailbot Robot Paints Your Nails and Empowers Girls - Yahoo Beauty The Nailbot of Our Dreams is Now Real - Cambio By women, for girls: Preemadonna challenges Silicon Valley’s boys club - The Next Web  
 
 

 
 

Risks & ChallengesWhile we have worked tirelessly building and refining our prototypes, there are also risks associated with backing a crowdfunding campaign.Our working prototypes are being refined to a sleeker form factor. This requires additional engineering work. Given our ability to rapidly prototype and test products quickly in the field to improve the Nailbot, we are confident that we can transform our works like prototype to a stylish Nailbot. But we must execute quickly to meet the ship dates that we have proposed.Manufacturing & QAWe spent January to May 2015 in Shenzhen, China making sure that we had a solid understanding of how to manufacture the Nailbot. We visited numerous factories, shortlisted contract manufacturers and researched how to design the next iterations of our prototypes for manufacturing. We plan on spending a significant amount of time in China again as we manufacture the Nailbot in 2016.We have an outstanding manufacturing support system with our hardware accelerator, HAX, and numerous hardware advisors (from companies like Cisco & iRobot) with experience shipping millions of units of consumer electronics and complex consumer robotics products.Formulation in ConsumablesWe are testing different formulations in our cartridges and polishes. While we expect to have this finalized in the coming weeks, there are third party certifications that we must meet to ship a cosmetic product both within the United States and internationally. Pree has personally attended a cosmetic and drug safety training over the summer and we will be working with specialist with decades of experience in personal care regulations moving forward.
 
FAQ
Product
Is the Nailbot Safe?
We have spent years working on various designs to ensure a safe product for our nieces, daughters, girlfriends and community. We are also finalizing our formulation and ink sourcing. We will be doing significant safety testing on the device before shipping and may seek a voluntary third party certification on the entire system.
How long do the Nailbot prints last?
They will last a few days - you do need to put a top coat to seal the image. We find that the traditional nail polish underneath will chip first before the prints actually fade.
How do I remove the Nailbot prints?
You can remove the prints with traditional nail polish remover or remover pads. We will also offer these on our website in time.
What happens if it prints on my skin or my daughter's skin?
We are working extensively on our accuracy - but you can remove with traditional nail polish remover or wipes.

story:
FINAL WEEKEND SALE TO PRE ORDER YOUR COPY!

Reinterpreting every single card, the Outsider Tarot marries ancient esoteric systems with the colorful and revolutionary spirit of Outsiders past and present.  The spark of inspiration was to create a deck that directly channels the wisdom of our beautifully eccentric, forward-thinking predecessors to provide guidance through obstacles and towards enlightenment. 

 

Brand new image of the final deck printing!

 

From diva to drag queen, 

Poet to hustler, 

Rebel to hacktivist, 

Essential worker to young migrant, 

Renegade filmmakers to queer tattooist, 

Transgender icon to uncompromising revolutionary...

 

I designed the Outsider Tarot to be an indispensable divination tool for anyone who lives beyond the boundaries of society.

 

 

I've also written a 225 page guidebook that covers the symbolism, meanings and framework of the Outsider Tarot. See the section on the guidebook below for more info.

Two above images are of the final printing of the deck and box!

The 2-piece art box for the Outsider Tarot will be full color inside and out, fabricated from highly protective 1200 GSM cardboard.   The inside of the box features an easy-access key to the suits and elementals - and the white pattern on the front of the box will be in SILVER FOIL!

 

The final printing!

The artwork of the Outsider Tarot is hand drawn and painted with watercolor and gouache. Every image is composed of black outlines filled with bright fields of color that spark the reader’s intuition and psychic powers. 

I think of the Outsider Tarot’s style as classic old-school Tarot meets vintage comic books and pop art. The iconography — from TV sets to roses, light bulbs to shopping plazas, magic charms to fabulous drag —  is culled from my Italian roots and my life experience as a queer, a witch, an artist and an activist. 

 

The Outsider Tarot's symbolism is intuitive and completely open to interpretation.

 

  

The Clown Witch of New Orleans, APOSTROPHE as the Root of Bottles !

@apostrophe_period on Instagram!

 

The Outsider Tarot removes all human figures from the Major Arcana to make room for each Outsider to envision themself in every card.

 

 

Each one of us is the Fool on our own life journey.  

 

Placing the Fool's bandanna over our eyes, we leap wildly from one Major to the next! 

I like to think of the 21 Major Arcana cards that come after the Fool as scenes for each Tarot reader to play and improvise.  Each one offers costumes, props, or set pieces to psychically interact with. 

 

The scenes of the MAJOR ARCANA from the Outsider Tarot

 

The Outsider Tarot guidebook offers stage direction with the props, costumes and set pieces for every Major Arcana card.  These stage directions are visual meditations to help each reader dive deep into each Major Arcana and spark psychic visions.

 

 

 

The suits of the Outsider Tarot are represented by symbols that we see everywhere but don’t pay much attention to: LIGHTS, BOTTLES, EYES and ROSES. These objects, at once omnipresent and overlooked, offer profound ways to meditate and to contemplate the power of each suit.

 

 

Every Minor Arcana card features an inspiring Outsider or group of Outsiders. Some are instantly recognizable like Edith Piaf from the Fathom of Eyes or Frida Kahlo in the 8 of Bottles.  Other Outsiders are more obscure like R&B singer Jackie Shane from the 5 of Lights. Some minors are representative of many Outsiders like The Resistance pictured in the 3 of Eyes or essential workers in the 7 of Roses.

 

 

The SUIT of LIGHTS is where personal identity is forged in the element of fire. It is the suit where we are inspired to begin new projects and go on new adventures. The world of Lights is where our passions burn, consume and transform us. It is the realm of sex and parties, projects and ventures, obsession and intensity, travel and higher learning  — most importantly, it is a place for new beginnings.

 

 

 

The SUIT of BOTTLES is where we nurture ourselves and others in the element of water. Bottles offer a container that gives shape to everything that begins formless, like consciousness, intuition, emotions, knowledge and memories. By giving these matters temporary form in the suit of Bottles, we are able to contemplate their complexity, significance and power. This is the suit of love, nurturing, incubation and meditation. 

**Includes two versions of the 2 of Bottles.

 

 

The SUIT of EYES is where we have an opportunity to connect to our soul, the spirit that animates us, in the element of air.  In the suit of Eyes, we interact with others, with society, in person or virtually. These interactions can be as calm as a breeze or as forceful as a tornado.  The suit of Eyes is where we learn that seeing isn’t always believing. This is where we get out our tools, and we make our ideas into reality. The suit of Eyes is where we fight for our ideas, for justice and for equality.  This is the suit of wisdom and clarity.

 

 

The SUIT of ROSES  is where we deepen our connection to the natural world in the element of earth.  When there is little connection to or interest in nature, there will always be more attachment to the material plane. The suit of Roses lets us know when this axis is out of whack, when material concerns and labor dampen our spirits and our ability to enjoy what’s right in front of us.  This is also the suit where we complete and release our creations into the world.

 

 

 

The Outsider Tarot has evicted the King, Queen, Knight and Page and invited a lovely band of eccentrics known as the ELEMENTALS to take their place.  Each Elemental embodies one of the four elements of fire, air, water and earth, bringing all those properties into its suit. 

 

 

TO SPARK A FIRE:  Sparks embody the element of FIRE — child-like figures at the beginning of a new journey.  Sparks replace Pages.

 

 

A BILLOW OF AIR:  Billows characterize the element of Air — young adults in the early stages of life and exploration. Billows replace Knights.

** INCLUDES SPECIAL EDITION VERSION OF BILLOW OF BOTTLES: BRITNEY!

 

 

 

TO FATHOM THE WATER:  Fathoms personify the element of Water —  masters who possess the deepest understanding of their suit’s power. Fathoms replace Queens.

 

 

TAKE ROOT IN EARTH:  Roots are the element of Earth —  teachers, mentors and sages offering us wisdom and valuable life lessons in each of the four suits.  Roots replace Kings.

 

The 225  page guidebook is the essential guide to the symbolism, meanings and framework of the Outsider Tarot. Reinterpreting every single card, the Outsider Tarot marries ancient esoteric systems with the colorful and revolutionary spirit of Outsiders past and present. 
 

In addition to in-depth information and background on every aspect of the deck, this guidebook also includes a two-page discussion for each card, instructions on how to do readings, a brief history of the Tarot, and a selection of spreads designed specifically for the Outsider Tarot.

SILVER FOIL:  The drawing & white pattern on the front cover and the the Wheel diagram on the back cover will be in Silver foil!

Image of the actual guidebook

 

 

The deck, gudiebook and reading cloth have been printed. Indiegogo backers can expect to receive their perks by OCTOBER/NOVEMBER 2021. Please see the updates!

 

 

Add on for $15

 

The 22x22 inch 100% eco-friendly natural cotton USA-made reading cloth will be screen printed with a design that I created specifically for readings with the Outsider Tarot.  As an all natural material, it is also excellent for wrapping and storing the deck.

FEATURES:

Emblematic shields of the four suits and elements in each corner

Concentric radiant circles form a protective reading space within

Astrological glyphs of the zodiac signs and major planets

North and South node glyphs evoke our spiritual journeys

An original drawing at the center blends symbols of the four suits and elements 

ADD ON THE READING CLOTH FOR $15

 

Shipping is $12 for US, $26 for Canada & $36 for the rest of the world.

** INTERNATIONAL CUSTOMS, DUTIES, TAXES (CDT) are not included in the shipping price. CDTs and VATs are the responsibility of the backer.

 

 

I'm offering four original drawings from the Outsider Tarot for $200 that includes the deck.  Please contact me to indicate which one you want to reserve. First come, first serve.

 

Original Drawing #1: The 8 of Eyes

 

 

Original Drawing #2: The Root of Lights, Shirley Chisholm

 

 

Original Drawing #3: The Spark of Lights

 

 

Original Drawing #4: The 2 of Bottles

 

CREDITS & SPECIAL THANKS:

 Music Track from Video:

Anni Rossi

www.annirossi.com

 Guidebook Layout: 

Kelley Simons

 Consultation & Guidance: 

Amanda Bell from Indie Deck Review 

 Proofing: 

Whitney Van Nes

Bottles offer a container that gives shape to everything that begins formless, like consciousness, intuition, emotions, knowledge and memories. By giving these matters temporary form in the suit of Bottles, we are able to contemplate their complexity, significance and power. This is the suit of love, nurturing, incubation and meditation. **Includes two versions of the 2 of Bottles.  The SUIT of EYES is where we have an opportunity to connect to our soul, the spirit that animates us, in the element of air.  In the suit of Eyes, we interact with others, with society, in person or virtually. These interactions can be as calm as a breeze or as forceful as a tornado.  The suit of Eyes is where we learn that seeing isn’t always believing. This is where we get out our tools, and we make our ideas into reality. The suit of Eyes is where we fight for our ideas, for justice and for equality.  This is the suit of wisdom and clarity.  The SUIT of ROSES  is where we deepen our connection to the natural world in the element of earth.  When there is little connection to or interest in nature, there will always be more attachment to the material plane. The suit of Roses lets us know when this axis is out of whack, when material concerns and labor dampen our spirits and our ability to enjoy what’s right in front of us.  This is also the suit where we complete and release our creations into the world.   The Outsider Tarot has evicted the King, Queen, Knight and Page and invited a lovely band of eccentrics known as the ELEMENTALS to take their place.  Each Elemental embodies one of the four elements of fire, air, water and earth, bringing all those properties into its suit.   TO SPARK A FIRE:  Sparks embody the element of FIRE — child-like figures at the beginning of a new journey.  Sparks replace Pages.  A BILLOW OF AIR:  Billows characterize the element of Air — young adults in the early stages of life and exploration. Billows replace Knights.** INCLUDES SPECIAL EDITION VERSION OF BILLOW OF BOTTLES: BRITNEY!   TO FATHOM THE WATER:  Fathoms personify the element of Water —  masters who possess the deepest understanding of their suit’s power. Fathoms replace Queens.  TAKE ROOT IN EARTH:  Roots are the element of Earth —  teachers, mentors and sages offering us wisdom and valuable life lessons in each of the four suits.  Roots replace Kings. The 225  page guidebook is the essential guide to the symbolism, meanings and framework of the Outsider Tarot. Reinterpreting every single card, the Outsider Tarot marries ancient esoteric systems with the colorful and revolutionary spirit of Outsiders past and present.  In addition to in-depth information and background on every aspect of the deck, this guidebook also includes a two-page discussion for each card, instructions on how to do readings, a brief history of the Tarot, and a selection of spreads designed specifically for the Outsider Tarot.SILVER FOIL:  The drawing & white pattern on the front cover and the the Wheel diagram on the back cover will be in Silver foil!Image of the actual guidebook  The deck, gudiebook and reading cloth have been printed. Indiegogo backers can expect to receive their perks by OCTOBER/NOVEMBER 2021. Please see the updates!  Add on for $15 The 22x22 inch 100% eco-friendly natural cotton USA-made reading cloth will be screen printed with a design that I created specifically for readings with the Outsider Tarot.  As an all natural material, it is also excellent for wrapping and storing the deck.FEATURES:Emblematic shields of the four suits and elements in each cornerConcentric radiant circles form a protective reading space withinAstrological glyphs of the zodiac signs and major planetsNorth and South node glyphs evoke our spiritual journeysAn original drawing at the center blends symbols of the four suits and elements ADD ON THE READING CLOTH FOR $15 Shipping is $12 for US, $26 for Canada & $36 for the rest of the world.** INTERNATIONAL CUSTOMS, DUTIES, TAXES (CDT) are not included in the shipping price. CDTs and VATs are the responsibility of the backer.  I'm offering four original drawings from the Outsider Tarot for $200 that includes the deck.  Please contact me to indicate which one you want to reserve. First come, first serve. Original Drawing #1: The 8 of Eyes  Original Drawing #2: The Root of Lights, Shirley Chisholm  Original Drawing #3: The Spark of Lights  Original Drawing #4: The 2 of Bottles CREDITS & SPECIAL THANKS: Music Track from Video:Anni Rossiwww.annirossi.com Guidebook Layout: Kelley Simons Consultation & Guidance: Amanda Bell from Indie Deck Review  Proofing: Whitney Van Nes

story:
WHO AM I

Hi, I’m Amina Harper and I’m a black, queer, visual artist who has been working professionally for almost 10 years. It’s been quite a journey and I’m currently entering into a new phase of that journey by introducing myself to new mediums, such as acrylic painting and digital design. I began my career in December of 2009, my work was very cartoon-like in style and I was known for drawing pin-ups. I was showing in galleries locally and nationally, and in 2011 I began participating in 2 exhibitions a month. Though I enjoyed the style and methods of the work I was creating, in 2012 I began to feel as though my style was trapping me and preventing me from moving forward, so I started experimenting. During this time my work was imbalanced and detached; I was lost and insecure in my abilities, but I continued trying new things and eventually, in late 2013, I rediscovered gouache and watercolor painting and realized that I could achieve the same vibrant color and crisp detail I loved by melding water based paint with color pencil, a medium I was extremely familiar with. I sort of stumbled upon gouache and watercolor by accident, and even though I became good at it, I eventually found it limiting. Now, that I’m adding acrylic painting to my skill set, I’ve realized that the more artistic tools I have at my disposal the more prolific and long lasting my career will be.

 

If you would like to learn more about me, check out my website

 https://aminaharper.wixsite.com/aminaharper

 

WHAT I’M DOING

I’m trying to take my career to the next level, not just for financial reasons, but for the sake of better connecting to those who are interested in my work and may want to utilize it in a wider variety of spaces. A big part of that is getting new equipment to make clean, crisp, and well rendered design work for logos, band tees and album covers, posters, flyers and any other kinds of advertising.

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

If I reach or exceed my goal, anyone who donates $20 or more will get one FREE design for any project of their choosing. I’ll keep track of all of your names to make sure that you qualify for this incentive that, not only gives you something tangible in return, but simultaneously helps me build my design portfolio. As a designer starting out it is imperative that  my community benefits from my new creative journey. If you aren’t able to donate, please share this page on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or any of your social media platforms.

 

WHERE YOUR DONATION GOES

Ipad pro -  $1,149.00

Ipad cover - $40.00

Procreate app - $30.00

Stylus pen - $129.00

story:
1.About me

Good day.

 I am GashibokA. I'm an old fan of Mlp:fim, and I have a cartoon called Recall the Time of No Return.

Now I returned with renewed card set.

 

2. About Everfree Tarot

<Everfree Tarot> is designed to satisfy both fans of traditional TV shows and tarot card collectors. So it was similar to the style of the TV show, but I added artistry by painting a little more antique. In addition, I took the concept of 'Unknown History' and put a completely new story on each card. This story is not an official history, but if you like conspiracy theories, you can enjoy new fun by reading the enclosed guidebooklet.

 

3. Is this a Official stories?

Absolutely no. just look at the Devil card. This is inadequate to become an official story.

 

4. there is so many races. why?

Policy Correctness? hah. kindding. I wanted to say that Equestria is not for ponies only. There are many tribes living in this land, each with its own story. It will make the world view more abundant.

 

4. I want to know the specifications of the thing.

​

70mm * 120mm

mpc card paper 330g/㎡

full color (CMYK)

 

5. what is the booklet?

If you visit my Deviatart site and see the card image, you will find that there is a sentence written in Korean under it. In the booklet, the Korean Description will be supplemented and translated with the image. It is essential for those who use this card for psychic purposes.

 

6. Did you consider making it include Main 6?

yes I was.

 but Hasbro is a copyright monster. I scared.... 

 

7. Funding Goal is too small to making it. Why?

because I already made it all.

I printed 100 set of cards and books. you can get it immediately 

 

8.what's different between previous version?

  • rebelanced color
  • out frame renew
  • overhauled backside

story:
Thank You!

 

Thank you everyone who supported this campaign with donations, helping to spread the word and providing messages of encouragement. I have been heartened by everyone's interest in this project and their well wishes.

 

THE THREE ERZULIES / GHETTO BIENNALE INFO KIT [pdf]

For more information about the Ghetto Biennale, its impact on the local community, the complete list of projects for the 2011 instalment or for more information on me, please download my info kit [pdf].

 

GHETTO BIENNALE WEB SITE

GhettoBiennale.com

You can also view photos from the biennale on my Facebook page.

 

RELEVANT LINKS & VIDEOS

READ: "Magalie Marcelin" by Beverly Bell

The Artists of Grand Rue, After the Quake by Georgia Popplewell (6 mins)

Happier Times, Ghetto Biennale (Two Weeks Before the Quake) by Emily Troutman (5 mins)

Atis-Rezistans: The Sculptors of Grand Rue by Leah Gordon (35 mins)

TeleGeto 1 by Alex Louis, TeleGhetto (10 mins)

Milord and Ti Kay Rezistans: Une jeune et un grand artiste by Alex Louis, TeleGhetto (6 mins)

story:
Our Next Adventure

Five Ton Crane needs your help to build its next project: Storied Haven.

It is a large scale, immersive sculpture rooted in storytelling that will debut at Burning Man 2015 and continue onward thereafter.

She is the keeper of stories, holder of memories, steward of dreams. In a fairytale world where animals talk and children shouldn’t wander the woods at night, an enchanted home inside of a grand boot lures us. It beckons to wayward passersby with a promise of fantastical delight and dark mystery.

Join us and be part of Five Ton Crane’s exciting new chapter.


What We Need & What You Get

We have received a generous honorarium grant from Burning Man, however we are less than 50% funded.  All proceeds from this campaign will go directly towards purchasing supplies and materials such as wood, steel, resin, fiberglass and much more! All labor on this project is volunteered time.

We have an exciting selection of perks including the usual suspects such as patches, t-shirts and more.  In addition we have several unique art pieces created by crew members of Five Ton Crane and an intimate viewing of the project in process.  Donors at every level will be the only people to get an inside look at the build process through photo updates.

We are already moving forward full speed ahead. This campaign is not the only fundraising we are seeking, however it is a very important component. A successful campaign will help make this project spectacular and rich with detail as you have come to expect with Five Ton Crane.
Please become a part of this story!

Who is 5 Ton Crane?

Five Ton Crane (5TC) is a diverse group of artists, geeks and inventors from the Oakland Bay Area. The name implies the intention: 5TC does the heavy lifting that the individual artist couldn’t do on their own; by pooling resources, interests and talent to create opportunities for bigger, better and bolder Art. For over ten years, we’ve been building large-scale artwork in Oakland, California. From the Steampunk Treehouse, to the Raygun Gothic Rocketship to the Nautilus Submarine Art Car, Five Ton Crane has the skills and expertise to get the job done.

Nautilus Submarine Art Car

A land-based submarine weighing in at 11,000 pounds (dry) with a top speed of 13 mph. The base vehicle is a 2005 Eagle TT8 diesel AWD airport tow tractor, designed to tow 90,000 lbs airplanes. 25′ long, 100″ wide, 11′6″ tall

http://fivetoncrane.org/projects/the-nautilus/

Raygun Gothic Rocketship
A rococo retro-futurist future-rustic vernacular between yesterday’s tomorrow and the future that never was, a critical kitsch somewhere between The Moons of Mongo & Manga Nouveau.

http://fivetoncrane.org/projects/the-raygun-gothic-rocketship-2/


Project Risks

Five Ton Crane has over a decade of experience designing, building, and transporting large pieces of artwork. We have already have taken care of many of the key risks.
  • Facility to build the project - check
  • Structural engineering - check
  • Team assembled - check
  • Logistics for transportation - check
Building a project of this scale takes many people doing many things. While we expect that we will run into problems along the way, with your help, we can overcome them!

story:
Nice to Meet You!

We are Nicollette Bovat and Tyler Murphy, curators & managers of the Godine Gallery at Massachusetts College of Art and Design. About a year ago, we applied for this position with a vision to push the boundaries of traditional curatorial practices and maximize student interest and involvement in the gallery setting as a place to present ideas and work. We continue to question and explore this form and the dynamic relationship between artist and curator. What we have discovered is truely life altering and has affected the way that we view art and the world.

Take Care is magazine that will act as a catalog and forum for the Godine Family Gallery '12/'13 which will be “curated” by us. We want to highlight events and shows, and also student and visiting artists, such as The Jogging. We are incorporating articles and interviews with professional curators and artists that we have worked with. Our main goal is for the Godine Family Gallery managers, present and future, to publish an annual magazine that focuses on art and curating, both in and outside of MassArt. The magazine will be printed by Blurb publishing company and will be of very high quality. 

The Godine Gallery has become a venue to generate ideas, provoke discussion, and turn visions into reality. After working with our fellow students, their work, and hearing the MassArt community’s  feedback on our efforts, we decided that we had reached the bar that we set for ourselves from the start. WIth your help, it is time to take it to the next level. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $800 to go towards printing Take Care (blurb.com) , postcards, tote bags, and other promotional items to help get the word out about this project. We hope to print a limited run of 50-100 copies to be sold at MassArt Made Store and online. After the limited copies are out, we will have available our “spin-off” zine style publication called Take Off. With your funding, our costs will be low, making the publication more accessible to MassArt students and Colleges of the Fenway. If our goal is not met, our vision for this project will not have the ability to flourish to its greatest potential. 

Please keep in mind indiegogo does take out a chunk if we do reach the goal, and a larger chunk if we do not reach the goal.

The Impact

It is crucial that we meet our goal so that we can share our experience as curators in this unique form. Everywhere we go, there are magazines for artists, showcasing their work. It is imperative that as curators, our work gets seen too. How else will people realize how fun and exciting curating really is?

Take Care

In so many ways, we are helped every day by those around us with gallery chores, shows, openings, and other events. This is our opportunity to give back to you and prove that our work as curators is meaningful and important.

Please share this page on facebook, tumblr, e-mail, in a phone call, or in person!

Not interested in our project? Let us help! contact: godinegallery@massart.edu

Godine Gallery >>>> https://www.facebook.com/pages/Godine-Family-Gallery/161396093935283 

Take Care >>>>https://www.facebook.com/takecarezine
