story:
*UPDATE 12/04/2013*

We successfully reached and went beyond the goal!
Many thanks to all the people who contributed and supported the project so far. More update soon!
LOVE AND FIRE





Clicca qui per andare alla versione italiana


INVERNOMUTO

We founded Invernomuto in 2003 and since then we have been working as a duo. We make works without a set format, with an emphasis on the collapse and subsequent mixture of different languages. Our research ranges from the production of single-channel videos and installations to the staging of events and site-specific projects.
www.invernomuto.info

NEGUS - Abstract

The ongoing Negus project is a series of films exploring the metaphor of the Negus and retracing the Jamaican tradition of versioning (creating multiple versions of the same song). The project involves some of the godfathers of dub music and Sound System culture.

Negus was inspired by a historical event dating from the Italian Fascist period: in the colonial era, after the conquest of Abyssinia, effigies of the last Negus of Ethiopia, Hailé Selassié I, were burnt in the square of our hometown Vernasca, a small village located between Milano and Bologna. This episode coincided with the return of one soldier from the colonial war.

Hailé Selassié I became the Black Messiah for the Rastafarian belief, which was – and still is – much diffused in Jamaica, where the Sound System culture was born in the 1950s.

This way, an event that happened a few kilometres from where we were born and raised enters in resonance with a wider cult developed in the opposite side of the planet, something that cannot pass unnoticed.

A first version of Negus, titled Negus – Duppy Conquerors, was recently realized and presented in Bologna in the occasion of Premio Furla 2013. This version summoned the Duppy Conquerors – hunters of malevolent spirits, recurrent figures in Jamaican musical tradition – to seize the square of Vernasca.

 
NEGUS - LEE "SCRATCH" PERRY

The second version of Negus will features the legendary Lee "Scratch" Perry as the master of ceremony. Born in Jamaica and living in Switzerland, Perry is a key-figure within the whole history of music – primarily, but not exclusively, dub and reggae. Lee Perry built his own personal universe of sounds, symbols and attitudes; his deep and private relationship with Rastafarian culture lead us to consider him as the best figure to involve in the project. His impressive qualities of performer play a central role in the work, freely reacting and improvising through our set in Vernasca.


WHERE DOES YOUR MONEY GO?

We are asking for money to let Lee "Scratch" Perry come to Vernasca and fulfill his requests, pay his fee and all the production and logistic costs (equipment, operator, technicians…).

The shooting is already planned for the second half of March, while this campaign will still be running. We trust our funders.

Updates regarding the shooting and the project in general will be released regularly.


ITA

INVERNOMUTO

Abbiamo fondato Invernomuto nel 2003 e da quel momento abbiamo sempre lavorato come duo. Ponendo l’accento sul collasso e la commistione di linguaggi, la nostra ricerca si concretizza in produzioni fuori formato, ricerca che si espande nella produzione di video, installazioni, nella curatela di eventi e progetti speciali.
www.invernomuto.info


NEGUS - Abstract

Negus consiste in una serie di film che esplorano la figura dell'ultimo Negus d'Etiopia, Haile Selassie I, e ripercorrono la tradizione giamaicana del versioning (creare versioni differenti della stessa canzone). Il progetto coinvolge alcuni padri della musica dub e della tradizione dei Sound System.

Negus è ispirato ad un fatto storico che risale al periodo fascista: durante l’occupazione italiana in Etiopia, un soldato ferito fu costretto a rientrare nella sua città natale, a Vernasca, un piccolo paese tra Milano e Bologna. Fu accolto da eroe, e in occasione dei festeggiamenti fu dato fuoco a un fantoccio raffigurante l’imperatore Haile Selassie I, ultimo Negus d’Etiopia, nella piazza del paese. Il racconto di questo avvenimento ha dato origine ad un'espressione del dialetto locale, secondo cui il termine “Negus” designa una persona dal ridicolo aspetto vistoso, trasandato e goffo. Haile Selassie I fu proclamato il messia nero dal culto Rastafari, nato in Giamaica negli anni ‘30.

Il fatto che questa icona fu incendiata a pochi metri soltanto dal nostro paese natìo, giustifica la volontà di rendere omaggio all’immagine del fuoco, un bruciare simbolico, fervido e sacro. Una prima versione di Negus, intitolata Negus - Duppy Conquerors, è stata recentemente realizzata e presentata alla mostra del Premio Furla 2013. In questa prima versione la piazza di Vernasca è popolata da tre Duppy Conquerors, cacciatori di fantasmi maligni nella tradizione giamaicana.


NEGUS - LEE "SCRATCH" PERRY

La seconda versione di Negus vedrà il coinvolgimento del leggendario Lee "Scratch" Perry come maestro di cerimonia. Giamaicano di nascita ma residente in Svizzera, Lee Perry è una figura controversa nella storia della musica (reggae ma non solo); il suo personale universo di suoni, simboli e umori, la sua ambigua e profonda relazione con il culto Rastafariano, ci hanno portato a considerare essenziale il suo coinvolgimento in questo progetto. La sua impressionante fisicità giocherà un ruolo fondamentale nella narrazione della vicenda che verrà sicuramente arricchita di fatti biografici e, presumibilmente, deliranti divagazioni.


COME UTILIZZEREMO I VOSTRI SOLDI?

Chiediamo aiuto per riuscire a portare Lee "Scratch" Perry a Vernasca e soddisfare le sue richieste, pagare la sua fee e tutti i costi logistici e di produzione (noleggi, operatore macchina, tecnici…)

Lo shooting è già pianificato per la seconda metà di Marzo, quando questa campagna sarà ancora in corso. Crediamo nei nostri supporter.

Update riguardanti le riprese e gli sviluppi generali del progetto verranno pubblicati periodicamente.
story_txt:
*UPDATE 12/04/2013*We successfully reached and went beyond the goal!Many thanks to all the people who contributed and supported the project so far. More update soon!LOVE AND FIRE

Clicca qui per andare alla versione italiana
INVERNOMUTO
We founded Invernomuto in 2003 and since then we have been working as a duo. We make works without a set format, with an emphasis on the collapse and subsequent mixture of different languages. Our research ranges from the production of single-channel videos and installations to the staging of events and site-specific projects.www.invernomuto.info
NEGUS - Abstract
The ongoing Negus project is a series of films exploring the metaphor of the Negus and retracing the Jamaican tradition of versioning (creating multiple versions of the same song). The project involves some of the godfathers of dub music and Sound System culture.
Negus was inspired by a historical event dating from the Italian Fascist period: in the colonial era, after the conquest of Abyssinia, effigies of the last Negus of Ethiopia, Hailé Selassié I, were burnt in the square of our hometown Vernasca, a small village located between Milano and Bologna. This episode coincided with the return of one soldier from the colonial war.
Hailé Selassié I became the Black Messiah for the Rastafarian belief, which was – and still is – much diffused in Jamaica, where the Sound System culture was born in the 1950s.
This way, an event that happened a few kilometres from where we were born and raised enters in resonance with a wider cult developed in the opposite side of the planet, something that cannot pass unnoticed.
A first version of Negus, titled Negus – Duppy Conquerors, was recently realized and presented in Bologna in the occasion of Premio Furla 2013. This version summoned the Duppy Conquerors – hunters of malevolent spirits, recurrent figures in Jamaican musical tradition – to seize the square of Vernasca.


 NEGUS - LEE "SCRATCH" PERRY

The second version of Negus will features the legendary Lee "Scratch" Perry as the master of ceremony. Born in Jamaica and living in Switzerland, Perry is a key-figure within the whole history of music – primarily, but not exclusively, dub and reggae. Lee Perry built his own personal universe of sounds, symbols and attitudes; his deep and private relationship with Rastafarian culture lead us to consider him as the best figure to involve in the project. His impressive qualities of performer play a central role in the work, freely reacting and improvising through our set in Vernasca.

WHERE DOES YOUR MONEY GO?
We are asking for money to let Lee "Scratch" Perry come to Vernasca and fulfill his requests, pay his fee and all the production and logistic costs (equipment, operator, technicians…).
The shooting is already planned for the second half of March, while this campaign will still be running. We trust our funders.
Updates regarding the shooting and the project in general will be released regularly.

ITA
INVERNOMUTO
Abbiamo fondato Invernomuto nel 2003 e da quel momento abbiamo sempre lavorato come duo. Ponendo l’accento sul collasso e la commistione di linguaggi, la nostra ricerca si concretizza in produzioni fuori formato, ricerca che si espande nella produzione di video, installazioni, nella curatela di eventi e progetti speciali.www.invernomuto.info

NEGUS - Abstract
Negus consiste in una serie di film che esplorano la figura dell'ultimo Negus d'Etiopia, Haile Selassie I, e ripercorrono la tradizione giamaicana del versioning (creare versioni differenti della stessa canzone). Negus è ispirato ad un fatto storico che risale al periodo fascista: durante l’occupazione italiana in Etiopia, un soldato ferito fu costretto a rientrare nella sua città natale, a Vernasca, un piccolo paese tra Milano e Bologna. Fu accolto da eroe, e in occasione dei festeggiamenti fu dato fuoco a un fantoccio raffigurante l’imperatore Haile Selassie I, ultimo Negus d’Etiopia, nella piazza del paese. Il racconto di questo avvenimento ha dato origine ad un'espressione del dialetto locale, secondo cui il termine “Negus” designa una persona dal ridicolo aspetto vistoso, trasandato e goffo. Haile Selassie I fu proclamato il messia nero dal culto Rastafari, nato in Giamaica negli anni ‘30.
Il fatto che questa icona fu incendiata a pochi metri soltanto dal nostro paese natìo, giustifica la volontà di rendere omaggio all’immagine del fuoco, un bruciare simbolico, fervido e sacro. Una prima versione di Negus, intitolata Negus - Duppy Conquerors, è stata recentemente realizzata e presentata alla mostra del Premio Furla 2013. In questa prima versione la piazza di Vernasca è popolata da tre Duppy Conquerors, cacciatori di fantasmi maligni nella tradizione giamaicana.

NEGUS - LEE "SCRATCH" PERRY
La seconda versione di Negus vedrà il coinvolgimento del leggendario Lee "Scratch" Perry come maestro di cerimonia. Giamaicano di nascita ma residente in Svizzera, Lee Perry è una figura controversa nella storia della musica (reggae ma non solo); il suo personale universo di suoni, simboli e umori, la sua ambigua e profonda relazione con il culto Rastafariano, ci hanno portato a considerare essenziale il suo coinvolgimento in questo progetto. story:
Here's the digs:

My name is Brian Hitselberger - I'm an artist and a professor living and working in Athens, Georgia.  Later this summer, I'm mounting an exhibition of new work, titled Counterspell, at {Poem88} gallery in Atlanta, Georgia. The show will be comprised of recent paintings and a new, site-specific installation comprised of many small elements, as well as the work of seven other artists, who I've asked to contribute to this piece. With your help, I'd like to make this project a reality. 

 

The current political climate of our country strikes me as oppressively fear-inducing. This work aims to take these fears seriously, and through a process of making and exhibition, exorcise these feelings of anxiety and isolation that are driving many of these fears to consume our thoughts and minds, and become our realities. 

 

Above: Hex. Graphite, acrylic, latex and various elements on gallery wall. 11' x 9.5'. 

 

A recent installation of mine, Hex, sought to do this exactly. In this piece, I brought together wall drawing, painting and small sculptures that acted as talismans against my own fear. Imbued with nothing other than my desire for myself and my queer-blended family to be safe, I created the piece to communicate these desires to a viewer. Although I don't believe in magic per se, I do believe in the power of symbolic gestures to articulate the intricacies of another person's lived experiences - which is in itself a form of magic. In other words, I believe in art. 

 

 

For Counterspell at {Poem88}, I'd like to revisit this earlier piece and expand upon it. I've asked seven other artists - all gay men - to contribute a small work of their own that will be incorporated into my larger, wall-based installation project. These artists are engaged in a variety of disciplines  [ceramics, painting, design, video, etc.] but have all through their work contributed to my own sense of certainty in my studio. I draw a tremendous amount of strength from their work, and I've asked them to lend me their voice in a piece of my own. In this manner, it is my intention to create a piece composed of not one voice but many, to annihilate the feelings of isolation that spring from political and ideological other-ing. 

 

Above: limited edition poetry zines I produced.  

 

Finally, to accompany this exhibition, I will also publish a small zine bringing together various writing and imagery that has been instrumental to the development of the ideas outlined here. The zine will be made available during the exhibition for a small fee. The zines will be staple-bound, black and white photocopy with spot color and screenprinted covers. 

This aspect of the project feels particularly meaningful, in that self-publishing has a long history with tackling and addressing marginalized and unusual subject matter as well as serving as a form of community-building between like-minded individuals. Additionally, the DIY ethos of zine production rings true within the larger structure of institutionalized power that is, in many ways, being critiqued by the exhibition itself. 

A project of this scale is not without expenses, and this is where I'm asking for your aid. 

What We Need // What You Get

A piece this large requires a certain amount of density, which is why I've budgeted for more  materials than I typically work with in my projects. A portion of donated funds will go towards clay, paint, sculpture supplies and the other raw components of the work itself. Additionally, installation materials (plastic sheeting, spackle, latex paint and so on) are included in the total cost. Because my studio is based in Athens and {Poem88} is based in Atlanta, I've also factored in costs for commuting back and forth between the two.

Additionally, a portion of your donations will be used  to aid in the creation, shipping, and insuring of the other artists' works who are contributing to the project. Last but not least, your contributions will fund the production and publication of the limited edition zine accompanying the exhibition itself. 

As a bighearted thank you for your support this campaign offers a range of perks in return for your contributions. Postcards, copies of the zines, and original artwork all await your generous hands should you feel so inclined to contribute. You are all so awesome for helping me realize this -- I want you to feel appreciated!

One last thing: I've set up this campaign for a certain dollar amount, but in the amount that my goal is not reached, the show will go on - I'll just have to scale back here and there (a smaller run of the zine, or a smaller version of the wall piece, etc.), so don't you worry!

Impact

In all seriousness, I feel that the arts are among the few freedoms that we truly have, and that they represent possibilities for dialogue and mutual understanding that transcend the limits of language. With your contribution, I can put this philosophy into practice in the public sphere through the work itself. Art can operate many ways within in our world, but I've always felt that among its most noble purposes was the attempt to allow a viewer to feel less lonely. Counterspell seeks to do exactly this. 

This combination of studio work and site-specific installation is right in line with my practice of the last several years. Previously, I've mounted solo exhibitions at the University of the South, the University of North Georgia-Dahlonega, and Greenville Technical College, and in each these occasions I executed a piece directly within the gallery itself. Additionally, I've created installation work for group exhibitions in galleries and museums consistently for over 10 years now. A few exhibitions I was particularly proud to have my work included in from the last several years:

  • Locus @ Mason-Scharfenstein Museum of Art in Demorest, Georgia
  • ArtFields2017  @ Jones-Carter Gallery in Lake City, South Carolina
  • Proximity @ Malone Gallery at Troy University in Troy, Alabama
  • TEASE @ ATHICA, in Athens, Georgia
  • True Colors @ Antenna Gallery in New Orleans, Louisiana
  • Transitory Identifications @ Linda Matney Gallery in Williamsburg, Virginia
  • Atlanta Print Biennial @ Barbara Archer Gallery in Atlanta, Georgia
  • Emerging Artists show @ Macon Museum of Arts and Sciences, in Macon, Georgia.

Above: Above and Inside. Graphite, Latex, cut tin on wall, Roughly 7' x 12.' 2015. 

Above: Self-Portrait, In and Out of Sleep. Relief and intaglio prints on kozo paper, graphite drawings on found book covers. 10' x 10' x 3". 2012. 

 

Your contributions, can make this exhibition a reality in Atlanta in August. Any contribution, no matter how large or small is not only welcome but hugely appreciated! However, I understand completely that not everyone is able to contribute financially, and if you are one of those people, you can still help! 

  • Share this campaign with your people on social media, and help me spread the word!
  • Come to the exhibition once it's up and open - better yet, come to the opening and say hey!
  • Contact {Poem88} or myself to get a copy of the Counterspell zine - the next best thing to making the show itself. 

For more information, please visit:

-My website

-{Poem88}'s website

Thanks so much for taking the time to check out my campaign! Your support is invaluable to me- <3 u!
